nIMde_uyZ00ZhRyv9LN52w.text: Customer service is subpar!  My spouse and I attempted to have a nice dinner for the evening.  However, to my surprise, they claim that they do not have any availability for the remainder of the evening!  Even though from what we could see, there were several empty tables.  After we walked out disappointed, we saw that we could make reservations online, and those were available.  Not only that, but when I had called the restaurant to make a reservation, they had no problem getting me a reservation (in the next 20-30 minutes).  However, walking into the restaurant in person, no reservations available.   Must be completely judgmental on the way people look.   If you are not wearing items of clothing costing over $3,000 ....you can forget about getting a seat by simply walking in.   What a snobbish little restaurant....fits well being placed in Scottsdale!

zDpEC3DsUpYs0yEa_0Sdkw.text: Went there for my birthday dinner. The service was impeccable. Server Sarah H was terrific in every way. The seafood tower was once again a dream dinner. The staff was great couldn't have been nicer. This is how a restaurant should be. Even got a box of truffles from Sara as a birthday gift and a gift card from one of the managers, perfect night.

mrtI_ckxRIzBUIU4ib2tqg.text: We celebrated our father's bday and had a delicious dinner (ask for any special seasonal menu which they don't offer if you don't ask.)  For dessert one guest ordered the lava cake. The waiter brought one out with a candle and placed it in front of Dad. We sang, he began happily eating it. When the person who ordered the cake asked if theirs was forthcoming, the waiter said - we had to have something to put a candle in, that was yours. Really?? They charged for the cake and gave Dad a box of truffles at the end of dinner as his bday comp. Not classy and rather uncomfortable. Sorry Flemings. That was not up to par.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The birthday cake that wasn&#39;t.

LDWwy3qP4R1c-w3V3bDgbQ.text: I could be a jerk and rate it 1 star worth poor service in hopes of getting some free gift cards or something but Wow wow wow wow. What an amazing meal. Amazing service and a great environment.  There was a party of 100 in the private room and our server was apologetic for the "slow" service but In fact it wasn't slow at all. It was great.  Thank u for a pleasurable experience

Xc1UHQLgHibLucC3RvNoVw.text: Flemings of Scottsdale, AZ, If I could give "0" stars I would. This in hotel restaurant and its server embarrassed 1/2 of our table of 12. While we were the ONLY table in the restaurant. Having finished our dinner and enjoying desert and cocktails our server cut off the beverages, without speaking to our host, for absolutely no reason...the only thing we can figure is the staff wanted to get off early. Needless to say, Flemings will never be in consideration for anyone in this party again.

ZhKSuRIVQabkLRGN1KfdVA.text: I'll be forthright! I'm not a fan of Fleming's 3 bad experiences in three different cities. They have redeemed themselves in this visit. Everything and I mean everything was perfect! Mashed Potatoes, Corn, Asparagus and the Ribeye was delicious and flavorful. Service was excellent!

Gapl2jFsPEVilzDmkhbf3w.text: "Super Dining Experience"  Another visit to our favorite steakhouse!  Food and service was exceptional (as usual) our server Erica F. provided wonderful advice and worked to make sure that our visit was superb (Again, as usual)  The managing partner Darrin's personal attention and genuine interest in our dining experience set this location in a class by itself.  Thank you for another memorable evening out with our friends! Sincerely,  Mike Callahan

PVbBAnXhWNYyE-coBvaNxQ.text: We just finished eating at Flemings, and it was very good. Both the steak and seafood were excellent. Great wine list too. The interior was a bit predictable and so were the deserts. Still, it is an overall good experience.

3QddQ8_YO6KDj7FFnDKH8w.text: I celebrated my birthday dinner at Flemings and our waiter was nice including the manger that evening who was so nice and pleasant.  The hospitality was outstanding.

GYBa-NjVSQfMCJysUuDURg.text: I wanted to followup my review.  The manager came to table to talk over situation and actually comp'd one of the meals ( which for me was above and beyond).  I will definitely be back and recommend to others.

0nKoufHGdrq8jQj_zKXe3A.text: This was my first trip into Fleming's. My husband and I were blown away by the service we received. Thank you Nicole and management. We had an excellent experience and the food was great!

0Q7USTW1yH1UpyAbpeY91w.text: Came to Fleming's after not visiting for many years. We have always loved coming here. Upon seating they gave us a tablet that contained the drink menu, which I think is a great idea because you get a visual of what some of their cocktails look like. After ordering they bring out their bread that comes with 2 different butters that are to die for.  The menu is what you would expect from a steakhouse, but I still enjoyed every bite. I started with the shrimp cocktail and then a filet w/ a side of bearnaise sauce. I think my favorite part was the Fleming's Potatoes, the jalapenos give it a great taste but the good news for those who aren't into spicy is that it is mild.  Finished off my meal with the carrot cake, which was by far my favorite dessert there.     The reason for our visit was to celebrate my husbands birthday, so during the meal they surprised us with a $25 gift card. Great touch as it makes you feel special and almost guarantees them that you will return to dine again. Win-win for everyone. My husbands favorite  part was at the end of our meal they gave him a box of 4 truffles to take home. He said that they were delicious, which I am assuming to be True as he wouldn't share them with me.     I would like to add that we also had our 9 month old with us and they were so friendly with him even when he did make a mess on the floor. They even came to specifically see how he was enjoying his pieces of steak, as it was his first filet ever.

asoKIB6jJDfIc8eNjiOPGw.text: Scottsdale road has just about everything including Oscar Filet at Flemmings, ohhh yea !  Talk about decadent, they were serving a special the night we were there that  included the Oscar topping for the filet. Something about jumbo lump crab meat slathered on top of a perfectly cooked steak that is...... well..... just plain awesome!   Add a side of asparagus and a wedge salad with a nice cocktail and damn if that is not the start to a kick ass evening.   As always this location on the weekends was packed including the bar area, thank goodness for reso's.  Something about this Flemming's has more je ne se qua than  the "run of the mill" Flemmings( if there is such a thing).

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Filet Oscar with seared scallops and asparagus

TiwIE08TSU9inY6NgrMD9Q.text: I would love to give a review of the food or drinks, but my husband and I never got that far. We decided tonight to try Flemmings for the first time. First off, we had a reservation for 7:45, the hostess said we are a " little bit" late on our reservation times so feel free to get drinks at the bar. Well at 8:45 we started getting pissed off along with all the other people with reservations getting sat hours after their reservation. Finally, after waiting over an hour past our time and finding out that even then we had 7 people in front of us, we just left. I thought upscale restaurants should have their acts together enough to honor your reservation time at least somewhat close...absolutely ridiculous!!

tZyyKizbVg6tiDcteGILzg.text: Eh...  We had some gift cards from Christmas, so we decided to dress up a little and check the place out.  We started out in the bar, where luckily it was HH. The bartender was so nice and down to earth and she mixed us an amazing gin concoction off their HH menu. It was potent, refreshing, not too sweet, and went down way too easy. The complimentary freshly made potato chips at the bar are scrumptious and perfect to settle your belly when drinking these strong drinks.   Dinner wasn't as great as the bar experience. My husband ordered a filet Mignon and I ordered a few sides, since I'm a vegetarian. Now, I don't mind going to a steak place as long as the side dishes are impeccable. I'm perfectly content with some delicious starches and veggies. I was looking forward to sampling their sides but our server wasn't very enthusiastic when I told him I was a vegetarian. He mentioned what he thought was good but he didn't really seem keen on selling what little they had for vegetarians. Hmmmmm...  On to the food... I had mac and cheese. It was good, not great. No comparison to the green chili mac n cheese at Roaring Fork. I had a loaded baked potato sans bacon. Again, just okay. Can't really screw that up. I did find the skin of the potato to be tasty... they salted it quite well. Had sauteed spinach too... was good. I ordered a dirty martini and it was awesome!   My husband was looking forward to his steak since he barely gets to go to steakhouses. He ordered his steak medium rare and was disappointed that it came out medium. He did not want to return it because we had to be at a show in less than an hour. He said the taste and quality was good but he could replicate it at home very easily for a fraction of the price. He had a tiny side of Fleming potatoes which was tasty but it was the exact same sauce they used for the mac n cheese. So don't order both because they taste exactly the same!  Our server was okay. Kind of cold and I felt like he was disappointed that we didn't order more expensive items. I did like that the manager stopped and said "hi". I told him I was a vegetarian and he recommended the ravioli appetizer. It sounded delicious. He was very lively and personable. Wish he was our server...  Atmosphere was weird... I expected it to be dark and hyper masculine, after all it is a steak house, but the wood paneling and extreme darkness was unnerving. With that setting you would expect the background music to be jazz or some Sinatra or something wouldn't you? Nope. They were playing top 40 from the last 2 decades. Kind of weird to be listening to U2 while eating steak and drinking dirty martinis.  Overall, I don't think the experience was worth the money. Each side dish was $10. Most of the steaks don't come with sides and they are well over $30. Luckily we had gift cards, but otherwise our bill came out to $105. For under $20 I could have made the same meal and probably make it taste much better.   We did have an excellent experience at the bar. My husband was drooling over the bar burger the person next to us was having. I am open to trying HH there again.

_j9VkMYHTEql3Ake4f4kVQ.text: NOTE:  THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE DC LOCATION....NOT THE SCOTTSDALE RD. LOCATION.....THE MANAGER FOR THIS LOCATION WAS GOOD ENOUGH TO CALL ME & WAS VERY CONCERNED, WHICH WAS NICE.  Terrible Happy Hour yesterday at Flemings.  We should have known it wouldn't be good when my husband ordered a Manhattan "up" and it was served in a champagne glass!  Did the bartender take Bartending 101?  The waiter asks "what kind of garnish would you like in your Manhattans.....an orange peel?" Ok, whatever.  Look at the picture of the calamari appetizer...we've had it before...really good sauce on it.  Ours was totally dry with NO SAUCE whatsoever....a few pepper slices thrown on it.  Then we got the burger and fries (Happy Hour), which also in the past has been very good.  Not this time!  The kicker was that they ripped us off with our gift card.  I gave them a $50 gift card that has never been used....THEY INFORMED US THAT IT ONLY HAD $30 ON IT!!!  Really???!!!  Course, how can we prove it?!  Never going back!  Glad my gift cards are finished!!  No more!!  No wonder the Happy Hour wasn't totally crowded like in the past!!!

yOMcP7tgpPBJO22RKjqe4Q.text: Great steak.  Had bone in filet Oscar.  My husband had dry aged ribeye  Best ever.  Service good.  Great night out in DC Scottsdale.

wQkcxloTqEfg6npVCtPaMw.text: I was in the mood for great food and great service so I picked one of the most expensive restuarants in the area.  I can say I went to a steakhouse with good food, but there wasn't anything exceptionally great about Flemmings. If I was going to compare Flemmings to another restuarant it would be Oscars Steakhouse in Downtown Las Vegas with that "Beef, Booze, and Broads" feel.  Good steak, good drinks and even a waitress pumped full of botox.   The food we tried included the calamari appetizer, wedge salad, swordfish, filet, crab, and asparagus side.  Everything was cooked as it should have been but again nothing that really made you say WOW after that first bite! They did have a great wine list with 100+ wines by the glass.    Our service was excellent and everything was timed perfectly and our waitstaff was very attentive and ensured we had all we needed throughout the meal, including beverages.    I may find myself back in Flemning but it will not be one of my top choices in the future.

H7T-s5BIZcE4y_uIdbsqTQ.text: My husband and I have been to flemings a few times, The last time we were there the food was very expensive and of poor taste.Also we noticed that some of the bar tenders that worked there was very professional and of good manners.,and no longer there, Flemmings what are you thinking firing the ones that works the hardest for you to make you who you are today I see that in the future you will no longer be in business by treating customers, and the help the way you do, shame on you, I have told all my friends and several others to boycott you, because you guys don't treat people or help the way they should be treated. My own feelings are you should not be in business with the public. I hope other people read this and think again about spending money in your establishment.

lU8u-j-oT-_K7c8T1jOgSA.text: I don't know what has happened at Flemings tonight, but the place was  totally falling apart. Tough prime rib, lousy service, and people running all over the place trying to get it together...not a good experience at all. We waited for someone to come to our table to get our dessert selections, drink refills and our check for about 50 minutes. I don't know what was going on, but I doubt we'll be back anytime soon...

y4alUq8rE6fN7nM92HRyVQ.text: Very nice happy hour.  I sit at the bar and try various appetizers, paired with a Syrah or Malbec.  I loved the Caesar salad, ravioli and the seared tuna.  The steak is very good, but not the best I've had.    Staff provides excellent service and remembers repeat customers.

HeBkR7kwusTBhgPgeJ-9Qg.text: Flemings is, for me, just about as good as a steak house gets.  Warm, inviting and not pretentious.  If I had to pick nits (and I do) I would just say the service can be breathtakingly fast - so if you're going to linger over martini's, make sure your waiter knows not to fire your order until you're ready.  Oh yeah, the martinis are large, cold and good.  Otherwise the service is top notch.  I really like a place where waiters are trained to observe every table, not just their own.  When we needed something, as soon as we looked around for our waiter, another waiter noticed and came over immediately to assist.  As soon as we were done with one course a passing waiter picked up the dishes, checked on our experience so far and asked if there was anything else they could do. That makes for a great dining experience.  The Porcini rubbed tenderloin in gorgonzola sauce was great.  Ask for extra sauce on the side and you'll get some chunks of gorgonzola in it.  The added texture really helps the sauce.   The scallops in lobster cream sauce were equally good.  Slightly crisp outside, sweet on the inside, perfectly complemented by the lobster cream sauce.  The vegetables served with the scallops were perfectly done.  The mushroom ravioli is a must-get.  We always share it, it could easily be a perfect light entree for one.  The atmosphere is dark (as a steak house should be) but not too dark.  There is none of the pretentiousness of some other houses and the staff are willing to accommodate almost any request.  Thanks Nick!   5 stars!

hIARrjpAodyW-Czyl2WHog.text: To put it in one line Fleming's is a 3-star restaurant posing as a 5-star restaurant.  The issue for me at my visit to Flemings was service.  The hostess was rather unenthusiastic.  It seemed was just her job to point us in the correct direction, which was the bar to wait as our table got prepared.  For a 5-star place, a reservation is a reservation, and the table should darned well be ready when advertised.  I expect to wait for a table at Outback, with the little buzzing and flashing beeper, but Flemings isn't Outback.  Right?  And as I will state later, getting the food orders correct was an even larger issue.  For background, I was part of a large group (11 people) for dinner.  The bread served before the meal was absolutely delicious; fresh, hot, with a crispy crust, tender middle.  Drinks and salads were ordered.  I got a Caesar salad, and all I can say is that it was adequate. I have had a better Caesar salad at my employer's cafeteria.  But, I'm not there for the salad.  Fleming's is all about steaks.    The server moved around the table and took orders.  Our server was cheery and tried to make small-talk conversation with the table.  She took the orders where overall there were 8 steak orders (some of the couples got one meal and split it) and various sides.  I ordered the prime rib-eye; whenever I go to a steak place, it is my benchmark meal.  When the food arrived I had a very nice, although I would call it a bit small piece of Filet Mignon in front of me.  A very nice cut of meat, but it wasn't what I ordered.  Also, one of the couples at the table was not brought any food.  So, doing the math, the serving staff has a 25% chance in bungling your order.  The staff re-took the incorrect/missing orders and about 5 minutes later the manager was by to apologize.  The couple who had the missing order was offered a shrimp cocktail; I was not.  Maybe that is why I'm the odd person at the table.  I started munching on the community sides watching my other friends enjoying their steaks.  As for the sides, they were adequate like the Caesar salad; nothing to see here; although the Fleming potatoes were better than average.  About 15 minutes later, my steak arrived, a bit rare for medium rare.  Gee that would make it rare.  I was hungry, and I ate it anyway.  The steak was very nice.  Tender and tasty, the way a good rib-eye ought to be.  To be honest it was one of the best rib-eyes I ever had, although slightly undercooked.  Much more tender than ones in those cowboy steak places.  There is something about the flavor of fat from a good rib-eye, and that is why it is my benchmark steak.  I was not alone on the notion under-cooked nature of the steak.  I guess from a management standpoint, undercooked is better than overcooked.  But I am of the school nothing goes back unless I am always within eyesight of my food.  I've seen the movie "Waiting".    We got desserts, and did them community style.  The walnut turtle pie seemed to be the best liked.  I didn't do the walnut turtle pie.  Walnuts are a bit bitter for my tastes.  The timing for delivery of food was a bit slow.  This was "European" dining.  Reservation at 6:30, offered dessert 9:30.  So, in a way we owned the table for the evening, or maybe the staff realized they were not going to turn the table for another customer, and with a large group tip was set, so there was no need to hustle for the tip.  Slow service is fine, if that is what you expect.  Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed chatting with my other friends at the table, but this was not typical "American" dining service.  On the good side, the water glasses were filled with great regularity.  Water glasses were 12 oz glasses, and these glasses never got below half full.  Service from the bar was not as good.  I ordered a glass of Shiraz before the salad, and the glass arrived after the salad.  So, about 20 minutes to get my glass of house Shiraz.  With respect to the food errors, the manager did deduct the two meal errors from the bill, and that was very generous from Fleming's management.  But mistakes like this will crush high end places.  From a profit perspective, that's $80 that Flemings management isn't going to get, and a not so stellar review on Yelp. So for me, I give Flemings a 4-star for food, 3-star for service, and a 2-star for value.  As for me, I'm not a high end restaurant guy, but from the small amount of travel I do for the company I work for, I have seen some higher end restaurants.  I was expecting penultimate experience, and I received an Outback level service experience.    Ultimately, the question is: "Did you get what you paid for"?  For my money, it is a resounding no.  But Flemings is in the business to appease business types with expense reports and such.  It is sufficiently snooty enough to impress your customer, so the corporate sales guy can give the impression to his customers that the company he represents "cares".

dSrqag_KMs_jzFe2YvQU1A.text: My wife and I visited Flemings on Monday July 16, 2012 for happy hour 5p to 7p.  We enjoyed the $6 happy hour menu sitting at the bar starting with tenderloin carpaccio , sweet chile calamari , shrimp cocktail, all were worth the $6 each.  Although we had the sweet chile sauce on the side for the calamari very good appetizers shrimp good flavor cooked in house.  My wife for main course had the lamb chops with fried polenta served with it she really liked this dish the chops were the size of lolli pops three pieces but very very good.  I had the in house made $6 prime 8oz burger cooked rare with swiss and cheddar cheeses bacon on a nice brioche bun it was cooked rare and tasted very good.  Also served with this burger was two large fried onion rings , slice of iceburg lettuce and slice of tomato.  Along with a few beers for me my wife had the in house made sangria it was not worth th $8 price.  The bartender was very detail minded friendly great service !   We will be back for dinner next time. Enjoy.

x3lxyR8LX2pxKf0MImWq0Q.text: We had the most wonderful Thanksgiving dinner at Flemings in Scottsdale today. Great service and fantastic selection of food, something to please everyone. Their prime rib is always the best!!!

HAG6msbi4Y124JSTCzpq0g.text: Service was sub-par. Had to ask multiple times for iced tea refill, little to no ice, filet for one guest overcooked, ordered bearnaise sauce that never arrived however server was very pleasant when he stopped by. Table was small, chairs encourage one to wrap it up. 13 year old asked me if server didn't like us, I explained unless you've been rude or demanding it is often not personal and is more a reflection of training and a desire to provide good service. A disappointing discussion to have at dinner table. We won't return.

nol9kq6gotFJzOHaxeMz5A.text: Formerly my favorite special-night-out spot, Fleming's has disappointed as of late.  Had to send back overlooked, dry halibut last time and this time some very disappointing fleming's potatoes and prime rib.  The food is still acceptable overall, but for the price, I expect more.  Sorry Fleming's, I'll have to move on.

z5_sJBxH6sPueUxAfrX7cQ.text: Found a hair in my entree. Notified waiter who didn't say too much, quiet apology.  Later manager came over as usual to see how everything was. He didn't mention anything, no apologies...nada. Didn't take it off the bill either.   Not classy way to handle. Food was good

rEnLnskdhYjttrtPpMY6Zw.text: Best happy hour ever! Awesome prices for delicious food. We keep telling our friends about it, but I kind of want to keep it on the down low for as long as possible! We LOVE coming here!

JN1nErVqOaobrwUk_-vhBw.text: I had only been to Flemings once for their fabulous happy hour.  I decided to go for my birthday.  I ordered the "wrong" thing and they quickly turned what could have been a disappointing situation into a reason to come back.  Nice atmosphere, great service, excellent food.  Yes - a little pricey - but quality costs.  Will be returning!

48NAVKiPQKFhbqG6cRXVHA.text: Went here for our anniversary.  Pretty much what you would expect from an upper end steak house.  Yes, it's pricey.  Steaks were good and service was attentive.  A good place to celebrate.

VkIbz02iIbMhCuWHxvNJ5Q.text: LOVE the patio for happy hour!  My entire office goes once a month.  It's a bit more casual, quiet, and intimate than the main restaurant.  I've never eaten inside, but by the looks of it, I would really enjoy that , too.  All the drinks are great!  I've had the carpaccio a few times and I'm never disappointed.  Most usually get a burger.

gEipqZi-ct_iYhAip7EyCA.text: After extensive analysis, and I do mean extensive, our happy hour research team has determined that Flemings has the best happy hour bar food. I mean, the drinks are fine but where else can you get carpaccio, ahi, crab cakes or a very good burger for $6? Seriously.

8bT2oAOpO4VJzHRTJONgCg.text: I don't know if it was the fact I consumed too much vodka before the nights dinner, but my NY strip steak was one of the best I've ever had. It was just seasoned on the outside and was juicy on the inside . Why not a 5 star, well, I'm not sure if it was the alcohol doing the tasting.

KztQKqxSPWy927U8vyu3QA.text: I've dined here several times and each time have left satisfied and impressed. It's what you would expect from an upscale steakhouse, with a more "modern" decor and ambiance. What you can expect is excellently prepared traditional fare of a la carte items such as aged cuts, wedge salad, lobster bisque, blue cheese mashed potatoes, steamed asparagus, and creamed spinach.  Compared with Mortons and Ruth's Chris, I would pick Flemings. The service is always top notch without a bit of snootiness.  This is the only place I have been offered a BLACK cloth napkin as to not impart white fuzz onto my black skirt . I think Flemings has got their act together. I will be going to Capital Grille later this month on a business meeting so I will see if they  can top Flemings - I think they've got a good running, judging from the menu I've seen. I'll report back!

7tgOJRFjv1yLHE6QbXcgDw.text: Went because of their $50 gift coupon.  The two for $99 filet and lobster tail special with sides and dessert was perfect.  Not Caesar salad fans but this one was tasty and the fresh bread was a nice start.  Fresh margaritas were made just right.  Leftover dessert came home with us. Will definitely return for their attention to detail.

aH9-YNSuol0iMqGhpYbS7g.text: I went to this restaurant for happy hour from the recommendations on yelp.  The drinks were good and the service was good as well.  The server could only seem to find one 5 for 6 menu, so it took a while to figure out what to order.  We ordered Calamari which was OK and shrimp which was fair.  The shrimp simply did not taste all that good and we left some on the plate.  Maybe it is because I am from the East Coast, but I have had better.  (Much better at Mastros. All in all it was a good value for happy hour.  Crowd was older ...very senior.  Maybe because it was Wednesday.

qSHgsrnYAzG41dh3ZMxaFw.text: WONDERFUL. This restaurant has really gotten it right. Fabulous menu, service, five stars for a job perfectly done!

8B33gRTHJtu780ioBwB2mQ.text: went for restaruant week. absolutely fantastic. the filet mijon was so moist and rich, not overly seasoned. the creme brulee was the perfect way to end my meal.  the staff are very professional and friendly.  atmosphere compliements the entire experience. i hear they have an amazing happy hour!!!

n7kCQd0ak-BuXMHd01AVoQ.text: I've only had the good fortune to dine here once with a friend, and I can't say much about it other than it was glorious.   It is everything you'd expect from a premier steakhouse: excellent high caliber beef, amazing service, great drinks, tasty desserts.   It isn't cheap but neither is the food they serve. In many respects, I prefer it to Houston's because it feels like less of a scene to me and much more about eating a drinking really high quality things.   Paul Fleming (of PF Chang's fame) does steakhouses even better than he does panasian, in my estimation, and the next big payday or birthday (hint, hint) I may opt to celebrate here.

BCyHQqQ-SbWzN8yfbio7uA.text: Just came over for HH on the patio.  First off the service was awesome.  My favorite of the four appetizers I ordered was the homemade burrata.  The prime burger is very filling and a popular choice for the night, at least one person from every table ordered one.  The calamari was soft and sweet but I think crispier may have been better.  The carpaccio was good but not as savory just creamier.   Regardless the red blend was a great pairing for the above appetizers.

3cstwZmDc-Np_YwVlt7FBw.text: The food and service are superb! This is the place to go if you are celebrating a life event or just want to be spoiled.

RJVbQSZSmJKAXvkBfslw7Q.text: Last night my husband and I had a fantastic 12 oz filet and 2 lobster tails!! We had a nice bottle of Pinot Noir and Jason Santa Maria was an excellent server!!! Such a fabulous touch to be given a box of four house made truffles!! Excellent experience!!!!

8hUcv4rWJ0tmm53DKyj3vg.text: Giving it a 4 1/2 star rating but rounding up because it was NYE.   Party of 4 of us. Had 7:45 reservations but it was NYE and it was packed as f. Didnt seat until 8:15 but we understood. It's arguably the busiest night of a restaurant year and we werent in a rush. So all good.   Our waitress was a little frazzled from the evening i feel like. She seemed out of it and wasnt checking on a table like she should have. We did notice she had some "difficult" tables (basically people complaining left and right).   The food was great though! Fresh bread was awesome. We ordered 3 steaks and the salmon. Everyone said their steak was fantastic and the gal ate her salmon faster than I could blink.   All in all - I'll take amazing food and a little drop in service over any dining experience. We'll def return

aN7HxLf3f_ggHYguNWaepg.text: Stopped into this location while on vacation.  The staff was very friendly and our food was excellent.  We plan on going back the next time we are in town.

1nOxJQ0-eEe-dq_5heDtyg.text: So Good!!  I was there on business staying at the adjacent hotel.  I'm not a meat eater by heart, but can usually find something on any menu. Even though was there as since, they were kind enough to sit me in a booth in an area off to the side.   I ordered the Caesar salad. Yum.  Wow....with the fried capers and the perfect amount of dressing and parmesan shavings.  The bread was warm and soft with two delicious butter smears!  They had a "smaller portions" entree section which I appreciate.  I ordered the short ribs over mashed potatoes and it was huge!  And very tasty. I went back the 2nd night and ordered that Ceaser salad again! And tried another entree. I highly recommend and will even stay in same hotel again next business trip to eat here.   Prices not horribly high either.

Lwbe7GmzRoxAA96PyF-fZQ.text: Service- Great! Moscow Mules- Great! Mandarian sangria- sangria are my favorite so I'm picky,  this didn't cut it, but my waiter was nice enough to see that and exchange it out for a Moscow Mule Calamari- not for me Mashed potatoes- Great! Porkchop- okay, bland in my opinion Filet mignon- very tender and moist but bland Creme brulee- okay Chocolate lace cake- okay  I've been try Flemings, but now that I have I would have to say it is somewhat overrated. There is definitely better out there. I probably also on be back, because I won't spend another , $200 + dollars on a second chance.

kTSGEd_qqFPX96EAwSayuQ.text: Well the food was delightful, it was made with love and perfection. Our experience however was rather abysmal. Our hostess who shall be named S for now seemingly didn't care whether we were there to give her the business or not. When my fiance moved to a different seat because she felt a cold coming on and didn't want to sit right under the air conditioning. The entire table was confronted with attitude and sass "are we done moving around, and changing seats" However the highlight of the evening was when my father asked for coffee, she brought over a pot of decaf and asked him if he would like decaf or regular, he said regular and she stated they're brewing a fresh pot of it and its not ready yet - "so here is the decaf for now" and poured it into his cup. It was a little humorous as to how much worse the service could possibly get, but hey let's see. I mentioned we're here to celebrate my birthday; she says "I don't think we have candles, so you might have to just make do without it"... Overall, rather eventful.

iESV_mfc9vyOXQz7LDMfhw.text: This Fleming's is our go to place for steak, especially on Monday's for the steak and lobster prix fixe special.  Steak is always prepared on point, and the lobster is properly cooked to still be tender and not tough.  Service is always great, too.  The wife and I have probably been here more than a couple of dozen times since we've been married and we keep coming back.  There was one visit that over the years that was a little problematic, but just one, and for all the many times we've been here for outstanding meals, I can forgive that.

wJC1drMRFlFJD4dfO6YWmg.text: My husband brought me here for our 10 year anniversary. It wasn't spectacular but very pleasant. The steak was perfectly cooked and the lava desert cake was delicious. The sides are additional to your $50 steak and very mediocre (hence the 4 stars) We had reservations but the place was not busy (for a Friday night) so we got seated right away. The waitress was very friendly and attentive.  If you come here, though, prepare to spend a pretty penny. It was $200+ for the two of us.
