wS8G94OLhNXN4oy7a1KjOg.text: Yeah, this place is good. I sat at the bar and had a wedge salad and a couple drinks. Service was good, not particularly friendly, just good. I would probably have ordered something else to eat but it was all so absurdly expensive that I just couldn't pull the trigger.  That doesn't happen to me often. Maybe if i was having more fun? Anyway - the salad was good, I'd do that again if i were in the area.

W_-8eD0_nofehwWM1kVZDQ.text: Flemings is my new favorite upscale steakhouse. Everything I have tried, literally everything, has been the best thing ever. Last night I took my parents here for Easter dinner. We started with the clam chowder soup, which was so creamy and chock-full of clams, we all were blown away. Next, we had wedge salads with crisp peppery bacon and the exact right amount of blue cheese.   The blue cheese dressing was a work of art.  After that came the prime rib dinner, 2 lobster tails, and filet mignon.  Everything was cooked and seasoned to perfection. Finally, we shared two desserts: the creme brulee and the lava chocolate cake. These desserts were a perfect end to the meal with the exact right level of sweetness and a fabulous dish of chantilly cream as an accompaniment.    Our server was knowledgeable and attentive without being invasive. They also take reservations which we appreciated. Flemings is a high-end restaurant, but our meal including tip was only around $250--so it didn't break the bank. We all left full and agreeing that the meal was worth the price.

O3ip5eurQJbg0xveZaB-iA.text: Let me start this review by recognizing the wonderful staff at this resturant. From the first moment you walk in until you leave, the staff is inviting,  friendly, and courteous. The dry-aged RibEye steak was cooked to perfection and was very tender. However, my host did not serve me, and there was no knife on the table to cut into this delicable slice of beef. Luckily, a passing host saw my situation and immediately came to my rescue, delivering the necessary utensil to spear this steak. The dessert was very tasty but the crust was unusually hard. I accompanied my dessert with a glass of Sambuca. I requested Sambuca black but all they had was the clear version. Traditionally this should be served with three coffee beans, but only arrived with two.  Overall, the staff and steak made up for some of these shortcomings, but this establishment is still well worth the visit. You won't be disappointed. Bon appetite!

GgrmzB1nuQMpKJyPGz9O2A.text: To qualify, this is Fleming's so it's not like eating trash at a food cart. But among the finer dining restaurants with which they compete - this one is a solid 2.   The bartender started off strong making me a water before I realized she had even noticed me. I had to ask for the Happy Hour menu that the hostess mentioned, and ended up ordering a glass of wine and a salad. 5 minutes later, wine arrived. I ordered the sliced filet and lobster off the dinner menu around that time. 20 minutes later, salad arrived. No napkin. Runner of the salad begrudgingly fetched me a napkin. About 30 minutes later (after I noticed both people sitting beside me sit down, order, and eat their meals) my entree arrived. No silverware. Bartender showed after a few minutes to offer silverware (no steak knife). Steak was over-cooked and under seasoned. Risotto was tasteless. Lobster had better flavor but was slightly over salted and WAY over-cooked. Extremely disappointing for a 1.5 hour stay running almost $100 for one person. Do not recommend, particularly in the midst of so many more appealing spots in Scottsdale...

5oEqj67IKB6SZXpHLqIlHg.text: I understand Flemings is dropping the Prime Rib dinner in May and coming up with a new concept.  They should think about why business is off.....This may be our final time of going there.  Prime rib was almost cold, the French fries were dripping in fat and were probably fried once, and then reheated by refrying.  The hamburger was cold, along with another prime rib.  The only thing that was at proper temperature was the New York Steak.  The manager apologized, but how do 3 meals come out cold when you have someone back there that is supposed to be watching that everything comes out of the kitchen properly.  This is supposed to be a high end steak house.....don't think so.  It's happened too many times before.  Staff is weak and management isn't paying close attention.  Try another place.  Am sure it will be better.

1RU5WLRsI-2tnep-WbSgTg.text: Celebrated my dad's 51st birthday here on a Sunday and it was great! We all got a little tiny taste of either sparkling or red wine, and decided to share a bottle of red (currently 1/2 off!).  Our server, Sarah, was very attentive and checked with the kitchen every time I asked for an accommodation which was absolutely wonderful! My sister and I both got the prix fix menu with the filet and either shrimp, lobster, or something else I forgot about that also came with a delicious salad and hasselback potato and a dessert. I was able to switch my dessert which was great. The potato was nothing special, it was pretty much just a baked potato. I ended up getting the creme brulee which was good, but nothing so special IMO. My sister got the original dessert in the menu stated as a salted caramel ice cream sandwich which came out kind of melted and sliding off. Honestly, the presentation was horrible but she said it was still good.   Both my parents got the prime rib dinner which also comes with a salad of your choice, prime rib, a side of your choice, and a dessert of your choice. Everything was great but the chocolate lava cakes which they are apparently known for were both overcooked and were not lava-like. It was completely cooked in the middle. I guess it was soft but nothing ran out of it. I'm surprised that they didn't get the timing on the cooking down on that one.  Overall, food and service was great! It's pretty rare, though, that a restaurant messes up desserts.. those are usually the safe options! Nothing major though and I would definitely be back.

aOGjB8GWYsBOcRTtnovpRw.text: Melissa is absolutely amazing. GREAT HAPPY HOUR!!! The volcano chocolate cake is delicious. The best bargain is Fleming's $8 Happy Hour Cheese Burger & Fries. I get the gift card from Costco which is a great price which saves some $$$. Also they give $25 gift-cards sometimes too. Great atmosphere and even better food. Fleming's is both a high end steak house for special occasions and a quick easy happy hour stop. Thank you

it714cbx4ixx86KvmxE7tQ.text: I thought that things could have been much, much better. The prices were high compared to the level of service and the quality of food. The staff were friendly but not sensitive to the needs of the customer.  I thought that some of the dishes could have been better prepared. For instance, the calamari was served drenched in sweet and sour sauce, so it got soggy very quickly. Also, the bernaise sauce was cold and not very good, and the tarragon was so strong that the sauce tasted like licorice.  It will take a lot to have me back at this restaurant. I can think of at several other restaurants that are a better value.

nXwFDicIsbmHWvlRysXbjA.text: I took my husband here for our anniversary because I had heard good things, but I wasn't impressed.  The service was great, but the steaks were only ok for the price. I spent a lot of money and I don't feel like I got the bang for the buck I was looking for.   Plus the drunk hotel guests making a stink about not being served any more alcohol...LOUDLY...went on way too long before management dealt with it. And they were still outside 45 minutes later when we left complaining to anyone that would listen.

P5fhDmooCgPgnJDSmsJQ9w.text: Amazing wine dinner last evening sponsored by Flemings.  Enjoyed the "chefs showdown", wonderful wines and meeting great people.  Thank you Seth Camp for putting together such a fun event.

cvS8gWyHiUTl2WoRN7KvsQ.text: Excellent service! Zach was an excellent waiter tonight! The food was the best! I had a great time here! Prime rib was superb!!! Love it! Love it!!!

gwdsO50Mj_fQnvxY70O3zg.text: Best happy hour burger around! Great service!

JKiAQtxuAtMZ_nc8PvjnTg.text: We recently had our wedding luncheon at Fleming's and the service/ staff was fantastic! We worked directly with Lesa.  She was very personable and helped to make the wedding planning process stress-free and easy.  She was prompt in responding to all of our emails and was very accommodating of all of our requests.  As far as the food was concerned, everything was prepared to our liking and all of our guests raved about the food which was served.  Some of the stand-out favorites were the Mac & Cheese, the Filet Mignon, and the Lamb Chops. The Fleming's staff helped to truly make our day a memorable one! We'll definitely be back for our Wedding Anniversaries!

COzZ9RjEIxVae3XPC2bgIg.text: Took another couple here for my birthday, excellent. The food was as always, wonderful, it was as loud as ever. I don't know why they can't find a way to block some of the noise from the kitchen. The manager came by twice and since it was my birthday in addition to comping dessert he also gave us a box of truffles.

93hUAA3oITwl44KzlB5mwQ.text: Great location, right next to Hilton Resort on the SEC of Scottsdale Rd. & Lincoln Dr. in Scottsdale. This location is much smaller than the other locations, and the noise level was actually too loud for me as this is a very special celebration for me and my date.  Both my date and I ordered the Bone-In Rib Eye steaks.  The steaks were very juicy and moist and it turned out perfect and it melted in your mouth.  Our waiter was Justin and he and his assistant were both very helpful answering our questions as this was our first time visiting this location.  We had to shout out loud to get our waiters' attention due to the noises surrounding our table. Once we finished with our meal, one of the manager, Tracy, stopped by our table to make sure their services meets our standard.  But overall, this was a great choice on both of our parts and we'll definitely return to this place again soon for another celebration.

9SXmnNZLhMSyQV8DV8mAUA.text: Absolutely positively the best meal I've had in a while! Loved this place! The staff was very friendly, quick to respond and catered to all our needs. I stopped by since it was connected to the Hilton hotel I was staying at and wished it was open for lunch so I could of eaten there instead of the hotel lol. First things first, the bread and specialty butters were delicious. We kept ordering more. I believe it was sourdough but the creme cheese butter with herbs was sooo good.   My coworker and I were craving salmon but the only version they had was BBQ'd. Yuck. We wanted it grilled Cajun style. The restaurant customized it and it was fantastic! The perfectly, seasoned salmon was super crispy on the outside and buttery, flaky soft in the inside. They were very generous with it as well since we each got 2 fillets. I've gone before in Boston and in Los Angeles but never tried the fish. Their steaks (Delmonico is my fav) is delectable as well.  My only regret with the visit was that we were too full, probably from all the bread, that we didn't get desert. Also, be warned that this place is very expensive and will only go back if my company pays for it again or somebody sends me a gift card haha.

_FUVZYSLPsRlKffedgtd1w.text: I'm not a big chain restaurant type of gal, but this place is top notch not only in service, but as well as quality of food. The fillet mijon was tasty, perfectly cooked (medium), and still sizzling hot on my plate. We ordered mac and cheese, potatoes au gratin, and the asparagus for sides. Again, I cannot express the 5 star quality of food this place serves. To end our evening off, we ordered the chocolate lava cake. I'm don't have a sweet tooth whatsoever, but to see the hot chocolate oozing out of the middle of the cake with vanilla bean ice cream. WOW, my taste buds were in heaven. I will be coming back to this place sooner rather than later. Get the lava cake ready for me! This time I will make room to fit it all in my tummy.

bkNZpid_iFajZhAKRKYbgQ.text: Four stars because we decided to cancel our reservation and went straight to the bar.  There were two hostesses: one was nice, courteous, the other one was rude and full with attitude toward the costumes. Really, we weren't in a mood to be greeted by her so we decided to hit the bar for HH.  Brian, the bar tender was great! He mixed good drinks, took our orders and the food were served in no time.

6scTCqAa1sn_DWJilcV-Pg.text: The best caesar salad i have ever had.  The scallops were tasty, but not as crispy as I like them.  My husband loved his steak.  The chocolate lava cake is amazing.  Instead of a little oozing chocolate, there was a lot of oozing chocolate.  And their house chantilly cream is to die for.  I could eat it alone, by the spoonful.

0Bs14vXIJNFT20IN6fYMwg.text: One of my favorite restaurants is Flemings Steakhouse.  My dad and I go here at least once a week because the food is absolutely amazing, and the service is wonderful.  Because my dad and I go here so often, we are on a first name basis with the manager, a couple of the hostesses, and two of the waiters.  The first thing I would like to point out is that the food is absolutely astonishing.  My dad usually gets the eight ounce filet mignon with chipotle macaroni and cheese.  He describes the steak as "mouth- watering" and it is outstanding.  The filet is prepared to his liking, not too pink on the inside, but not burnt at all.  The chipotle macaroni and cheese is one of his favorite sides because of the different tastes and the little spice that is added.  He says it reminds him of baked macaroni and cheese, which is his favorite food. However, I will only have a few bites of his steak once he is finished, and I usually get the Caesar salad and shrimp cocktail.  The Caesar salad is my favorite appetizer on the menu; it is not overdressed, and it is the perfect size for an appetizer.  Even though the shrimp cocktail is on the appetizer menu, I generally get this for the entree.  It is the ideal size and satisfies me.  The four large shrimp is chilled perfectly, and it is great for a smaller size entree.   Once we finish dinner, I order a couple scoops of the mixed berry sorbet, which is my personal favorite dessert on the menu.  I have always loved the mixed berry sorbet from Haagen Dazs; however, the rest of my family loves the infamous Chocolate Lava Cake.  I have heard Flemings is known for not only their steaks, but their amazing Chocolate Lava Cake.  Although I do not like chocolate, it looks to die for, and at that moment, I wish I liked chocolate. The hostesses are extremely welcoming and super sweet.  They are always asking how we are and where we would prefer to be seated.  The waiters and waitresses are incredibly polite, as well.  I love that the managers personally come to the table and ask how our meal is about ten minutes after we have received our entree. The service is always spot on and great.  The waiter we have had the most often, and we usually request to be sat in his area, is Stefan.  He is extremely nice and never messes up an order.  He is a very social person and has gotten to know my dad and I very well.  He has our orders memorized and we are in-and-out of Flemings in no more than forty- five minutes. Another fantastic aspect of the restaurant is their location.  The location of Flemings is perfect from where I live.  Flemings has two locations in Scottsdale, Pima Road and Legacy and Scottsdale Road and Lincoln; however, my dad and I usually go to the location at Scottsdale Road and Lincoln because of how much closer it is to my house.  Living down Scottsdale Road gives my dad and I more options for choosing a restaurant, yet, we choose to eat at Flemings.   This is hands down my favorite restaurant, and I would recommend it to anyone.  Although it is on the pricier and fancier side, it is fantastic for special occasions and business dinners.  The service is superb, and the waiters and waitresses are incredibly nice.

sdqXhJSYdBniZYl1YcE-Cg.text: Absolutely fantastic!! Our small business conference group were treated like kings. Food was perfect!!!!! From appetizers to Desserts. I wish all Flemings were this great. :)

_ZA1vZmgeTu1eEeQt-XP4g.text: I haven't come up with any resolutions for 2011, so I think I will resolve to give lots of unsolicited advice to friends, family, coworkers, and the public in general...and what better way to do that than Yelp!  The little lady and I decided we would start the New Year with a nice dinner (the little lady is a vegetarian BTW, and will be referred to as "LL") and due to a generous xmas gift and some vegetarian options we headed to Fleming's with visions of prime steak dancing in my head.  Fleming's boasts an impressive 100 wines by the glass, which makes for a very relaxed and user-friendly wine experience.  However, I immediately saw on the way in they don't have a single beer on tap.  Craving a Stella or microbrew or something beerish this was a bit of a bummer but no big deal.  I guess I could suffer through a bottle if I had to.  We were "greeted" by the hostess (I've had more enthusiastic greetings at McDonald's) and then she stared down at her screen to find the reservation.  There was enough of a delay I had one of those airport/hotel/rental car type moments thinking they had lost the reservation and would be turned away or asked to sit at the bar--but luckily this wasn't the case and we were promptly seated.  I started with the vodka martini (not made as specified but fine nonetheless) and LL had some prosecco concoction with elderflower liqueur (delicious).  Service was prompt and attentive, although I had a feeling our server was either brand new or a temp called in.  She didn't even know the dressings for the salad!  As for help on wine about all she could offer was the intensity of the wine increased as you went further down the list--clearly stated on the menu.  She was also unaware of what was truly vegetarian and didn't offer up any "super-secret-black-ops vegetarian options".  For those that haven't had the "pleasure" of dating a vegetarian (not vegan thank god!) most decent restaurants will modify dishes or make up something special to accommodate--so with Fleming's it looks like the mushroom ravioli was the way to go for any True entree feel....which is fine, I realize we were at a steakhouse!  LL started with the caesar salad with ranch (traditional dressing has anchovies) and I had the french onion soup.  Both were fine, nothing to write home about.  Mine was even a bit cool of all things.  Our entrees arrived in a reasonable amount of time.  I had the main filet, and our sides included the mushrooms and Fleming's potatoes.  I have to say I was disappointed in the steak.  It was the largest filet offered, but didn't seem very impressive when it came out...and was kind of in two pieces...so not the nicest looking piece of meat I've seen.  After having a few bites I also realized it was a solid medium instead of the medium rare I had requested.  In hindsight I should of sent it back, but in reality I'm just not much of a send it back type of guy.  I guess I'm more of the eat it/don't eat it and complain about it on Yelp type of guy.  To sum things up, we had a really nice dinner and the server was extremely attentive and cheerful.  It's certainly not her fault she hasn't been properly trained on the menu--although she could of just admitted as much instead of trying to wing it!  However, for $200 with tax and tip you have to at least do what you do best: serve me up a fantastic prime cut of steak and cook it how I want it!  I know I could go to Basha's right now, buy a "choice" cut, and cook it properly on my POS grill with better results.  For this I'm feeling pretty generous with the 3 stars.  Happy New Year!

9OKN9dEXI1Dfj4ZAqgwAtw.text: It was a wonderful experience here.  The service made us feel welcome and important, the atmosphere was romantic and the menu was impeccable.  I hadn't seen my boyfriend in over a month and we were really glad we made Flemming's our date night.

qEPf2hBoW8mFsDRj4PlrrQ.text: The service was EXCELLENT! No doubt!! Our waiter and water boy was so attentive, kind, and knowledgeable for all our questions.    The price was fair for the quality of food they serve. I was not impressed by the Fleming potato, but LOVED the crab cake and my Bone In Rib Eye steak.   Only down fall would be the restaurant was rather loud on the night of our visit and I felt like I was at AppleBee's/ IHop and had to raise my voice periodically to be heard by my friend who was sitting next to me.   Over all happy with the place! Will go back for special occasion or good piece of steak for sure!!!

dWkjZDjMLGWpaMS8PKIPjQ.text: I called to make some requests for an upcoming reservation. All of the requests were met and we were treated like rock stars.  Salad cold crisp and lightly dressed. Steak, spinach and potatoes all excellent   - what a delightful experience all the way around Sande s

dFaefF2ilDCwmWBjzYSbqA.text: Hard to argue with the rest.  Being a weirdo and confined to a $30 limit on my expense report, I ordered the Salmon Nocoise Salad and was pleasantly surprised to receive a nice half filet with a great assortment of veggies.  Washed it down with a nice cool Stella.    Service from the barkeep was great and the manager stopped by to say hi, even though they were a few minutes from closing.  Impressive.

fJSzl3rt0KHuMvRyWdr2KQ.text: While not having reservations on a Saturday night during the BCS Bowl games we were lucky to get a seat. In the bar area. However I had a great view of the 2 plasmas and was able to leave the sports coat in the car.  We had to wait a few moments to get a server, but once we got our server she was FANTASTIC! My wife and I have just gone thru Gastric Bypass Surgery and had a limited amount of choices to make on the menu. We both shared a bowl New England Clam Chowder. Which was THE BEST WE HAVE EVER HAD!!!! Then we ordered from the appitizer menu (Gastric Surgery has it's perks) We decided to try the Chilled Seafood Platter with Lobster,Giant Shrimp,King Crag legs, and Snow Crab. It was so fresh we barley needed any dipping sauce. We also ordered a side of grilled carrots another thumbs up! We ended up filling ourselves and had left overs to take home. Total bill came to $56.93, w Tip! We not only enjoyed the food but the atmosphere and the service. I would like to give Flemings Steak House a 2 thumbs up! Thanks for making our 17th Anniversary one we will never forget.

T7V4t2nKZKReDyzwrkOkfQ.text: Great place! Everything was set up before i even arrived. Great manager who came by to ensure everything was well

2YJojB2kQx-iVn395mhtmA.text: We went here after watching some fancy cooking show. We inquired about a certain steak that is prepared a certain and drawn out way that wasn't on the menu. WE just happened to mention this and our waiter went and asked about it, Fantastic, So thankful this was the best dinner I have had In years! Actually the best steak of my life! Love this place!! So thoughtful and amazing that they could make this work although it wasn't on the menu!! Total kudos!

7syUISn-KymzrXyjgR_12Q.text: My wife and I attended an event here last night. They set out a pretty good spread buffet style. * Bikinitini - this is their new 99 calorie drink. It was very good light and refreshing. I'm more of a regular martini guy but it never hurts to try something new. * Porcini rubbed filet mignon and peppercorn steak - both were excellent, tender, juicy and very very tasty. * Roasted mushroom ravioli - HOLY COW! This was amazing. This is only an appetizer on the menu though for some reason. I swear I had about 10 of these things. Next time I go to Flemings I'm going to get a steak on top of a bed of these raviolis. As always, the staff of Flemings was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely be back. The event we attended was through Foodies Like Us (foodieslikeus.com). It was $15 per person and well worth it for all the great food, wine and cocktails. It was a bit too crowded though. Anyway, it is a solid group of people that attend different dining events around the valley. Check it out.

3e8Y9S5yrgBfV5ytjwnu5g.text: I read some very negative reviews about Flemings at DC Ranch but I have to say my time was amazing. Yes it is a little pricey but sometimes what you pay is so worth it. Had the Filet special which was a salad, a side, filet and desert. All were fine and Molly our server was a real keeper. Maybe this location is hit and miss but for me it was a nice hit. Took my amazing cheesecake home and digging into it. Perfect way to end the night. Thank you Flemings for me you rocked it.

T0fMxRZIXEiHLmr8K-3ReA.text: We love this Fleming's location!  We have been coming to it for years and have celebrated most of our anniversaries here.  I typically get the Ribeye.  This last trip they had a dry aged ribeye and it was delicious.  My husband loves the filet and lobster tail.  He said the lobster is the best he has ever had anywhere.  We always order the Fleming's potatoes which are so delicious.  Their desserts are wonderful too.  My husband's favorite is the creme brulee and mine is the chocolate lava.  The service is always excellent!

YUN5j3xHrWdOBDR81E6ekQ.text: Went this weekend on sat night for the first time. We joined a group for a birthday dinner of total of 8 people. Waitress took everyones drink order and never asked me or my bf. Then after a while I asked a lady filling our waters that I wanted a drink and my bf wanted a beer and that we have been waiting to give our food orders. Finally got my drink but had to ask again for my bf beer. Food finally got ordered and of course im not surprised it took forever to Come out. Food surprised us all on how small it was from how the waiter explained it. Got the chefs special which I can say tasted so good but was a very small amount for the price. Lava cake was delicious! Over all the service was bad for a pricey place that that. Im giving 3 stars for how good the food was. I wouldn't recommend or go back

3yYJbtDC-sG3QAuKMSlq8Q.text: Another great Happy Hour! The selection of dishes was very nice. The calamari was delish and the burger was huge and very good. The drinks very strong- the definitely don't skimp on the alcohol just because its happy hour.   The bar area was crowded, so I would recommend getting there early for Happy Hour. Sit at the bar, you will meet some really interesting people!

LCED-AVImwSuCOp_UNbSTw.text: My fiance, friends and I had a great time this past Sunday! Everyone LOVED our waitress, very sweet and loved how cheerful and kind she was. Just saying the food/drinks was amazing, is a understatement! One of our friends even said his fillet mignon was better then Ruth Chris's. Three(including me) ordered the season sampler with 3 courses, and we all got the first course all together, but my 2nd course was missing, and one the the other waiters said the kitchen miss counted, and was going to get my order in right away. After that happened the supervisor(did not catch his name) came in to check on us, and was very nice. Pretty much everyone in our group got the lava cake dessert, but I had the carrot cake and we all shared and all ended up saying the carrot cake was the best! During dessert the supervisor came back with the truffle box with a candle, the truffle box had one missing, I went to confront the supervisor, he was very sweet and got me another box and asked if i wanted a truffle for everyone in the group, i was under the impression he was going to get a plate of truffles but came back with 5 more boxes, that was very very sweet. I could not be more impressed, even down to the host that recognized me, to the bartender that really knew how to shake a cocktail. We will be returning very soon, hungry for more!

8I4qKur69pXKE1KdJYg1hQ.text: WOW!  What an experience we had here.  Dined with friends and were all blown away by the service from start to finish.  It started with the server approaching us in the bar letting us know she would be our server once we were done with our cocktails and offering to decant some wine ahead of time.  The manager came over to introduce himself too and offered his assistance should we need it.  Once we were seated at our table the drinks kept coming all night and the service was just right, not pushy at all.  We ordered the shrimp cocktail and BBQ Shrimp for the table.  Both were outstanding and the shrimp they use are HUGE!  I ordered the larger fillet and others at the table had different cuts of meat and one person ordered the swordfish.  Everyone was very pleased with their entree.  The sides we ordered included the mac-n-cheese which was prepared with Panko breadcrumbs and toasted perfectly.  Overall an outstanding experience and we will certainly be back.

thhosUaC_01h4vrBrTT29Q.text: Not somewhere I usually go unless it is a business function or a special occasion. This was the case last Friday. I received a $40 off coupon from Am Ex and it was my wifes birthday. We got there early at 5:15 for a 5:30 reservation and were promptly seated. We were one of the first tables seated. Tommy, our waiter was attentive and explained the specials. We both got the 5 oz filet medalions (2) oscar style which was the chef's special for the evening @ $43.00. 2 sides and each a drink and the bill is $140 w tax.. Is it worth that much? You be the judge. The food, atmosphere, service and quality were all great. We enjoyed the meal and the $40 was the reason we came here. Could I go to TGIF or Outback for a similar experiance? Absolutely not.

smsTPtgwl029uUcOmvjzqA.text: I've lived in the Valley for 36 years and have been to all the major steak places.  Fleming's is the best!  I've never had a bad steak there - or bad salmon filet for that matter! And their Flemings potatoes are not to be missed--potatoes au gratin with a twist - jalapeno sauce - Yum! And the ambience is fabulous - rich woods and copper. Both elegant and intimate.

5-PCaKuL9fHsuLYA9Ukcpw.text: Noisy at happy hour, the Salt and Pepper Shrimp (on their appetizer menu) was really a shrimp tempura served with a creamy mayonnaise type sauce.  Not to my taste.  This is no reflection on their dinners which may be fine.

0NwPY5uCakrb58Lu-CScbQ.text: Wow! What service!! I stopped in right when they opened since I'm an ESTer and was ready for dinner!! The server went absolutely above and beyond, even to the point of getting me a blanket since he thought I might be cold!   The food was equally as amazing. I had the filet with garlic mashed potatoes on this visit. The steak was a smidge overdone, but still incredibly flavorful. They serve the steak here on a SUPER hot plate, a couple of high end restaurants do similar servings. It's really an acquired serving preference, so if you're not a fan skip the steak.  I'd definitely go back and definitely recommend!!

i1iEkrNPSi1xoL3W_wOEeA.text: So this is the place to go when my family and I want to dress up all fancy smancy. It's become an even greater event for the Williams clan since they have their entire menu gluten free!   I can order the exact same thing as I always do without having to suffer! WIN! As you are seated just ask for their gluten free menu and they will gladly give you the Flemings gluten free menu- an actual menu not some flimsy piece of paper. (As silly as this sounds I always feel embaressed having to order when I am thought as a spectacle) When they serve the bread and delicious champange goat cheese (ahhh so  amazing) they will gladly serve you cut veggies instead! I have never had a poor meal here trying the beautiful steaks, poultry and seafood. And for all the lovely people who can eat gluten still you must order the shoestring potatoes- they cross contaminate their friers so a no no for GF!  The service is fantastic and I have never had a bad meal here!  The creme brule and berries with cream are a must as a gluten free desert!

oxtIQ4TGjoxUAhz4q1XofQ.text: Best happy hour in town!  carpaccio and burgers are out of this world!!!  Great service which is typical of all of Flemings. Friendly, accomodating and spot on.  Always a great atmosphere whether in the dining room or the bar. Love this place!!! Scottsdale, Tucson or anywhere! You know what your going to get!

VZ28Xdb0zmj2bdgTsX0HOg.text: I used to frequent this place 7 years ago, moved away, and went back again last night. The service is still efficient and good, however the noise level in the dining area is very high. If you are looking for a quiet and relaxing meal, this is not the place.   Let's start with the good stuff. The complimentary bread comes out crusty and hot and the flavored spreads were delicious!  The burrata with heirloom tomatoes and arugula with a balsamic dressing was slightly overdressed, but amazing! The little hint of fresh mint in the dressing takes it over the top! The clam chowder was very good. We also had the molten lava cake and creme brulee, which were both good, but not exceptional.  Now to the big disappointment. We both had the rib eye steak, medium rare. The seasoning was good, but the outside wasn't crusted or charred enough. The cut of meat was hard to eat with bite after bite of gristle and too much fat. Overall, just a bad cut of meat!  We used to have a manager's special, a double bone-in rib eye for two (that they no longer have available...not to be confused with the one on the menu) that came out sizzling hot and crusty, and was to die for! They need to bring it back!  Their signature potatoes were good, but came out with the cheese already hardened and cold at the top. Tasted like it was made far in advance and dried out. When I cut into the cheese, the top separated like you'd expect with leftovers. The asparagus was very skinny and so tough I couldn't even cut through them with my steak knife. To their credit, our server was happy to replace it with green beans (which were very good).  Overall, we had a pleasant experience, but the main attraction fell short. Where's the beef?!!

1LtRWkN7AGiUjXBLy1nJHA.text: Knocked Ruth off the top of my list.  Sorry lady.  My only issue is that the size of each portion of meat is not listed on the menu.  My meat was cooked to perfection (which is my requirement), and the wait staff was personable. I am a convert. Thank you Fleming's. I am in love.

AtWQ_xr2h-Lxb-nCiJoAdA.text: This Fleming's is top notch! My boyfriend and I went on a weekend getaway and stayed at the Hilton where this Fleming's is also located. We decided to treat ourselves somewhere a little fancy, so we thought why not try this place. Mind you, this is both our first time trying Fleming's. We placed an order for the crab cake appetizer ($20 if I can recall) and ordered our main course (steak of course). We started chit chatting like normal, over heard a lady on the other table. she asked if they serve plastic utensils cuz she didn't like how metal felt with her teeth. The hostess replied, "of course! you're at Fleming's. We can get you what you want", so we saw the manager walk out and he came back with plastic utensils from the hotel. We were like, wow! So a few mins passed by and the waiter came to our table and apologized. We both looked confused as to why he apologized? He said, "I apologize that the crab cakes hasn't came out yet". We both said, "oh it's ok. Don't worry about it". He left and we both said I didn't even notice it was late. lol. A couple of mins later the manager came to our table and also apologized for the crab cakes being late. Again we said, "ohh it's ok. It's fine, no worries" and he left. We were like damn, even the manager apologized for that. Wow, how sweet. Then finally the crab cakes arrived and it was specially delivered to our table by the head chef! And yes, he too apologized! We were in awe by the excellent service!! The food was amazing. Meat was so tender and tasty and the mash potatoes were delicious. When the bill came, they complimented the crab cakes (which I forgot to mention was soooooo good! real crab meat). We both left pleased and with a memory we won't ever forget. :D

xEgfpYsFrcPIwPHlToG4Ag.text: We were *that* family that brought a cranky toddler and a picky 9 year old to a fine steak house and Fleming's survived with style and grace and an excellent sense of humor.  We enjoyed every item on their happy hour menu as well as a pile of cocktails and every single thing was absolutely delicious.  I think the happy hour here must be one of the best values ever in the history of happy hours.   Our server was funny - seemingly a little distant but in actuality totally attentive and on top of every special request we had.  Our favorite was our bus boy who had the nicest manners I've ever seen on an 18 year old.  His family should be so proud of such a great young man. Wish we lived in town, we'd be regulars.  Thanks Fleming's for allowing us to enjoy a white table cloth evening while still enjoying time with our kids!

YzbSva2MyCoDIw7GvVWIqQ.text: Food is average. For the price they demand the steak was average. Kids meal had more steak and fries than the primary entrees. Not a high end restaurant. Water served was warm. Portions too small

swRw_Qkz1LlsywPNXFKhXA.text: I am sad to say we did not have a very good experience this time. My husband and I are big advocates for Flemings but we are not so sure any more.  We visited this time to celebrate our Valentines (a little late but our job schedules don't always allow us to celebrate on the exact dates), I had made a reservation earlier in the day for 6:30 for their "Arizona room" since their dining room was booked. They assured me that it was heated with heaters and a fire but ill get to that... We arrived around 6:10 and let the host staff know we were there.. They already seemed pretty flustered and it was only 6pm.. We waited till about 6:35 ish till we were seated where the fans were all on, ppl at other tables were wearing their heavy coats, none of the heaters were on and the fire really didn't seem to help at all and I shivered the whole time only after asking our waitress if the fans could be turned off.  We waited for our server to come for about 15 min and than waited another 15 min for our drink orders... We finally got to order and waited at least 45 min to an hour before receiving our food. My husband ordered his fav, the filet and a baked potato (medium), however, what came out was almost done with no pink at all in the center and I ordered the pork chop with the mushrooms, it was just okay... Not better than what I could make on my grill at home!  The server finally came back to check on us and when my husband replied that his steak was just okay she must have mentioned it to the manager. He walked over, asked how our meal was and gave us a coupon for $25 off to use Feb18-March 28th...as well as removed the steak from our bill... We were glad they did something but sad that we were so excited to go to one of our fav more upscale restaurants only to be pretty disappointed.  We weren't sure if it is under new management or new ownership all together but I hope something happens fast or else most people will start to go to the other locations.

tzebmoI--l3liz4g8THXsA.text: The "Five for six til seven" is out of this world.  Enjoy the class of this wonderful restaurant without breaking the bank or go for a sit down dinner or brunch any other time of the day.  This place never lets you down no matter what sort of dining experience you are seeking.    The staff is great and very personalized and have a way of always making you feel special.  The deep wood bar is warm and inviting.

EatnKhbN2UFkP12UJ0cTtw.text: Courtesy of @Shwaag, I dined at Fleming's with @CaymusCabernet, @RussellOnSteak and @MarianOnWine.  I should have written this sooner, but this is my 100th review, and I wanted to reserve that spot for this.  I attended an Interactive Wine Dinner, which was an amazing event, and I highly recommend attending one.  Our evening began with an amuse of Danish Bleu Cheese and Red Onion on Flatbread. The caramelized onion contrasted with the bleu cheese was phenomenal! I think I ate about 7 of them!  This was paired with Caymus' 2008 Conundrum; a blend of Napa and central coast varietals. This was my first experience with a blended white, and I am a fan! Vanilla, melon, pear, mild acidity, really amazing.  The combination of the sweet onions, and the vanilla and citrus of the Conundrum, made for a fantastic finish. Yumm!  Out next course was an heirloom tomato salad with burrata cheese  (mozzarella), arugula, and diced beets. I'm not a fan of tomatoes by themselves, but these were delicious, hearty, and very fresh. And the spice of the arugula paired with the acid of the tomato, and the creaminess of the burrata, made for a delectable salad. I finished it off, even the beets.  This was paired with the 2007 Mer Soleil Silver Unoaked Chardonnay. Very fruity, creamy, beautiful golden wine.  Paired with the acid of the tomatoes, and the creaminess of the burrata highlights the richness of the wine wonderfully.  For the main course we were served peppercorn-crusted New York Strip with Bordelaise Sauce, Sauteed Escarole and Fingerling Potatoes. The strip was what other cuts of beef aspire to be. The preparation is what other chefs aspire to accomplish. Simplistic, subtle, yet very powerful in both mouth feel, and flavor. The escarole was topped with shaved hard-boiled egg, which was unique, and definitely changed the impact of the escarole. (I'm not particularly fond of it myself) The fingerling potatoes were perfect. The bordelaise could have been delivered in a cup and I'd have happily drank it up.  Paired with this course were two Cabernet Sauvignons; a 2000, and a 2008.  The 2008 had far too many tannins for my liking. I don't want to pucker up like I've just eaten sand and have dry mouth. The 2000 was much more mild, and was rather delicious.  Both paired wonderfully with the grilled meat, and the saltiness of the herbs on the potatoes meshed well with the reds.  For dessert we were served Berry Trifle with sour cream pundcake and amaretto mascarpone Cream. OMG. I died and went to heaven. Which I don't believe in. But almost could have.  Topped with toasted almond slivers, this dessert was pure bliss. The berries floating in the rich mascarpone, resting atop that delicious yet sinfully good pound cake.  As if that wasn't enough to knock your socks off, they paired it with a 2004 Mer Soleil Late Viognier that alone could make you think you were drinking pure sugar, with great flavor. Apricot, honey, orange, balanced acid make for a lush and long finish.  An amazing dinner and dessert, but in addition to the fantastic food, we were connected via videoconference with Chef Russell Skall; Fleming's Executive Chef, Chuck Wagner; owner of Caymus Vineyards, and Marian Jansen op de Haar; Fleming's Director of Wine. They fielded questions from several locations that were all conferenced in, making it feel a bit more personal. :)  As if all that weren't enough, one of the servers mistakenly switched my tab with another party's. That didn't really bother me, as I understand that mistakes can happen.  How it was handled made me want to reserve my 100th review for them; Mike Head, one of the Operating Partner's for the Fleming's in the Scottsdale Hilton, had introduced himself during the event, and had provided me his business card. I was expecting a deposit the night of the event, so the next morning I checked my account, which was how I noticed the disparity between my tab, and the amount my account was debited. (It was a triple digit charge) I emailed Mike, explaining the situation, and requested he contact me. Later in the day I hadn't heard from him, so I called him.  Long story less long; he was going to contact my bank and, calling as a merchant, attempt to reverse the charge. He called me back to inform me that, rather than take a chance on there being any delay in me getting my funds back, he just went ahead and took cash to my bank, and deposited it in my account.  Nobody does that. Ever.  Mike Head of Fleming's did.  He even returned my gratuity for the mistake having been made in the first place.  And after all that, they still gave me a gift card to entice me to return. Mike Head, and Fleming's of Scottsdale, epitomize what customer service should alway be about.  Thank you Fleming's, Caymus Vineyards, Chef Skall, Mike Head, and most importantly, Shwaag, for such an amazing evening.  And thanks especially to my date, for being so beautiful. :)  If you haven't been to Fleming's, do so at your earliest opportunity.

N_x-HkX_eZopM7bQXLoVKg.text: Excellent, exactly what you would expect from this brand. Not usually. Fan of chains but Fleming's gets it right

a1e7Ls-59oEltRHIAj3Ggg.text: Went there tonight for my March Birthday  Thanks go manager Chris and Julio the server  Amazing customer service!!!!!!!!

BfLjaAxjmr_Oweq8esqCIQ.text: This steakhouse is definitely pricey because it as one of the top steakhouses! However, that being said you expect the service to go along with the prices. We had 6 people that ordered the Sunday special last night and 3 of us received cold steak. In a steak restaurant of this caliber your steak should not be sitting around to the point where it comes out cold.  they took our steaks back and heated them and then the waitress and manager brought them back out. However, there was no apology, no discount, nothing. Not that we needed a discount, but al least an apology from the Manager.

DtZm8e99UxVlUAYhEZNI6w.text: Amazing quality of food. Hands down the best place we've ever eaten! Don't go here expecting to pay under $50 a plate though. We got the strawberry cocktail and the Manhatten! (Each $16 drinks and VERY well worth it! ) Manhatten was extrordinary!! Almost pure bourbon, lots of taste. Also could only finish 1/4 of it because of that lol but new fave!   My order was scallops and grits... literally melted In my mouth! Lighting and atmosphere was very pleasant. We came here after a very long day (18 hours) of delayed flights and driving. We were very impressed and cannot wait to stop here again in the future!  Appetizers were good... salads were fresh. Hubby got the grilled salmon and it was also done perfectly. Sliced right when you poked it.  Can you tell we loved it here??

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Manhatten cocktail.  If you like bourbon and scotch- this is your drink!
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. About to order drinks.
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Our appetizer of the grilled macaroni and lobster was amazing!

vnvBwz2LIxGnrCynfHMGxQ.text: Was at Flemings attending an event and even though the event had some amazing food and great wines, we were wanting something a little bit more, so we spoke to the manager (who was in the party) and told him we would like a table for 2 for dinner, and he was delighted and got us seated pretty quickly.  Once we were seated our server came by, he introduced himself and offered us a glance at the wine list, but we had to let him know that we just came from the private party were the wine was flowing, but we did order a large bottle of Acqua Panna. If God were to cry, Acqua Panna would be his tears, it's just one of my favorite bottles of water. Some great tasting bread was offered as well.  After checking out the menu I knew what I wanted. I ordered the main Filet Mignon with a steak companion of King Crab with Herb Butter topped with Caviar. We also ordering some sides, the Fleming's Potatoes & Grilled Asparagus.   Let's talk about the steak, this was definitely the star of the plate, I like my steak still pink, and this was cooked perfectly, oh and it was so smooth like butter! The king crab was the perfect side to this great steak, it picked up the flavors of the herb butter very well, and who doesn't love some caviar! This was a great steak!   The grilled asparagus was cooked just right, tender yet not too much so, can't believe I didn't like them as a child, now I can't get enough of it! The Fleming's potatoes oh they were a surprise, they are a potato au gratin style with cream, jalapenos & cheddar cheese, oh they were divine! I think potatoes should come like this all time.   We had great service, excellent dishes, l look forward to my next visit!

Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. filet mignon with king crab in herb butter topped with caviar

ZUcpGc39i6i9z-ufyCfDHg.text: WOW !!! My wife & I had our annual birthday dinner @ the Fleming's on N. Scottsdale Rd & Lincoln Dr.  What a treat !  My wife had the sea bass..delicious in every respect.....my choice: the Prime Rib Sunday Special......extra good !  We couldn't have had a nicer time, thanks to the attentive management & courteous staff. Needless to say, we'll be back....

UqccHz61KbFdMRiU8RXEhQ.text: So, at the last moment, my SO and I decided we'd eat out on Thanksgiving. One of the few places still taking reservations was Flemings on Scottsdale Rd. As with most restaurants serving on Thanksgiving, it was a complete 'feast',  prix fixe. Well, I sure hope Fleming's steak is better. The Thanksgiving 'feast' was a very prepared meal, something you expect from mediocre restaurant, diner or hotel. Portions were conservative (one small plate of mashed potatoes for the table?). The soup starter, lobster bisque was actually the highlight of the meal. The turkey was sliced thinly, two dark, three white meat. It wasn't dry but it was way too salty for my taste. Reminded me more of turkey cold-cuts rather than meat off of the bird. Desert (choice of pumpkin cheesecake or apple cobbler) was nothing special and certainly prepared well in advance of the holiday. The cobbler was a mass of broken pie crust and syrupy apple preserves. On the plus side, service was pretty good considering how packed the place was. For the cost of the meal, the margins must be huge. I've had memorable Thanksgiving meals at steak houses before and this is not one of those.

2Ep04or9W8cexULJI-JB2A.text: If you are not afraid to spend a bit to get the best steak in town, then Fleming's is the place. Great service. Exceptional food.

H5uFxw_s1pNyZiGuuYeSww.text: If I can only give 0 stars on yelp I would on this one. I can say I've been to many Fleming's before but this one in particular I had the most horrible experience ever.  Service guy (Alex) was MIA never checked on us and the food was crap and kept apologizing all night for it.   Drove with my family from Cali to Phoenix and was staying at the Hilton's next door so we decided to swing by and eat there for the night and what a mistake that was.   It started with the bread, they brought it twice and it was returned twice for being so hard and inedible. Steak was burnt, the fries were still raw and incredibly oily, the mushrooms were watery, no flavor and over cooked... nothing was right. Not sure if the chef had a brain fart or was rushing to get home that night but he definitely made it a unmemorable experience for us.  Going to Denny's would have been better.  To cap it all off they charged me $70 for the steak and a measly Caesar salad.WOW payed the bill and left extremely annoyed.    Will never go back there or to any other Fleming's ever again. I guess this chain is going down hill. Avoid avoid avoid

tWl9jsqAia5KfgEuQWZlww.text: We had a great time at Fleming's. We were there to celebrate my birthday, and started the night early for happy hour. The happy hour offerings are impressive, with the appetizers being a decent size and a nice selection of cocktails and wines. Seating is somewhat limited, so get there early.  We transitioned to the dining room, where the server was very friendly and helpful. I ordered a salad since I was a bit full from happy hour, and my husband ordered a steak. He requested it pepper crusted, and they were able to prepare it this way even though it wasn't something they offered. The dessert was delicious, and we were given handmade truffles on our way out.   Bottom Line: Great food and service. We will be back for a special occasion, or to take advantage of the great happy hour.

ApNALklqvvYetwnHGf2jNw.text: Came here to celebrate my wife's birthday.  We brought her cousin here to join us for the celebration.  We all had the same thing. We ordered the filet mignon with lobster tail three course meal.  We started with the blue crab empanada, followed by a Caesar salad.  The blue crab empanada was delicious with an incredible mixture if flavors with each bite.  The Caesar salad was fresh and tasty.  Now talk about the lobster tail and filet mignon.  I am not a big fan of lobster, but thus one was the best I ever had.  The filet was on point and cooked to perfection.  We were totally impressed by the service and the quality, tasty, meal.
