7CofUWVC_uS6qaCCLm-XpQ.text: Very romantic setting. Not as quiet as I'd like but it was happy hour. Steak wasn't done to my liking which they quickly rectified and brought me a new one. They also took it off the bill which I was shocked about. They didn't have to do that, I was very pleased with the second steak. Service is always amazing every time I go.

-5vTtmr5i9n4imC4-WWz5Q.text: Can't go wrong with the $8 Prime Burger in the bar til 7pm smothered with cheddar cheese and topped with bacon. Had it twice in less than a week it was so good and juicy. Properly cooked to my medium rare liking. Good attentive fast service. in & out in less than 40 minutes

7DQizqMa9n8Tv92e737umg.text: My husband and I dined here last night for his birthday and we were blown away! I had first dined at Fleming's over 10 years ago and wasn't a huge fan. At the time I felt that all of the other steak houses were better at that price point. It wouldn't have been my first choice for a special occasion dinner, but I had a gift card burning a hole in my pocket. We figured why not use it for this, and we were so glad that we did!  I had made a reservation online and noted that it was a birthday dinner. Fleming's went out of their way to acknowledge this, and really made the night a special evening. We were greeted by name when we were seated, asked whose birthday it was (nice touch 1) and given an ipad with an extensive wine list. It was fun choosing a bottle this way because you had a wealth of information regarding the flavors and notes of the wine. We were then served a complimentary warm Parmesan bread loaf with two delicious herb and brie butters (nice touch 2).   We decided to split the Caesar salad, wagyu NY strip with onion rings and the chipotle mac and cheese. They brought the salad out with two plates along with chilled forks (nice touch 3). I really enjoyed the fried capers and prosciutto in the salad. The wagyu NY strip was cooked perfectly to our asking of medium rare. The onion rings are some of the best I've had, super crispy and not surprising that this is their signature item. The mac and cheese was just as good and flavorful, very rich. For dessert we shared the carrot cake which was layered in cream cheese frosting and was served with fresh Chantilly whipped cream on the side (nice touch 4).  While we were dining, the manager visited our table and wished my husband a happy birthday. He then gave us a gift card for $25 to return (nice touch 5). At the end of the meal they brought out a complimentary box of chocolate truffles with a lit birthday candle (nice touch 6).  Summary of extra nice touches 1) Birthday acknowledgement 2) Complimentary fresh baked bread with delicious flavored butters 3) Chilled forks for the salad 4) Fresh whipped cream served on the side with dessert 5) $25 gift card to return 6) Complimentary box of truffles with birthday candle  I would not hesitate to return to Fleming's, especially for a special occasion. They really went above and beyond. I can't believe at one point they were my least favorite steak house and now they're one of my favorites! You can tell they made some great positive changes that sets them apart from the competitors.

Ekii1Le3ERIxfcoqyNPZEg.text: Fleming's has great steakhouse service. Attentive, friendly and gracious. Always sit at the bar and enjoy all aspects of a great happy hour or full service dinner. Highly recommend.

hWLwS5RNP8NhAL5ibzcF9A.text: Normally this is not in my range. Interestingly my friend and I found ourselves here after not being able to get a reservation at my choice. Our food choices were very well prepared. We were treated like royalty the entire time even though were were not buying the $45-60 steaks. Now I know what the bar is for a special evening I want to find another reason to come here or a similar place. And in this case the special reason was only to use up a gift certificate. :)

nJ0OVw5_aNtwSaIGWm5OuA.text: High end steak house in the Hilton Village. Expected great service and food, was not disappointed.   Had ordered the Prime Rib Special. Comes with Salad, Prime Rib and dessert. For the dessert the Chocolate Lava Cake is awesome being served hot with vanilla ice cream. When we first had it the price was $29 and now is pushing $40.  The Prime Rib is generally prepared exactly the way you request. Top quality meats with exceptional service.  We generally celebrate some occasion here so we have about 20 people which they give us a private room.  Important tip, buy the Flemings Gift cards at Costco.  $79 gets you $100 worth of food.  First class all the way, will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate Lava Cake
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Prime Rib Special

fFX5yNUMNZ_wlm_Umukv1A.text: Oh my, this place exceeded all of my expectations food wise and service wise. I was at Steak 44 earlier this week and I'd have to say I was disappointed with that place. Fleming's is my new go to. Staff was very courteous and I think we met the manager as well, very nice man. We were there celebrating a birthday and we were greeted with a card signed by the staff and a little special gift at the end of our meal. The lobster Mac n cheese was excellent and the bone in ribeye was mouth watering. Will definitely be back

W-X29W7SmrVJwe_HpWW2UA.text: I consider this fine dining which I do once a year for my birthday. The hostess and waiters greeted you by your party's name the entire night. A nice personal touch. The meal was definitely pricey, but the steaks alone made it worth it. The sweet chili calamari was good although it quickly became soggy from the sauce. We had two cocktails. Mine the blood orange sangria, was nice and strong. I had a New York strip and my date had a ribeye. We also shared a side of asparagus and diablo shrimp. The steak melted in my mouth. I couldn't finish it all, but boy was it good. *i made steak and eggs with the leftovers. The diablo shrimp fell short in my opinion. It had no flavor. Only the sauce which did nothing for me.   It's my goal to try a different high end steakhouse every year. I've tried it so on to the next. I wouldn't voluntarily go back on my own, but if invited, I'd indulge.

Zk3DePcQB9PDBGPjp8HHww.text: Wow.  Best of the best. The service here was totally unexpectedly awesome!  This was my third time here and management must have changed because the service was excellent. Not only was the service great  but the food was really good too.  We had the prime rib special for around $30 which included the salad the entry and a dessert. The prime rib was cooked to perfection and no one can beat the creamed spinach at Fleming's. We of course ordered the signature lava cake which is to die for. This place is a must try and reservations are highly recommended!!!!

coOKIPk55FqEI7O9eTzGdg.text: I love dinners with the clients.  There are always at least 3 courses, several bottles of wine and no expenses are spared.    We all agreed the steaks were like "budda" the were so melt in your mouth.  They had some wonderful wine suggestions for with the meal.  But what I remember most was the tuna appetizer.  For some reason it just really stuck with me.    The setting is beautiful and while it was more loud than I anticipated, we could still fairly easily all 6 members of our party.    it's a bit of a drive and not exactly for the cost conscious.  So I doubt I'll be going there any time too soon on my own.  But I anxiously look forward to the return of those clients so I can enjoy all Fleming's has to offer for free.

slo57TAWsg5LzLeChlSuMg.text: First time visiting this location. I'm from California and love the Newport Beach Flemings.  This was just as good. Everything was incredible. Great service and delicious steaks.

Q-wtCdSISJDr3_E1FWqYaQ.text: We dined with them and was so disappointed.  Service was horrible and the food was substandard.   Would not recommend this  place to anyone.   We had reservations....waited 30 minutes for a drink after getting seated...ordered appetizer before dinner which we never got.   My prime rib was so fatty I couldn't eat it.  The waiter didn't even question why I didn't eat my entree.   One table next to us walked out...I will never go back.

1RjuwQl6HT7luowj8Q3Nfg.text: I'm afraid because of the departure of Scott Yanni, the Operating Partner and the Head Chef, Flemings Scottsdale has nose-dived. :( The Flemings potatoes are still to die for, however, well-done steak doesn't mean burnt and dry. The service isn't as impeccable as it once was with our server being distracted and not on pointe.   I've heard that the Flemings line is owned by the same company who owns Outback Steakhouse and they want to be more hands-on with Flemings. Frankly, they are ruining a really good thing. Get Scott back--quick!

CKbuTRIx1Vw2JW2qROgOpw.text: My husbands boss was in town and wanted to take some of his employees out to a nice swanky dinner. he made a reservation for 6:30 pm on a Friday night. we get there and our table is ready to go! Our server Javier was very polite, I would say he could have been more attentive but they were busy and it was a large place.  Any way, I ordered a Mojito, it was just ok. You would think for the price it would have been the best Mojito I have ever tasted. There was to much Mint and not enough anything else. It looked as though a forest was growing out of my glass. I love Mojitos and this one was by far the worst I had ever had. no appetizer because we are on a time constraint we have tickets to a show right after dinner so we hop right into ordering the main course. I ordered the Prime Ribeye, for 43.00 you would think it would be all meat right?!? nope not so much, a good 2 inches of my ribeye was pure solid fat, (not the edible kind) I was pretty upset and you would also think that for the price it would come with a side.. yep think again. I ordered a side of mashed potatoes (9.00) for a quarter of a cup of potatoes. I have to admit they were DELICIOUS! but not $9.00 for a quarter of a cup delicious. My husband ordered the Scallops. and thats just what he got, 5 scallops on a huge plate that had so much paprika on them they were red.  I myself never understand spending so much money on so little food but hey if that's what you enjoy doing where you have to hit up the drive thru on the way home because your still hungry I recommend this place.

WNw0hZVh63JBwnwAKCqIEw.text: Uhm, I can't believe I haven't written a review on Fleming's!!!!  I first brought my then-bf (now fiance!) to Fleming's to celebrate his birthday - we ordered the petite filet and the beef wellington (which sadly, I must say, they no longer offer) - and got a FREE chocolate lava cake. pretty sure that thing has a fancier name, but at any rate - simply put, the BEST chocolate cake i've ever had. you MUST try this!  in return, my fiance brought me back to fleming's after winning a gift card at an office holiday party for a date - we ordered the surf&turf special - scallop risotto and beef medallions, the lamb chops (i am totally drooling just thinking about them!), and a side of Fleming's house potatoes.   Ok, so we know that Fleming's beef is crazy-awesome, but the lamb chops? I have never had a better chop in my life. If you like lamb, you will loooooove this stuff. and the fleming's potatoes? probably 1 million and 2 calories in 1 cheese-laden/jalapeno-spiked bite, but hello!, totally worth it.  The medallions were quite tasty, and the scallops/risotto was superb. but nothing could even touch the lamb. seriously.

MLpFQmM--utV-cbOOlafUQ.text: Great place for a romantic dinner.....  I would definitely cross state lines again just to dine at Fleming's!!!!  The service was remarkable, the steak was incredible, and the molten chocolate cake was heavenly!!!!!

eQ38wOAH8AXSjW_0a3QIug.text: I came here for a free dental CE which in and of itself was amazing. Flemming's has a nice private room so we could here the speaker well, (downs for hosting, a little trouble with the lights and watch for next door clickers taking over your screen). The food was fabulous. Shrimp cocktail, interesting butters and bread, red onion walnut cranberry salad:  pretty standard. Then things became interesting. My favorite kind of mac and cheese coating in panko bread crumbs, perfectly cooked and seasoned asparagus, and melt in your mouth filet mignon. I did not think I would be able to eat another bite but out came a huge slice of I believe white chocolate cheesecake with a berry sauce. Amazing! I wanted more sauce but that was not enough to stop me from cleaning my plate. Why isn't there free CE's with fantastic dinners that allow over eager dental students every night???

cxiSlxsRGGGPqzGCGTVBfQ.text: This place is WAY over priced!  I had the 6 oz. Porcini dusted filet mignon.  The description read, with high country asparagus spears and Goronzola cream sauce.  There were 3 thin asparagus spears and maybe a tablespoon of the Goronzola (sp) sauce.  I ordered it pink in the center and it came out red.  It was tasty but not the melt in your mouth steak that I had expected for $42.95.  I also ordered Flemings potatoes for $10.95.  They made the meal!  Potatoes were delicious!  Unless I have a coupon, I don't think I will go back.  MAYBE for happy hour.

BpUBm8wqdZfiaIwP2L3Aig.text: Been here several times and have always enjoyed the file mignon or prime rib, creme brulee and attentive, professional service.  Atmosphere is nice with some younger (late 20s, early 30s) customers and not too stuffy and overrun with older businessmen/ppl like some other steakhouses.    When we made our reservation, were asked if we're celebating a special occassion.  Server presented a Godiva-like gold box w 4pc chocolates and a 'happy birthday' which I thought was very sweet.

8esafUsjkcYGz_8omLLYGg.text: Other than a snotty girl who seated us in a crappy table and told us there wasn't anywhere else available, despite our reserving a booth, we had a wonderful time.  We quickly realized we were not going to deal with the attitude hostess girl and went back to the front desk where they promptly seated us in a booth.  The snotty girl needs to realize who is paying her salary - ugh, the customer!!  The rest of our evening was wonderful.  Excellent service, great food.  The Filet Mignon, chipotle mac & cheese that is always to die for and nice french green beans with mushrooms. Pricey but great food and so worth it for a special occasion.

gYnHIJVFRbnGtXwlVgwmNg.text: Took my parents here for fathers day - so good - one of the best ribeyes I have ever had.  My parents loved it!  Salad with blue cheese and bacon was tasty as well.  Cant wait too go back

290bGr8AVP0FZiBIaQ3gkA.text: 1st time ever disappointed with Flemings....we ordered baked brie as an appetizer and it was a solid chunk of cheese instead of melted and oozing like it should. the service was exceptional

uu1E6wtkZHWU5uMMN8k0WQ.text: Went there Aug 28,2011 reservation 6:30 pm- ordered our drinks, got our bread( their bread is so good) and gave our orders( prime rib special). The place was packed- ... Then everything just went south! Ordered bread twice - never arrived- and the food took so long.  We have eaten here several times and generally had a good time- this time was a first bad experience! And they ran out of the lava cake too! Now that's really bad!

68osjoHHrsTHlN84VHcEfw.text: I also meant to add that they have special event dinners as well as a Friday night special and a winter prix fix for only $39! It's nice to know I have the option to eat have my steak and eat it too.

yJI6k6EAWVyvFYs-QC8i8Q.text: Best Happy Hour in town! $6 burgers (cooked the way YOU order them, I prefer med rare) seared ahi salad, carpaccio, bbq shrimp etc. AND $6 cocktails and wine! You cannot beat the quality for the price for happy hour, must sit in the bar or patio however. Steak and sides are all delicious! LOVE this place!!!

knic5JEddif_R_pHTs-S-Q.text: Top notch steakhouse. Excellent service - over the top actually with about 5 different people stopping by the table calling me by last name and filling water glasses on time, serving and taking away food immediately, checking in to ask if all was OK. I can't remember that last time I experienced such top notch service - spot on. Food - we all ordered steaks that were cooked perfectly - sides are ordered separately and are quite large - example the potato I ordered loaded was the size of regulation football - I easily could have split this monster with the wife. Couple of notes: pricing on the high side - would only stop in here for a special occasion, wine pouring per glass was less than I expected, noise level in the place can get loud - not  a deal breaker - however this should be mentioned - overall from start to finish they get A's in my book.

mHbFV-gII6TtvdixWoHGTw.text: Went here on New Years Eve this year. Place was fantastic. The support staff kinda sucked, but our waiter made up for their flaws. Excellent filet!

Mx8y80bj_lnsoSS4sefFyw.text: This Flemings is one of the best I have enjoyed.  The manager and staff go out of their way to make your meal the most pleasurable experience possible.  You can not go wrong with this restaurant.  We recently celebrated a birthday there on a Saturday night and they made my family feel like they were the most special group in the restaurant.  OH - and the food was excellent.

JxSuQkQ-8sem--J49kOy4Q.text: We have eaten at Fleming's a number of times.The food is pretty good , but the service has sucked each time. We mentioned to the manager, whom was not very sincere with his response. Next time Eddie V's

9ywgJiZnaab16IIUi6vN2Q.text: Received a gift card in the mail so took my family there on Sunday.  My wife and I each ordered the Prime Rib special.  When our salads arrived, my wife's salad contained a paper label in it which I'm guessing was from the head of lettuce used to make the salad.  When the manager came, he just asked if she wanted another salad and that was it.  While the prime rib, side dishes (Sauteed Mushroom and Asparagus) and dessert (molten lava cake) were very good, I was disappointed in the customer service.

iP7LYhOHcx5_0NWFdcpvyg.text: Fleming's was great !  We just came from Houston's down the street which was awful.  At Fleming's the Appetizers were wonderful, great selection, and friendly service (especially Nichole).  Thank you !  A little on the pricey side, but still worth it.

CPDB56-LOTuU3658taAgkQ.text: Whenever I travel I look for the perfect ribeye.   I've tried most of the restaurants in the area and scanned my gps for a different steakhouse.   I've never heard of Flemings before, and thought I would give it a try.    Thought the prices were normal for quality steakhouse.   Service was excellent.  Was NOT disappointed in my ribeye.   Extremely tasty with great flavor.   Probably the most tender one I have ever had.    Definitely on my go back list.

Ppc0iePwbYm5tn-VPHUx8A.text: Don't get an opportunity to treat ourselves much. This was an absolute pleasure. Lois and I both had the Flemings house salad with lemon vinaigrette that was crisp and the dressing just the right amount of acidity and lemon flavor. We each chose the small plate, Lois had the braised short rib that was almost like a pot roast on a bed of spinach. I chose the small plate of shrimp and scallop scampi served on a bed of squash vermicelli. Excellent. We really went all out and had their creme brulee with Chantilly cream. Fresh berries on top. I can't say enough about our meal. Oh and not to forget the hot loaf of bread with two flavored butters, champagne infused and smoky cheddar. Our servers were very attentive. Carmen and Javier you were fantastic!  Thanks for the hospitality.

cdYMkL0e86lgKCBTVC8gXA.text: Don't expect much on a special occasion . I went for my boyfriend's 40th birthday . There was a card on the table which  was nice but that's all I can say about the experience. The waitress disappeared , 3 managers walking around and not one of them touched our table . Every table around us received a hello , how was your diner , anything else you need ? Not worth the money  to be ignored on a special occasion .

UjLtakYG1BOH8vvmuCQmOQ.text: We visited Fleming's on a Thursday evening, after making 7:15pm reservation via their website.  The place was absolutely packed, a great surprise.  When we arrived early, we did have to wait for our table to be ready (to be expected), and had a chance to sample their "5 for $6" Happy Hour drink menu, which stops at 7:00pm.  The Manhattan and Peach Sparkler were quite good for only $6 each.  While waiting, we used the iPad wine menu to explore the many, many wine selections that would be available to us at dinner.  Once seated for dinner, we had fantastic service from our servers, who were always attentive and helpful throughout the meal.  Their homemade bread and butters were great for a start while waiting for our orders.  Instead of wine, we went with the special Pomegranate and Sage Margarita, which was delicious.  For food, we decided to order their Seasonal Menu, a wonderful 2-course taste sensation starting with Lemon Ricotta Crostini with Fresh Pear Slices for an appetizer, and then an Iron Seared Delmonico Steak with tangy bearnaise butter and spiced blue crab topping.  It also came with a crisp potato cake and heirloom carrots.   Unfortunately, one of our steaks was not cooked as well done as ordered, and had to go back to the kitchen.  The resulting extra/twice-cooked steak was disappointing at best.  This is the only black mark on an otherwise excellent dining experience.  To Fleming's credit, the manager came over to the table to apologize, without our asking, and did offer to remove the entire 2-course meal charge off the bill for the steak preparation mistake.  You really can't ask for anything more.  Mistakes do occasionally happen, and they really stepped up and took care of us when it did.  Other than this little problem, I would have rated them a full 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Iron Seared Delmonico Steak w/tangy béarnaise butter, spiced blue crab glaçage, crisp potato cake, &amp; heirloom carrots.

smRHNVCLst299YNu9VAq8g.text: We returned as guests of Darrin's, a managing partner. The first thing I will say is the service here is the absolute best! From the minute we arrived till we left everything was great. Our waiter Jason was amazing, warm and friendly and so very knowledgeable; he had great suggestions. We enjoyed the 2 choices of butter with the bread and probably ate more bread than we should have. The modern caesar is delicious especially with the dried prosciutto chips and my husband enjoyed the huge, new wedge. We both had the 16 oz. dry aged seared rib eye both ordered medium rare. I felt my steak was cooked perfectly but my husband's was a little more towards medium but both of us thought the steaks were delicious and tender. We also had the brussel sprouts which are amazing and the chipotle mac and cheese was probably one of the best we've had in a long time; very cheesy with a wonderful panco crust. For dessert we shared the chocolate molten lava cake and requested the salted caramel ice with it instead of the vanilla since the caramel is so very good. and it went great together. It was warm with lots of rich chocolate pouring out from the inside, topped with their chantilly creme.  They have an extensive wine and spirits list with some hard to find items. this was certainly a much better experience than our last visit but I can definitely say again that their customer service is the very best. Our waiter was so sweet that before we left he gave us a box of their truffles to take home which were very good. I think the one we enjoyed the most was the smores truffle. A very enjoyable night.

fgRKj08oMJxKWlZIhDQ9Hg.text: I was looking forward to a great experience and a great meal.  I was by myself and decided to eat at the bar.  Upon entering I was greeted by a friendly hostess who I asked if I could go to the bar and she said yes, it's open seating.  She could have walked me over if she really wanted to impress, but hey...  Upon entering the bar, I was quite disappointed with the ambiance or lack thereof.  When you go to a nice steakhouse especially the bar, you don't expect it brightly lit and plainly decorated - plain painted walls and poorly positioned tv's that were not large enough to view from where they were positioned way off to the far corners of a very tall ceiling.    You expect hip and fashionable with good music and vibe.  Especially when you ar paying $10 and up per drink...  The night was more of a disappointment from there.  I was given a menu and a wine menu but never asked if I wanted to order a drink.  I finally had to ask the bartender, a guy on the shorter side, not that it matters, who seemed to be too busy socializing with the waitresses and staff than to consider my drink order.  I will say he was a friendly guy and I can see why he was so popular with the staff b/c all he did was socialize with them over and over again.    Ultimately, he suggested the petite filet over the Scottish Salmon which he said was wild caught.  I went with his suggestion and asked for it medium which he said would be pink in the middle which I said was fine.   I also ordered the tomato salad w/beets and was disappointed with the arugula as it appeared a bit wilted and the tomatoes were not chilled which they need to be to make this salad good.  Same with the room-temp beets.  Dressing was decent.  I was working on my salad when the female bartender came over to me and asked me if I was done with my salad which I clearly was  not.  It was awkward b/c my steak was ready as one of the servers had come out and told her as I could see them conferring off to the side of the bar.  I told her I would be ready in a couple of mins and then realized that I should have probably just let them bring it out.    After finally getting her attention back, I asked to have it brought out.  Five mins later I was presented with a petite filet that clearly had been sitting on a hot plate and under a heat lamp as it was quite dry.  It also was a disappointing cut and had some fat on one side which I have never experienced before at a fine steakhouse...disappointing to say the least.  I also ordered the sauteed spinach with oil, no butter and that was pretty good.  There were red onions in it which I typically don't like, but these were well-cooked and seasoned to my liking so I ate them.  I had asked for a glass of Pinot Noir to accompany my steak and he recommended a glass of the PREDATOR Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine, 2012/13.  It was hugely oaky and frankly the most overbearing red I have ever had.  I asked him to smell the bouquet or even try a sip.  It's then that he admitted he had never tried it.  Why would he recommend something he had never tried.  The wine was terrible so he poured me a glass of the Syrah which was much better.  I looked at a menu nearby and saw that Flemings is part if a broader chain and then realized what I was dealing with.  It is their highest end brand I believe and I don't think it is being closely watched from the corporate offices; at least not this one.  I finished my meal and the plates sat there for a good 20 mins without being cleared.  This is at the bar, mind you where the staff is basically on top of you by design.  I finally asked him for a refill on my water and 5 mins later he filled it for me after taking care of several other customers first.  On the positive side, the waiter suggested I not try the Chocolate Lava Milkshake since I told him I had to be up at 4 a.m. the next morning and had a trip to Hawaii  planned the following month.  With just that advice  I avoided a hangover as well as likely close to 10,000 calories.  He scored back some points for that one.  All in all, a lot of money for a average meal with no ambiance...likely wouldn't go back and wouldn't recommend it until managment instills a higher level of professionalism in the staff.

OSUnTtK1yyBRjdj8x7LoLw.text: After making a reservation for 6pm and asking specifically if they serve Beef Wellington I was told yes indeed and that they could prepare it for me this evening.  That was at noon and so I rescheduled my flight out and arrived at the Hilton Village location, at 530pm.  Only to be told by the hostess that the chef saw my request and did not have any time to go get any puffed pastry for the day so I was out of luck.  (Keep in mind I was told at the time of reservation that only this Flemings location which is one of two in Phoenix could prepare Beef Wellington at the tine I made my reservation).  They then said they tried to call me but there was no anssr?!.  Ooops on that lie.. the number they had was the Westin Kierland Resort open 24/7 and so someone would have answered if they only tried.  Now it is 545 and I am on the hunt for Wellington.

xckn3LcBDT1kgLR9AGfRjA.text: I am so disappointed in this Flemings location. After receiving an email advertising a special prime rib promotion for $29.99 I followed the link to make a reservation. However, I got a message saying that the promotion was not being honored at this location. I called and talked to Randy who said that the price at the Scottsdale Road location would be $40 because that's how they chose to offer the special. So I made a reservation at the Flemings at D.C. Ranch only a few more minutes away. For $29.99.  We had been frequent diners at the Scottsdale Road location but from now on we'll go to D.C. ranch. If you use the Flemings brand you should honor the promotions.

Q9Hyr55ce1ddlfGBp8jcyg.text: We've been to Fleming's probably 50 times over the past several years.  Obviously we like this restaurant; the food, atmosphere and service.  I've written previous reviews but never one for Fleming's, which is my fault.  I've read the previous reviews and must admit this place wouldn't be highly recommended for vegetarians or vegans - it's primarily a steakhouse, by definition.  I rarely buy steak at home (because my doctors think I'm on a low-cholesterol diet), but I do love steak.  Fleming's has excellent steak, meat and fish dishes.  We've been to several Fleming's locations in the Phoenix area; they're all good.    [Note:  The previous reviewer's comments are perhaps in the wrong location because they basically reviewed Paul Martin's American Grill.  Paul Martin's full name is Paul Martin Fleming.  His current restaurant is Paul Martin's but he has a long and successful history.  He created Fleming's Steakhouse but sold it years ago to Outback.  He also founded P.F. Chang's China Bistro (P.F. = Paul Fleming), Z'Tejas Southwestern Grill, and Pei Wei Asian Diner, all of which he sold.  As best I understand Paul Martin's is currently his only undertaking.  He was also formerly an investor and involved with Ruth's Steakhouse.]   We absolutely love all their food.  They offer an absolutely fabulous "happy hour" with appetizer's and hamburgers (which isn't by any means hamburger), and discounted drinks.  What a great introduction to Fleming's for those that have never been here before.  One of the things we particularly like is their bread.  As soon as you sit down they bring you warm freshly baked bread with some wonderful spreads.  If you want more, just ask and they'll bring another small loaf, but be careful because if you eat too much you won't get through your meal.  We rarely order their "sides" because we're not big eaters, but they are all terrific.  The one thing I never pass up is their wedge salad; a wonderful salad.  On rare occasions we've had some of their desserts, which are fabulous, but fattening.

LAdTaejtAykqj088cDIAuA.text: This was our first time at the steakhouse, & I have to say I won't be our last. We don't normally like going to the same place as when we do more expensive meals because we like to try the different cuisines throughout the city. The service was great, the manager was phenomenal, and the food was very very good. It definitely lives up to its name.

vzZ1DUszFEL6l25DISBafA.text: I gave this a two star because the service was very good and friendly...the food has always been excellent at Flemings until this visit...the steaks were over seasoned with pepper and spices.  The creamed spinach was also over seasoned.  I had a filet and my husband had the prime aged rib eye steak and both were very disappointed  My husband told the manager but his response was saying he would inform the chef...we live on DC Ranch and hoped to have a great meal ...maybe will try again some time .

xofXMBc5hWz1K7QIFSt9oA.text: I was in town for business and Flemings is attached to a Hilton Resort where I was staying.  I was at a 2 hour disadvantage because of the time zone and with an 11 hour day of travel I didn't want to go out searching for a place to eat.  I showed up during Happy Hour and sat at a booth at the bar.  They had a nice menu for happy hour which included a burger for like $8 which was wonderful, for the money.  Heck, you spend $8.00 at McD's now and this burger was hands down the clear winner.  Cooked to perfection, cheese and bacon and all the fixings.  I also had a bowl of French onion soup.....which was good but served pretty much boiling hot where it took forever for it to get cool enough for me to eat it.  It was busy at that bar, not in the restaurant since it was so early and I can't understand what took so long for them to bring me my burger.  It was well over 30 minutes and I had to chase the waitress down for it.  This was the only downfall of my visit.

KF4QnGtRRMJGe--DN5GXwA.text: No star.. Were waiting for our dinner for more than an hour....terrible service..we decided to walked out the door. Im not going back here..  Front desk did not even say nothing nor apologize to the lousy service ...i did not have problems to the pima branch.

kM3zbbCfHbHWmhvyQ-IXcA.text: Terrible service- terrible food.  My son's took 1 bite of his chicken and stopped there.   The waitress never asked if there was something wrong or of he wanted anything else.   We spent $135- on an awful meal.  We will never return

Bxn5r2rmSLP9wmIOBTyOYw.text: Great late night happy hour!  It was about 10pm and most places were closed, but Not here.  We indulged in a couple of appetizers and recommend the baked Brie.  If you want a great burger, Fleming's served me one of the best prime burgers I've ever had and raised the bar for all other restaurants.

fLpt16BjG5Mnd7MWBYkxfg.text: Before you read my entire review, please note that my boyfriend and I are primarily vegetarian.  We do eat fish on rare occasions (so technically pescetarian), but I primarily cool entirely vegan at home, which is most of our meals.  We received a Fleming's gift card for Christmas, so made Open Table reservations to check it out.  We were immediately seated at a large booth.  The service was spot-on for our dinner.  Our waiter was attentive, but gave us our space as well.  We had a couple of glasses of wine, which were fine.  We didn't order anything special, as we have nicer bottles at home which makes it tough to want to spend a ton of $$ one wine at a restaurant.  We ordered the Jumbo lump crab cakes as an appetizer.  These were great.  Maybe not the BEST I've ever had, but right up there.  Next, we split the Heirloom Tomato and Homemade Burrata salad.  This was also nice - not overly dressed and quite simple.  I wasn't all that hungry, so we decided to split two small plates.  We ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna and the New Bedford Scallops.  We also had a side of the Fleming's Potatoes.  First, the potatoes did NOT go with the food at all.  That is probably our fault for ordering them, but our waiter highly recommended them.  The potatoes were good, but very rich and the flavors were quite overpowering when compared to the fish.  Both fish dishes were great - we liked the Tuna better than the scallops.    Overall, we had a good meal.  Will we be back?  Probably not.  While the food was good, it was also quite expensive and not really our typical style.  This seems like a great date restaurant or somewhere to take someone you want to impress.

72VqdwC4fF1p9iNGh6SinA.text: Food is amazing. Never a disappointment there. Service however needs some work. We came the day before Valentine's Day and were very disappointed with service. When ordering $150 wine, you would hope the server would come by every once in awhile to pour it for you. Or at least check up on you! We never saw her after we ordered. And poured our own wine. I don't even want to imagine her service when it was crowded on Valentine's Day!!!  We came 2 or 3 weeks later to give it another try. We had a reservation, however it "wasn't ready" so we waited 25min...what was the point of a reservation?? Service was a little better, but still not the service you would except and that we usually receive at a prime steakhouse restaurant.  I hate to take away 2 stars for the same reason, but we give it two tries....  All other Flemings I have been to have had 5 star service, they need to retrain at this location!!!

xyHGtJ4Z5I9zHQBEZKFFhQ.text: After hearing back from the owner Darrin my girlfriend and I decided to give Flemings another try. What an experience! From the time we walked in until the time we left the atmosphere was what you would expect from a steakhouse like this. The staff was very friendly and the food was amazing! Our hostess and waitress were great and made us feel very welcome. We ordered a ribeye and the filet and lobster with a side of mashed potatoes. The steaks were cooked to perfection. I ordered cheesecake for dessert at the recommendation of our waitress and it was incredible.   I will definitely be coming back to Flemings very soon!

W-srdVs-giWV9NNgtaDYSA.text: I wanted crab cakes, lobster bisque and a steak, so I "settled" for Flemings because it had all the above. I ended up only getting the crab cakes and the steak, and both were outstanding. The crab cakes were cooked perfectly with lots of meat and had some kind of sauce underneath that really complimented the appetizer well. My steak was cooked at a perfect medium-rare plus, and didn't require any extra sauce or seasoning, and I ordered a lobster with it that was cooked perfectly and huge in size. I was obviously hungry...lol.  Brandon was my server and the manager came to my table periodically just to check and see how everything was going. My experience was wonderful and I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bone in filet, lobster and a Cesar! Sooo good!
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bomb crab cakes
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Table before the grub

f6NqL7xFDQjDQv0KO8qS9w.text: No matter where i sit or who i dine with Flemings is  a True favorite Weather it be a solo dinner or a special evening i always find something i enjoy, The past week i went, i enjoyed a wonderfull johnny walker blue, and the flemings ceaser as well as the small bites sliced fillet serve over mushroom risoto The bartenders were fantastic nice pours and great conversation  This place is a must try

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Johnny walker blue neat  So tasty and very smooth Perfect pour
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gorgeous presentation small bites fillet
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Small bited Sliced fillet over mushroom risotto  Medium rare

AHlqbgDQf-qRW6nMh5TLqA.text: My husband and I just attended Chef Jeff's "steak class" and it was fantastic! Chef Jeff is presenting several classes over the next few months and the steak class was the kickoff. There were about 25 people and we were there for over 3 hours. Chef talked about cuts of steaks, characteristics, cooking methods, and wine pairings. We had 3 uncooked steaks at our table and those were taken back to the kitchen and cooked to perfection. Each table got a platter of steaks (rib eye, filet, and strip- one of each), sliced, and ready to eat. We also had pourings of 3 wines - 1 for each steak. It was fantastic and quite informative. We will definitely sign up for future classes and continue to dine at the restaurant.

_NrQafTIbCGa-2-44RoOfg.text: Delicious steaks. My wife doesn't eat steak or seafood and usually gets the chicken, I don't like it at all(always dry), however it's not a chicken house, it's a steak house. If you ask for a peppercorn crust it is so good.  I think this Flemings has better food quality, but the one on the west side over on Northern has better service.  At these prices, I do wish all Flemings had an actual sommelier in house.

FAtZLB9QvnYmoLb4e2IiaQ.text: It was NYE and we were "playing it by ear" as far as dinner plans. We were staying at the Scottsdale Hilton. We knew we couldn't possibly get a reservation in the dining room so we tried the bar. It was packed, as expected. We got extremely fortunate when a couple finished their drinks and vacated their table. We were perfectly happy sitting in the bar - that is where the action is! We had a couple martinis and ordered mushroom soup, kale and roasted vegetable salad, soy- ginger scallops and a filet. Our waiter was very busy but made us feel like we were the only ones there. I believe his name was Adam. He was wonderful! Happy New Year, Adam!!

D5AkTYQJ6sGj2PSMmkNkRA.text: I made a Valentine Reservation weeks in advance... Requested our fave booth #51....the Hostess gave it away, there were only 2 booths occupied.....she could have sat these people at any other booth....she said we try to honor requests.. she was a phony. after years of going here and spending $$$ They just lost a customer~!!

KHV0x2Po2dWKDCXyIF_70w.text: We celebrated our anniversary here Saturday night. The atmosphere was warm and upbeat. We both had the steak and lobster meal, with a side of sauteed mushrooms. Everything was delicious, from the breads and butter to the perfectly cooked steaks. The carrot cake with caramel drizzle and key lime pie, both served with whipped cream, were yummy and the perfect ending to the meal. Also, the welcome gals and bar staff were very friendly, and we had great service at dinner. The manager even stopped by to make sure everything was going well.

L3ha-LlFFUnArTsZlaSgiA.text: My husband and I have been dining at the Scottsdale Fleming's for years.  It is, in fact, our fine dining destination of choice.  We customarily enjoy a formal meal in the main dining area.  Last night, we were in a casual mood, so decided to enjoy a light meal in the bar.  We were delighted to discover a gourmet menu that includes lamb lollipops, beef tips in an elegant wine sauce, shrimp scampi, as well as creative burger choices.  We stuffed ourselves on the lamb chops, beef tips, spicy tater tots, and shrimp scampi.  Every dish was perfectly prepared.  The service in the bar is as attentive and gracious as in the main dining area.  I don't think any bar in town offers as fine a menu as Fleming's, and as nice an ambience.

e0lgobld-V70b1LMBOJCVQ.text: The food was good nothing spectacular ....but definitely not worth the price... 4 in our group bill with cocktails $500.... large portion of meat served like slab a meat thrown onto an empty plate.... no presentation... meat tasted dry even at being cooked at med rare.  Been here twice ... would not go again or give another chance... staff was bland and seemed unknowledgeable about the menu...we asked twice to have our drinks muddled with mint... both times they came out with mint floating on top ...food was comparable to an Outback Steakhouse with a fancy price tag

mSdW3njX_f9MpmGvQdUp0g.text: On Easter, our family normally goes out for a steak dinner.  This year, we decided to try Flemings, after receiving a few gift cards over the Holidays.  We made reservations weeks in advance, which is something I would recommend btw.  We arrived on time and were seated within a few minutes.  We found it to be a treat to be seated near the kitchen.  The food at Fleming's was good, but the service was somewhat disorganized.  In upscale steak houses, your server is always watching to see if you need anything and is very much on top of things: topping off glasses and getting a sense of timing on when to bring things out.  Here, even with four Culinary Managers walking around, our server was gone for long stretches of time.  Our two glasses of wine took fifteen minutes and our salads were completely forgotten.  Our server only caught the error just before our Entrees arrived.   Our meal ran in the low twos, as you would expect for a party of three, or about $70 each, not including gratuities or taxes.  Our three course Prime Rib (photo) dinner ran $40.95 seemed about right, as was their Double Breast Chicken was $34.95.  We also ordered the Macaroni & Cheese Lobster (photos), Creamy Spinach, Spicy Habanero Skillet Potatoes for the table.   It was inevitable that during dessert, we started comparing Fleming's to our other Easter dinners.  The consensus was that Flemings was: "Three Stars, A-Okay, with no je ne said quo." when compared to other places nearby.  Sorry!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Medium Prime Rib
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5ScTV9A1sE0UNVXYoD6tMA.text: Had dinner here last week. Phenomenal service (as always) and our meals were perfection! Filets were dead solid perfect, as was the asparagus with egg,Dungeness crab bruschetta, burrata with prosciutto and creme brulee!

sAdbZ9MuaxDISo-33My9ZQ.text: Food: went to happy hour. 5-7pm daily BAR ONLY.  We got: Portobello mushroom ravioli, calamari, fillet mignon flat bread, and the burger. Everything was so good and at a great deal except the ravioli. Don't get the ravioli.  We also ordered the chocolate lava cake. Drool. So delicious. Warm chocolate cake with chocolate filling, 2 scoops of vanilla ice cream, cookie crisps and sprinkled with pistachio nuts.  Drinks: some wines listed in happy hour, cocktails and blue moon. The whisky cocktail is so good. Highly recommend.  Service: great service, highly attentive.  Restaurant: dark. similar to a casino. You can't tell what it looks like outside.   Highly recommended

dUshU8AM9_9F8d3Uc8VBdA.text: Flemming's has fabulous food. My wife's sea bass was delicious, $47 bucks. I sampled it. Yum. I got the special Surf & Turf, $50 bucks. The steak was perfect. The lobster was a little tough in parts & a little mushy in parts, but tasted really good. The S & T came with salad and desert which I shared with my wife. The salad was what you would expect but the key lime pie was to die for. My wife got a Chardonnay while I knocked down two Manhattans. 15 bucks a pop, but fabulous. The cherries ware candied. Service was excellent. Waiter let my friends wife sample wine before she committed. Now, let's face the facts. The bill was $156.67 after tax and before tip. I left 20% which brought the total to $186.67. We're talking 10% of my social security check. Thank heaven I had two $50.00 gift cards. We could have gone to Black Angus, Outback or a cowboy restaurant and got much better value for my hard earned money. I would love to go back but just can't afford it. If you're trying to impress your first date or business acquaintances it's the place to go.

_Q_6_8p6xHcE5ArjoSvhPg.text: Fantastic experience great service by John and Johnette. You have to try the fall special with fillet and lobster salad and dessert all for 50 bucks is a great 8 ounce steak with a sizable lobster tail all prepared perfectly and your choice of chop salad Caesar salad or blue cheese wedge and dessert what a great deal from a quality steakhouse

aQB40mj7S_aLo2qT4t3KxA.text: We went for the first time to celebrate our 34th anniversary. It was outstanding. The food, service, atmosphere. We were wowed. Adam our server was exceptional and Anthony the busboy was attentive in many ways, but getting us more sour cream was key! We will definitely go back. It was a lovely evening.

qYzILunaWdy_7zBN79pBzg.text: If you are looking for a cozy yet sensual place to have dinner, this is it. Came here on a Sunday a few weeks ago for their prime rib dinner for 2 deal. The waiter helped us pick out wines that did not disappoint. The meat melted in my mouth and was so good I barley used the dip because the flavor was so great. Their chipotle Mac and cheese was fantastic. Last but not least their dessert was the cherry on top, the homemade whip cream was amazing in itself! Will be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ufsmYqEWMGn-kcUTVWdvXg.text: Met a gal pal there for happy hour the other day.   In fact, it was on a Monday; therefore, thought it would be "slow."   No!  It was packed!   HH is only in the bar and patio, and when we got there at 6:00, the only reason we got a place to sit was cause some people got up and left.   Otherwise, what?    Even though the place was packed, we could have a decent conversation without shouting at each other, which I appreciate the acoustics.  Hannah was our server and I can't remember who assisted her.   Both very efficient and professional.    I had the 14 Hands cab on the HH menu.   Most HH wine is UGHHHH!!! and I usually end up getting something to drink off the non HH menu.  The 14 Hands was good.  In fact, good enough that I looked to see if it was sold in town.   It is. And it is inexpensive.  And, yes, I shall buy it.  We perused the HH bar food.  Hmmm.  Both of us were hungry; therefore, we both had the burger and shoestring fries.   The beef patty came topped with two yummy strips of bacon and a slice of tomato and enough iceberg lettuce for a salad.  We both put our buns aside and ate the burger, bacon, and salad/tomato and lettuce.     The burger was, well, a burger.   Nothing special about it.   The shoestring fries were, well, shoestring fries.   It was good.    I would go back to try their other food.   If it was based only on the burger and fries, I'd give it three stars.   With the atmosphere of being able to hold a conversation without shouting and the efficiency and friendliness of our server and her helper, and the fact they don't have some sort of cheap rot gut wine on the HH menu, I'll give it a four.   I think they should be more creative with their fries.  The other option was onion rings.   I saw what appeared to be two huge onion rings on other guests' plates, and I am assuming that was the onion rings.   No, thank you. ...

PBqSl3HjHFeIHIeAhe52Ew.text: This was the perfect ending to a beautiful date night with my husband! We made reservations through their site and were seated as soon as we arrived. The hostess, Maygan was awesome as well as the manager Chris!!! The food was delicious and came out in a timely fashion. If you're looking for a more upscale dinner or date night, definitely give Fleming's a go!

TSqwgTH22xO527gglOemGA.text: Went out for Beef after days of healthy eating and were tremendously pleased, as always...  Beef carpaccio, Bone-in filet, prime burger, loaded baked potato, creamed spinach, Diablo shrimp and cheesecake to share.  Every dish was prepared perfectly.  Our waiter, Baren, was top notch and made sure our meal and drinks were perfect.  Chris, the Manager, made sure we we were absolutely satisfied.  And, we were!  We will see you, again, soon.  Keep up the great work!!!

i2uL3hHmdn7mgDzVW5t2tA.text: So I chose Flemings to celebrate my birthday yesterday. It has been about a year since I was there. There were 4 of us. We all had steaks, they did not disappoint even though my husband's steak had to be returned to the kitchen 3 times. Ordered medium plus and it was rare. The nice thing is that they gave us another steak which we took home and made an adjustment on the bill. The wedge salad is huge and can be shared as can the giant loaded baked potato. One person in our party had the flemings potatoes which are like au gratin with cheese on top. The spinach and mushrooms were tasty. Service was top notch. A great place to celebrate a special occasion. Expensive but worth it.

ENAEY2HGiNabOv591rEqJQ.text: Fleming's hosted a corporate event for us last night. The service and overall experience was incredibly positive. The managers and servers were responsive, quick, and polite. The setting was wonderful! All our guests had a great time and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend Fleming's to someone in the Scottsdale area.

Ho2SKp6USPDMjOxru5ZELA.text: While visiting the area I had a hankering for a nice cut of beef. After picking some local friends brains, I was told that Flemming's was the place to go. Absolutely stunning steakhouse! Some colleagues and I stopped in one evening without a reservation and had to wait about 10-15 min for a table of eight. After being seated our server was very prompt and helpful. This being many of our first time here, our server was very patient and willing to spend the few extra moments with us to discuss the many items on the menu that we were interested in. Awesome drink menu and plentiful selection of brews. The appetizers we got were amazing!  After finishing the amazing steak and sides I was more than satisfied with my choices. The next option was dessert... Oh boy!? After thinking about it long and hard I did pass on the dessert as I was stuffed after my main course. Some of my friends do still joke with me as the server asked me if I wanted deep fried filet migon with ice cream. I was sure that the server was serious and it appeared that they would make basically anything we wanted.  After paying the bill and complementing our server to his boss we were all thoroughly impressed. Next time I'm in the area, I will definitely be stopping by for another amazing steak!

L83hUXF7OXfi_gKmWHIFAg.text: I was in the area for work and felt like having a great meal. Flemings didn't let me down. I walked in and sat at the bar. They brought me some fresh kettle chips which were awesome. The sourdough bread with the sun dried tomato spread and some sort of Gorgonzola spread were amazing. I went with the wedge for a salad. It was huge! Presentation was great, it had a full piece of bacon and a block of blue cheese. For the main course I decided to go with the Filet and flight special. I had the filet with the peppercorns and then Oscar styled. The steak was cooked to perfection, so perfect I almost didn't even need a knife. I left very full and happy. I absolutely recommend!

uzjVgzrHFynDf3zeJ9Sx9g.text: Had 8pm reservations on a busy Saturday night, got there and were seated right away. Service was great. I've been here three or four times in the past few years and never really had any bad experiences. Was comfortable in jeans and a polo. We started off with the calamari, which was cooked perfectly but I wasn't big on the sweet sauce it was served in. Seemed a little cheesy for a higher end steak house. She ordered the Wagyu strip and I had the dry aged ribeye, along with truffle mashed potatoes and creamed spinach. The cook was a perfect medium rare, the steaks themselves were decent... I'm a tough critic as I cook a lot of steaks, all higher end cuts of beef from local butcher shops (Hobe, Midwestern Meats, AJ's, etc). The creamed spinach was great, wish the truffle mashed potatoes had real truffles instead of truffle oil. Loved the bread with the champagne brie butter.

OM18Ouo0X5LR4QzCw3b6WQ.text: server named Erica was extremely nice. and the manager Corey very friendly. drinks were great. however, the steak was some of the driest blandest steak ever. no flavor at all. if they employ rest chefs here, I'd look into restaffing.  and the chicken is a joke. slimy and bland. I had two bites. gave it to my dogs. for the money I could cook up food 5 times better.  and have.  asparagus was hard too. the potatoes were ok. if you wanna spend 150 on 2 star food then this is your spot. but this place could use some new cooking

MpPYKye_wWFgOVI4FhsNEA.text: I'm typically skeptical of restaurants in hotels. But for some reason "Prime Steakhouse" was unusually alluring.   We had a late reservation and we got seated fairly quickly. Our server Abram was really helpful and friendly. I got the Petit Fillet Mignon and it was so good! Pure meat cooked perfectly. A side of mashed potatoes and asparagus to share- this was a good meal. All the staff was really friendly to us; great service at Fleming's.   Their wine list is on an iPad, which is pretty fun to play with too!

X_EpF_h1SOZgz9Bs3dczBA.text: Had our "big dinner" there with my aging parents last week.   It was a great pick for an occasion. Ambiance is rich, service is Downton Abbey-like, food is something from a cooking show.  My filet mignon was perfect. The scallops only lacked for bacon. Those Fleming's potatoes were wicked good.  And I broke a 30-day diet to mangia on Chocolate Lava Cake, which was the closest thing food comes to sex. Holy crap that was good. Seriously.  The whole staff was impeccably mannered and quite kind. Our waiter put up with my aging parents who don't hear too well.  It ain't cheap, but damn, it's good.

cghMPRW739GfnYizZebgag.text: I would have to rate Fleming's as my favorite Chain Prime Steakhouse! Especially once you start receiving coupons and invitations via email it makes Fine dining somewhat more affordable (if that even goes together) LOL! A discount on $100 dinner helps out. I would definitely recommend them over a few other well-known Fine Dining Prime Steakhouses for a special occasion.   I absolutely love the flavor of the Filet Mignon so tender and buttery and they have the perfect balance of salt & pepper seasoned on there I try to cut the pieces as small as possible so it will last as long as possible. Their sides are great too the macaroni & cheese, creamed corn, and potatoes are great. The creme Brule & cheesecake are my favorite desserts.   The Service is great too even better if you go on a weeknight cause it is quieter more romantic for a special occasion without the background noise, everything is so clean, they servers are very knowledgable on the menu the way things prepared and perfect wine pairings for what you're eating.   My biggest complaint is they discontinued my favorite cocktail it was like sweet but had a spicy bite to it cause the bartender drops a little tabasco sauce in there so every time you take a sip it gives you a kick! OMG it was awesome I went back and they said they no longer have the main ingredient for it Mango Puree so they had to discontinue it NOOOO!

xQvau3q64hHq4Cnwn5mxkA.text: Had my Birthday dinner with my wife and parents and it was amazing. The food was delicious, the service was amazing. The manager even stopped by and remembered us from a few months ago. Just nice people and great ambiance. Can't wait to go back.

Lfjdd27pexl5idf_QFoJ8g.text: Great food and ambiance.  Great place to splurge. Great wine list and dining selections. I had fish and it tasted very fresh to be away from water. Will definitely go again.

U4x6p9NvlHKT-BeXPFZ_RA.text: I'm spoiled...I'm used to Fleming's in San Diego where I've had great experiences.  Not so here and we were celebrating my wife's birthday.  And not because of the service...everyone was nice.  The food was not good, not for Fleming's. The steak came rare when we ordered medium...the expediter must have grabbed the wrong steak. The sauces were cold. The white wine was room temperature.  Disappointing.

jFDI8k6DO3Nl4u4WK4clSA.text: OK, a lobster cobb salad for over $30 and one of the very best prime rib dinners I have EVER eaten (also over $30)...  If I had the time and the money, I could LIVE here. Sure we waited.  We waited long time. But Flemings love us long time too.  The calamari appetizer was cooked to perfection, and the special lobster bisque was equally incredible.  Our server was kinda hot, very eloquent, and easily served our table of twelve with no issues.  My biggest issue was with the party I was with because they simply didn't want to leave...    One of the greatest tourist restaurant experiences ever.  HOWEVER...  I have to ding this establishment a star for not having free/any wifi...  Because that's how we roll in the new millennium...  Try the pomegranate margarita.  SERIOUSLY.

-DkQ7gKoaru-A0ctavPF9w.text: Wow get there early for the happy hour menu. The food is out of this world. Two drinks and two appetizers under $25.  Best deal in town.

kVieoKj0vxnS6pIHHFoGuQ.text: I treated a group of friends and my partner to Easter Brunch at Fleming's.  We were greeted and taken to our table right away.  Sara F. was our waitress.  Sara F. gave us impeccable service.  The food itself, was outstanding.  Nothing but class. Thank you Fleming's and Sara F for an amazing experience.

ES2Uq4-X7zF4Y33P2z_l1Q.text: We sat in the lounge for happy hour. Had the burger and wedge salad. They use prime beef for the burgers providing outstanding flavor. The $5.00 glass of Cabernet was very smooth. The best part of the evening was the outstanding service staff. In fact, I left my cell phone on the table and the waiter ran out in the parking lot to wave me down so that he could give me my phone. Outstanding service.

g7Sb_f6bePEeps_VsBrXqA.text: Very solid all around.  We had a very nice meal here, the highlight of which was definitely the steaks.  I had a new york strip medium rare, which was perfectly cooked, and also very well seasoned.  You don't need much more than that, but that's what you need.  The chipotle cheddar mac and cheese was also spectacular - smoky with a bit of heat and nicely coated in thick creamy cheesy deliciousness.  Not quite as stellar: the creamed spinach was a little too creamy, being basically more cream than spinach.  Also, the seafood tower; it had some pretty excellent items  like the jumbo shrimp and the king crab leg, but it was extremely light on the lobster and the lump crab salad was bland and subpar.  A couple other notes: They have some really tasty homemade butter spreads they serve with the breadbasket.  The place looks great inside, and the service was excellent with the only hiccup being a long wait for our first cocktail.  My only other complaint would be the wine list; there are plenty of bottles in the $30-40 range but most of them are from the cheap aisle at your grocery store.  You're gonna have to shell out $50+ to find something that really stands up to your red meat.

Sw9Jn9aCcEq6Mf0m7_-diw.text: We ate at the Flemings on Pima Road on June 19, 2015.  Simply stated, the experience was outstanding.  Our waiter, Jose, was friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable, but not an overbearing presence.  The rest of the wait service was also very good.  The food was cooked to perfection.  The Strip steak that I had was one of the best, if not the best, I have ever had (and yes, I have eaten at Durant's).  I had mine done medium rare and seared while my son had his Strip steak medium rare and broiled.  My wife had the small Filet done medium rare.  Both stated that their food was equally as good as mine.    Do not expect a fast paced meal.  One of the pleasures is that it was served at a leisurely pace allowing for the total enjoyment of what was being served.  We had drinks, the entrees, and we shared a wonderful fruit and cream dessert and we where there for over 90 minutes.  The environment was subdued and reasonably quiet.  The other guests' conversations did not intrude upon ours.    All the employees, from the manager (who came to our table after we had told Jose how much we enjoyed our meal and service) to the greeter who open the door for us were friendly and seemed genuinely pleased that we had decided to visit their establishment.  One of the assistant manager even took my wife's arm and helped her to the restrooms when asked where they were.  Could not have asked for more.

TGDEtx9C29TostEwgtnDGg.text: Go to mastros city hall in Scottsdale for steak... This chain restaurant is no better than lone star or outback. Too bad was really disappointed with the wait, to be seated and served and average cuts of steak... You can do a lot better ....

6qF2g5rjs2LyssF8NdTICA.text: Great happy hour burgers (comes with cheese and bacon if you choose) with fries :) for only $6!! can't beat that!

jegZo6enkM8KWovLvulH2w.text: I think Fleming's is the cat's meow! Great service!  Fantastic food! Interesting wine choices! I love that they offer wine flights. I don't know of any other steak houses in town do that (if anyone else does, please email me).   Shhhh....don't tell, but Flemning's is my 2nd fave after Mastro's!!  Bon Appetite!

z-yU2K2nogT_lBCQkl1DMg.text: Quality of steak was nothing to write home about. Service was just ok. For what we got the price was very very high. I would never go there again.

EgZ0KG4L812b-Sr5-kOf4w.text: Service was unbelievable, awesome they treat you like royalty. Scottsdale Road and Lincoln would explain the pricing $12.00 for baked potato, a little bit expensive but the food is really good

z7zG07D3Gh8-dqTMJ50e5A.text: Dinner was amazing.  The fresh warm bread, and the butters for the bread, the steak, the potatoes, the chocolate lave desert, were all wonderful.  Our son drove up form UA and wasn't thinking about what he wore.  They kindly made an exception this time, and in the future he will dress more appropriately. We and he appreciated that immensely.

CN_UYrpz7NgcIn2n78C-Uw.text: Absolutely FANTASTIC. Best steakhouse I have ever been to. Thanks to Yelp, I decided to take my boyfriend here last night for his birthday. I called to make reservations in the morning and wasn't able to get in until 8pm (fine by me). First off, the bread was delicious (came with 2 types of butters). For appetizer, we had the carpaccio-it was a full plate of it with pieces of toasted bread on top! For the entree, we both had filet mignon. Mine came with the Fleming's potatoes (A MUST TRY). His came with crab stuffed shrimp and asparagus. For dessert we ordered the chocolate lava cake! OMG this was sooo good. I'm so glad we ordered this and it definitely satisfied my sweet tooth!! This place also has a large wine list--bottle prices were from  the $30's to $600's. If you don't finish it, they cork it and seal it in a bag for you to take home. Because it was my boyfriend's birthday, the manager gave him a $25 giftcard for next time. In addition, every staff member we talked to said happy birthday to him (I mentioned it was his birthday when I made the reservation over the phone). Our waitress was very nice and knowledgeable on the food & wine as well. What amazing service and staff! The only negative thing for me would be the noise-but it was only because it was so busy!  Overall, this place is worth every penny! Thank you Fleming's...we will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate lava cake! YUM!

4dgmE7-5H5wYEDh-eAqHEA.text: We were celebrating an anniversary of a family member.  I can say that the bus boys were better at service than our waitress.  We had started the evening ordering drinks an I was looking forward to the calamari appetizer I ordered through our waitress. She proceeded to take our orders salads came no appetizer then out food came   Food was awesome however my husband didn't get any melted butter with his crab legs. We kept waiting then finally my husband got up and found our waitress and asked for melted butter    We then told her make sure we are not charged for the calamari she acted as though she was surprised we didn't get it.  Anyways I was really disappointed in our waitress.  The rest of the staff was the service for us.   We still tipped at 15 percent when I will tell you I'm a solid 20 percent tipper. Food fabulous.  Waitress needs some training.

rpqryODTRdS3MT9qW07eXQ.text: Bread is finally improved, so that gets things off to a better start.  Love the beef carpaccio, they do that really well here.  Had the Wagyu NY strip, excellent.  Creamed spinach here is super.  Excellent cheesecake to finish.  Great meal!

tIF5nQPkLV5vUkELmRt4DQ.text: You want over priced food with neglectful staff, this is your place. I got the gift card from costco as a gift, so I thought what the heck why not? So me and my wife dress up for an awesome night. We get there and sit at the bar, since we made reservations and they werent ready for us. So we grab a drink, the bartenders are awesome.  30 mins later we get a table, why make a reservation? The stick us at a table in the corner where it seemed really dark. Maybe I was being punished?  Little did I know.... The waiter rarely came around, he was more concerned with the tables with fancy suited men with young women. After around 40 mins we put our order in. With the prices they had this must be the best steak I have ever had, right? Wrong! This small sliver of peppered meat was far from what I expected. I get better steaks from the market. After our waiter comes for the 3rd time during our 90 mins waiting, he was too busy taking pictures for those wealthy looking people, I get the check dropped on me and no questions on how the food was, or if we needed anything. Word to the wise, you want the waiters to recognize you, wear expensive suits and bring some ladies, you will be treated like a King.  Needless to say, this establishment will never get my business again.

YeQtWuJoKZcLNKQpT8XQQQ.text: Too bad the service is so terrible, I generally love the food. We went to sit down at a table in the bar (that the host told us to sit at) and the host asked us to please wait until they cleaned the table. No problem, but as we waited the waitress "gave"  our table away to someone else. The wait staff and the host stand all argued with us and the other patrons. Embarrassing for them, as the manager stood by and just looked the other way. We went to BLT Steak instead. Delicious meal there! I recommend you go there instead.

VV0tYU30S-13uZPHnft1gw.text: This was the first time I've visited this spot and I wasn't disappointed. My boyfriend and I came for dinner tonight and we arrived about 10 minutes past our reservation time. Oops. No big deal though, the hostess was able to get us seated quickly. Then again it was a Wednesday night so it wasn't too crowded.   Service: Our server was extremely attentive without seeming pushy and annoying, perfect. We were also greeted by the manager which was nice and each person that stopped at our table to help was efficient and polite.   Ambiance: Perfect lighting, bathrooms were clean, almost ate shit in my heels because the floor was either just waxed or slippery as hell. Oh well. Noise level was perfect, not eerily silent but also not too loud.   Food: We both ordered the filet and lobster 3 course special and it really hit the spot. We started out with an amuse-bouch of scallop on a bed of something I don't remember and cherry tomatoes. It was delicious. Then I got the wedge salad, I should have gotten dressing on the side but I wasn't thinking at the time. Too much dressing freaks me out. Oops again. The main course came out shortly after and my steak was cooked perfectly to my order. My boyfriend's steak was a little undercooked but it was no big deal. Lobster was also fantastic, our server de shelled our lobsters for us. Perfect. I couldn't finish my steak but I did manage to snatch the rest of my boyfriend's lobster, yay! Then came the desert of my dreams. I had the deconstructed s'mores and it was to die for. The marshmallow was perfectly fluffy and with the scotch in the chocolate, it wasn't overwhelmingly sweet. I would actually come back every day just to get this for my sweets fix.   Price: We had an amazing deal, but seriously, don't come here if you're not willing to put your wallet to work.   Overall, great service, ambiance, and food.   P.S. Writing this as I finish the rest of my s'mores.

0YwYQdXl07gErgjU0nqdhA.text: We came back again tonight, after 9months. My hubs got steak (ribeye with blue cheese crab sauce) and I got lobster.  The steak was meh. Mushy, charred on outside, and tough. My lobster was pretty good, but didn't taste as sweet as Maine lobster. I can tell the difference. Our service, as always, was most excellent.   Disappointing to have two 3-star steaks at $45 each. Boo.

SYjEsfTgMKt2b6HOT6MK2Q.text: I have been to dinner and HH here.  Both visits were fabulous.  The steak was one of the finest pieces of meat that I have ever had.  The tuna appetizer was delicious.  Tonight I had the HH hamburger for the amazing price of $7 and it was as good as any $15 burger in town.  I'll be back!

Q-mg9L6sGF--cP01TEpclA.text: The service there is the best!    Took the wife there for her birthday and they made sure that is was AWESOME!!!  Our server Justin was very helpful and was johnny on the spot with the food and drinks.  Speaking of drinks, you know it's great service when your glass is always full.  Their special right now with 8oz filet and lobster tail was very filling and barely had room for dessert!

cvHCVP5hFvPvBNG-RyjJ0Q.text: Fantastic food. Great atmosphere and service.  I forgot to ask what wine the waitress brought me but I really liked it. I will defiantly come back.

HiMSMsRuHK4_cCC-pBJFgg.text: I refuse to go someplace that lies about having an opening.  Walked in person with no reservation and they told me that they were booked for the night but yet there were tons of tables with nobody sitting at them.  I go sit in my car and look them up online and they have reservations available.  When I called about making a reservation they had no problem whatsoever getting a seating.  I chose to go somewhere else.  If you can't have enough integrity to be honest to my face about coming to your place of business and lie to my face about being able to eat there, then I won't be eating there ever and I doubt my friends will either!  To top it off they don't allow firearms either.  I would rather eat somewhere that has integrity to their customers instead of being lied too directly to my face.  Honesty is pretty important in my opinion especially if it a place of business.

RALjxlxxazTrdPD_F_XcyA.text: I'd heard great things about Fleming's, so I was excited to go last week for dinner.   For starters, I love a good bread basket. They have a fabulous one.  Their wine list is presented on an iPad, and rightfully so - it is gigantic.  We split the caesar salad which was great and even a small was easy to share.   Since I wasn't super hungry, I ordered the scallops. Four midsized scallops in a delicious meyer-lemon honey glaze. The side of vegetables were fabulous as well. I had a few bites of my husband's ahi tuna which was also excellent.  I'll definitely return - looked like they had a great happy hour menu as well!

qJ8NFmeiinV615KPnEdNdQ.text: My favorite steakhouse by far, and I've been to many. Always great service and have never had any problems with food. Amazing steak, good prices for such amazing meat. My mouth is watering writing this review thinking about my last experience. I had the pepper new york strip and wow it was amazing, perfectly cooked! Can't wait to take someone here on a date!

RV-A1MXyOwmYnhOuT9zAHg.text: We arrived at the Hilton tired and hungry after a long day at work and traveling.  The front desk recommended Flemings and we can't be happier with that decision. The menu is amazing and the wine selection is one of the best I have seen. The filets were prepared to our desire and cut like butter almost melting in your mouth. The staff was fantastic and we would go back every time we are in the Scottsdale area.

2zUi1gHYStWptZI-PygerQ.text: Absolutely amazing Father's Day Brunch!  Bread, Wedge salad, Filet Benedict on buttermilk biscuits with hash brown potatoes and green beans, New York Style Cheesecake = $29.99 + They gave me a $25 gift card to come back for dinner!  Thanks Flemings!

OSPMErQrAkMVlKC5KyjlSA.text: Had a party of four here to celebrate a graduation.  The service was truly outstanding - from being seated immediately, to wine recommendations, to the presentation and great flavors of the food.  For special occasions, we would certainly come back.

14QB5UrY3ZOi4i7OKOUHCg.text: Food was a 10 but service was abysmal from check in to wait staff just a disaster. Otherwise would have rated our visit tonight a 5.

I29xqKx8M87eNre9odrwFg.text: A good steakhouse. Wait staff is attentive and eager to ensure your experience is enjoyable. The menu of course has lots of steak options but there are some seafood/fish options as well. Large restaurant but has a warm feel.  My most event visit I took my staff out for a team dinner, the place was buzzing and packed. I would suggest you to make reservations but I'm sure that they take walk-ins you just may have to wait a bit longer to be seated.  The steaks were cooked to perfect temperature, I got the large filet and the sides...damn. The sides are all bomb particularly the potatoes Au gratin and the lobster Mac. The portions are meant to be shared family style.  I've not had the dessert here, I've always been too dang full from the main course.

dDf-8EhrsHttKpvkDnkSXg.text: I wish we could give 1/2 stars because I think a solid 3.5 not quite a 4 star experience but nothing atrocious. My partner started with the French onion soup that he said had a good flavor. I decided to get my appetizer with my meal and just enjoy my cocktail. Service in the bar was very good sometimes it can be hit or miss. I got the prime burger not very original but I was in the mood, burger was just fine cooked a little more than medium as requested but it wasn't an issue for me, fries of course delicious. I could not go to Fleming's and just get a burger so I ordered the crab cake appetizer to accompany my meal. Good crab cakes for in the middle of the desert so I can't complain. My partner got the double breast of chicken with white wine mushroom thyme and leek sauce. He said the pieces of chicken were good but the sauce was eh. Definitely will be back at one location or another.
