p6RGyQolrOiTdItRUpRBmQ.text: Dropped in on a sunday evening and did a 3for5. Three guests for HH @5pm.  We started with 3 martinis, a blueberry lemon drop, a filthy dirty-classic with blue-cheese stuffed olives, and a vodka cosmo all served as ordered. The glasses were so chilled the glass was ice-frosted. Immmm... We moved on to a have a few bites from the HH menu, Burrata, mushroom-farro burger and a California burger. The HH menu is frequently tweaked to accommodate a sense of newness you'll never be bored with happy hour here. I've probably had 8 HH visits in the last 12 months and it's always stellar. A notable item, with the burgers came a side of french fries, they dipped/rolled a few olives in batter and tossed them in the fryer with the fries, a spin off of deepfried pickle.  The final notable mention goes to the service, it has never been less than exellent. Waitstaff has has always been well thought, well timed and on the ball. Every time I've visited a member of the management has stoped at the table to greet and inquire as to satisfaction. what's worth noting, is the timing. They always seem to greet you when its convenient, and not while your chewing.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. HH, on a Sunday evening...

mGbWOVKde-QIzgxvbj-O5w.text: Kind of an older crowd here and the bar is always packed.  I was here for an anniversary dinner and we all had a good time.  Service was very attentive and the food was good. Our bone-in ribeye was cooked a perfect medium rare.  The Fleming's potatoes have a nice little kick and the creamed spinach brussels sprouts rounded out a satisfying meal.  They also have an extensive wine list.  We had a nice Justin red blend that went great with the steaks and didn't break the bank at $78 for a bottle.

0gTr03sFHNcRbuV1ZGlhew.text: We absolutely loved our dining experience here. We went for an early Valentines celebration. Normally we would. It have gone to this place as I'm big on steak and it's a lot of $ to spend. We had a gift certificate for the restaurant and some Uber credits for the travel which we knew would help allow us to make the trip. I cannot say a bad thing about it. Drinks, Starters, Entrees... all to die for. The melt in your mouth can't get enough of kind. And surprisingly we didn't feel stuffed or have lots of food left over. Our Server Sara Flanagan made all the difference.  She answered all of our questions, assisting us, making recommendations when we asked and guiding us every step of the way. This allowed us to make the right selections and I will say I'm really impressed when I'm dining and the Server gives us her business card. How Professional and wish I could give Ten Stars! Two drinks each, two starters, two Entrees and bread and Without dessert. We spent $140 with tip (after our $100 gift card), so plan to spend some money. But if you can do it once it is well worth it. We will be back!

Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Miso Glazed Chilean Sea Bass* this melted in my mouth and left me speechless! Exquisite presentation too! $26

B3RQ_yi22iM7GqmndAqEcQ.text: Great steaks, but extremely pricey so bring your checkbook.  We had $100 in gift cards to Fleming's so after visiting the Scottsdale Art Walk recently we decided to stop in for dinner. The food was delicious, but like all upscale steak houses, everything is a-la carte. Steaks are $50 and up and your sides start at $12 and go up from there. We started with an appetizer of calamari, then I had a bone-in ribeye and my wife had the New York strip. For sides we had the brussel sprouts and bacon and the lobster mashed potatoes. Because it was a Thursday night, my wife stuck with water and I had one IPA. I will say that everything was delicious and very well prepared and the service was excellent.  However, the whole setting was very generic. Fleming's is locally owned, but if you'd blindfolded me I couldn't have told you if I was in a Morton's, Ruth's Chris or Capital Grille. Even the beer selection was generic. Yes, they carry a lot of wine, but how about offering some local craft beer as well? My IPA was a Sam Adams Rebel which is decent, but something I could find anywhere.  I also take issue with how much they charge just to cook a piece of meat. Yes, I realize that's how steakhouses work, but when I'm paying that much for food I like to know that the chef actually worked to put ingredients together.  So how much was it? Well after tip our $100 gift cards barely covered half of the bill. I can't even imagine what it would be if we had ordered more drinks or a bottle of wine.  Sure, this is a great place if you're on an expense account or just want something generic, but I also appreciate the experience so next time I want a steak I'll choose Durant's or The Stockyards.

tK5iSju_tnBIBOzz0eXt6w.text: Brought the whole family to celebrate our mothers 70th birthday and we couldn't have had a better meal or a more enjoyable time.    We dined on a Monday and most in our family had the special - Filet & Lobster for $55 (or $57 for crab?  I think...).  The steaks were perfectly Medium Rare, seared and seasoned well.  The Lobster was also quite good and included drawn butter.  Salad and dessert were included.  Everything was excellent, as one would expect from Fleming's.    The highlight of our meal, however, was the service.  Having waited tables in the past, I know that showing up at a fine dining establishment - with both a toddler and older parents (who like to share everything) and then ordering the special -  can illicit anything from an eye roll to lackluster service.  Not so this evening.  Our server, Andria, and the manager, Chris, were beyond hospitable.  They were charming and kind and patient.  We felt truly cared for and we are grateful.  We will be back!

P80pOzgx1bTlmZGwgI7Khw.text: Tonight we decided to celebrate our anniversary at Fleming's. Our entire wait staff, especially our waiter (Kristos) and the manager (Evan) went above and beyond this evening to make sure everything was perfect. Our table ordered the crab bruschetta, the wedge salad, the lobster Mac, the rib eye, the wagyu strip and profiteroles to share for dessert. I was a little underwhelmed on the wagyu-- which was VERY surprising as we come to Fleming's all the time and the steaks have ALWAYS been amazing.  The manager was beyond generous to rectify the minor inconvenience. I knew the food was amazing, but the wait staff officially secured this steakhouse as our choice for future visits.

pRgYfEL8AWmirhC6ju-Jbg.text: Amazing steaks and great wine choices and the atmosphere was wonderful too. Highly recommend if you are looking for a great quality steak house.

97zNLUEG-g48VofvyuNN5w.text: Top line service when you enter the restaurant and leaving the restaurant. Our server Jordan was Great!  Cheerful, Friendly and Helpful! As always the food was Excellent!!!

EHE93SFqlRrECADwIPF2kg.text: Delicious Steak and good wine selection last night at Fleming's Steakhouse in Scottsdale, AZ.   I had the New Wedge salad and 5oz Petite Filet. Cooked perfectly Medium Rare. Great flavor.  I'm not a big fan of a la carte pricing and family style service. For me it removes a bit of the personal touch and service I think is expected.  Great location for larger parties but I probably wouldn't take my date (@amywesttravel) there. A bit loud and not as many private seating options as I prefer.  Overall, good experience and good food.

P1a_E157vHPVFK2ptYdXMw.text: We went out to Flemming's happy hour for the first time since our new baby was born. We sat on the patio and James Blase took care of us. He made our experience so special and enjoyable. The service/food/ambiance was so  great we will probably remember forever!

vSi4L55ifgpkboPAOlz4Ng.text: so i get email this AM-prime rib special good for 2 weeks.  call local restaurant on Scottsdale road, and was told it expires this Sunday, 4 days from now.  HUH?  call corporate and they confirm what the local yocal told me.  these folks are disingenuous, do not honor what they send out as a special.  I suggest you do not patronize.  they are all about corporate, not the individual.  their attitude can work now as plenty of snowbirds here now, but we locals shall remember this disingenuous response far longer, when the snowbirds are gone, they need us, and we shall not support.

3BrMciwA9Dhb95VJ1SU9cw.text: Flemings must have the best service in this town! We came in early for HH. Kris bounded over with a huge welcoming smile to get us seated and comfortable on the spacious patio. Next, he introduced us to our waiter Doug Ray. Even though it started to get busy he never forgot about us checking with us frequently to make sure all was going well. What a gracious guy!! Then Prentice came to inquire if everything was AOK. The food was awesome, but one thing;if you want onion rings on the burger you have to ask now. Come on over. You won't regret it.

BG176sp_CZ2PJy3ZKkyCrg.text: A group of us had a special dinner at Flemings - reservation for 12 people had been made several weeks in advance.   When we got there, we waited 25 minutes before our table was ready, even though we had reservations.  We were in a semi private room, which was nice. The service was not steller, nor was the food.  I wasn't responsible for paying the bill, but I am sure the "tip" was already included. I do not plan to frequent Flemings any time soon - there are too many places to choose from which offer better service and food worth the price that Flemings charges.

gAmc2m7fPAWmgfC7nL5ULg.text: My girlfriend and I went there this past Sunday for the second time.  We went previously for my birthday and had a great experience.  The food is always great and very hot when it comes out.  I love steak so it is always right up my alley.  This past Sunday's experience fell short.  Our waitress, although nice, was not attentive and did not listen to what we had to say.  We ordered an appetizer and needed it prepared in a certain way, but it did not come out as we ordered.  We saw our waitress all of three times the entire night.  My girlfriend ordered a bottle of wine which was on the "last call" list.  We waited 20 minutes before she came to tell us that the bottle was not available.  The busboy that was associated with our waitress might as well have been our server.  He was great.  He made sure everything was to our liking and even refreshed my girlfriends wine glass.    When the food did arrive, we were satisfied with it.  The two times that we have been, the food is always exceptional.  But, you can't help but notice the lack of service.  I have to say it did affect our time there on Sunday, but won't hold us back from coming back.  We can only hope that the service will be better the next time.

J9fmoknk_dRz_ENMDCki0g.text: Came for valentines brunch. Food was great! Service was awful. I plan on going to the other locations in the future.   First we got seated and the guy didn't pull out our chairs and just handed us the menu. Our server ignored us for 10-15 minutes literally avoiding eye contact. Finally got some water and biscuits. When ordering I asked "which is better this or.." Then he cut me off and told me oh yes get that one. Pretty unfriendly and made a big deal about substituting a side. Kind of grabbed the menus and left awkwardly.   The food came and was very good. The runner kind of threw the plate down and some actually went off the plate and he said "oh it's slippery". We kind of laughed it off but still... Everything added up to not be service you expect at a nicer restaurant.   The waiter started warming up a bit towards the end but still pretty awkward.   Went to tell the manager on the way out about the rough start and his response was that he'd have to talk to the waiter and get his side of the story. Weird response considering we'd already paid and were walking out. We weren't asking for a refund or anything. I expected a "sorry for that bad start" and instead had him say he doesn't believe us. Again very awkward.

DtwtdEdXIGW4xJj70IaWFQ.text: Its been well over a year since we've been here but this chain has never failed to satisfy!  The double pork chop that i had was fantastic!  I had the porcini mushroom sauce on the side and OMG!  Such a great combo with the chop!  And actually they bring an inhouse made bread with 2 different types of spreads and one of them was a brie cheese with champagne and just thinking about gives me goosebumps!  Unfortunately, i have to cut this review short but the creme Brule is also to die for!  The only reason why i didnt give it a 5 star is that they sat us under a ac grate and it was too cold sitting BUT the manager did take care of that.  Great job Flemings!

RLgidorSUmC_TZR8Bm1e5w.text: Birthday dinner #1 with mom at Flemings was a great experience. Both of us are first-timer at Flemings but really enjoyed our nights.   Reservation at 6:30 on a Saturday night in the private room section, a perfect seating for us as it was much quieter. Our dinner consisted a shared plate of calamari, two petite filet with a side of grilled asparagus and sauteed mushroom.   Calamari plate was very big, pre-mixed with the hot n sour (though it says hot and sweet) sauce, not the typical calamari I had tried, especially there were sauteed red pepper, onions and some very sour jalapenos. Overall it was ok, the outside layer of calamari isn't as crispy as I wanted, probably because it was already mixed with sauce.  Now to the main dish, steak!! We both opted for the petite size, it was perfect for us, very well accompanied by the grilled asparagus and sauteed mushrooms. My medium rare filet came out very nice and juicy. If only my mom doesn't eat her steak at well-done, i would have ordered a bigger steak to share (of course to save money too!) oh well, we both only want what we like :p  For dessert, we chose the famous lava cake. Well, it came out very neat looking with two scoops of ice cream and a little candle, but the cake itself was a bit too bitter for me, it was very very dark chocolate. I normally do like dark chocolate, but this lava cake, if no ice cream was accompanied, i don't know how many bites I could take.   Our overall experience was great, very nice staff and attentive services! And because we went for birthday, yay for a $25 gift card for the next visit !!

ZyCsW6uVvBm3_SA0PuRGJQ.text: I came here with my fiance about 2 months ago (I'm late to post the review...I know).  We are such food people that when it comes to going out and spending money on a good steak, we love it. We have been to Roy's, Mastro's, City Hall... you name it!  So we decided to give Fleming's a shot. We were so incredibly disappointed. The food was decent, Id say a little over price for the quality, but the service... oh goodness.  Not to say that my fiance and I are prim and proper, but we do live a luxurious life style and appear like we do as well . (meaning we don't dumpster drive then try to act classy in public). The waitress made us feel like we did not belong there what so ever! Such a strange feeling! I'm not sure if she was tired of being a server or what, but it was bad. It left me feeling like a loser... We could not get out of there fast enough, more like she could not get us out of Fleming's fast enough..   regardless, to say we probably will not come back is an understatement. Plus with the people that we know, my fiance and I will definitely advise them to choose a different option.   End of rant....

45ChQJK6le9dLyZVysMxXQ.text: I was invited by Robyn N. to join her at the Paso Robles Wine Tasting VIP Event sponsored by yelp here and I gladly accepted the invitation. It was a great opportunity to try several of Fleming's offerings at once, and  to pair them with different wines as well. The wines were all lovely and the dishes that Fleming's offered for the event blew me away! We had a variety of excellent cheeses, always a great way to flatter excellent wines. Sweet chile calamari had a very pleasant sweet tangy sauce that lightly coated the tender squid. The roasted mushroom ravioli featured a delicious porcini butter sauce coating pasta pillows stuffed with portabello and shiitake -- a must-try for all mushroom lovers. We also had steak crostini,  melt-in-your-mouth tenderloin carpaccio, seared ahi tuna -- all excellent. The wine tasting event turned out to be a superb dining experience as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fleming&#39;s, on Scottsdale Rd. corner Lincoln

ujgoV_K2eOLGnWTC2uyiuw.text: Bottom line: Be ready to pay a lot of money for a food quality that rivals a mediocre steakhouse. I will not patronize this establishment again.  Pros: The service was good. The scalloped potatoes were excellent.  Cons: Everything is overpriced, and it is not the quality you'd expect. A decent cut of steak is $55+ and a la carte. I tried the pork chop ($37 and a la carte). The waitress recommend having it cooked medium, which I ordered. When it arrived, it was well undercooked (cold rare). The manager took it back and cooked it appropriately. Taste was okay but it was not at the level of a $37 a la carte cut (I could have cooked this pork chop in my oven with Apple glaze and seasoning, and it would have tasted the same). In addition, I like my pork/steak cooked over wood. Flemings broils or cooks over a gas grill.

8dEdDoCgHf-Y12GvrZ03Ag.text: A delicious meal! Every course. Perfect temp on the steak. They apologized up and down for the slight delay on our main course,but didn't  even realize it was a delayed.  But they more than made up for something that wasn't even noticed.  Exceptional customer service.

ycO73tskJMb8ck4KGHEpFg.text: Very good food and the wait staff were very nice and efficient.  You have to try the chocolate molten cake for dessert.  It was decadent!

ywImL1uuGGtpACoyWiQgdg.text: I ate at Fleming's and was impressed at first, but that went downhill soon.  I asked my server to leave off the spicy oil and my overpriced steak came with the spicy oil on it.  Instead of bringing me an entirely new steak, the server returned with the same steak still having the spiciness on it.  I did not enjoy it at all and just wanted to leave.  I was so disappointed that I didn't even feel like complaining, and left a lot of food left over.  I have eaten at 2 star restaurants with better food and service.  A very overrated place and very over-priced.  No steak is worth paying $50.00 for it!  I did complain the next day but no one ever contacted me.  I will never go there again, nor recommend it to anyone.

Kvo4IhBm2acBKtc-d7iaOw.text: It all starts at Paul Martin's Steak house across the street from Flemings! I am not sure how to rate food I did not eat! I came in on Sunday to celebrate my anniversary. We specifically chose this place for the prime rib, unfortunately they did not have it despite offering this dish as their feature choice. We were offered an alternative for a significantly higher price. But it was not the price hike that we felt offended by, it was the condescending nature of the manager. We felt very uncomfortable and embarrassed that we even asked for a price match. This reason alone is why we thanked the server and left. I can handle bad food, but bad service is unacceptable.  We cane across the street to Fleming's and they did not have prime rib either, but they immediately offered an alternative with sides for the same price! We never asked, they offered it to us. They gave us the desert when we mentioned it was our anniversary and the server and the manager gave us a $50.00 gift card and a gift wrapped box full of chocolates!  Simply Amazing!

RLtbFTczCq7a6k36kt1yTw.text: We love surf & turf!  I mean who doesn't enjoy an extremely well prepared Filet Mignon accompanied with a succulent lobster tail? Oh Yeah!  So of course we had to go pay Fleming's a visit with some good friends.  We go to Fleming's for their steak because they know how to prepare it better than most!    For starters we were treated to a warm, rosemary loaf of bread.  The bread was already very good by itself, but the butters were even better.  I don't remember what each butter flavor was but I liked them both.  I preferred the orange (sun dried tomato maybe?) looking one.  The white one had a bit of a feta cheese taste to it.  We quickly polished off our whole loaf of bread.  Shortly after that, our soups and salads arrived, nothing special to write about here.  Next came our steak and lobster.  The server waited while we cut into our steaks to make sure that it was cooked to the precise way we had requested.  My lovely bride's steak was so small it looked as though it was meant to be on a tasting spoon and not part of a surf & turf. The server apologized and was embarrassed he had not noticed it prior to bringing it to our table and quickly sent for another one.  My steak was perfectly cooked, mid-rare but I could have used a bit more seasoning.  The lobster tail was the highlight for my meal. The lobster came out served on top of its tail shell, but then it was removed by the waiter, (as if I could not handle it on my own :-) The lobster was not at all dry, which I worried about.  It was moist, tender, and was pure lobster deliciousness!  As we dug into our steaks, we were given sides of asparagus and Fleming's potatoes.  I found the asparagus to be seasoned and cooked very well but a bit overly oily.  The Fleming's potatoes were like layers of lasagna, covered in a creamy sauce.  I've never been a big fan of any creamy potato dish, but this was exceptionally good.    For the finale we had Chocolate Lava Cake ~ a rich chocolate cake with a hot molten chocolate center, served with vanilla ice cream and sweet crisp wafers. The warm hot molten center with a scoop of the cool vanilla ice cream was the perfect way to end this wonderful meal.  Fleming's is a fantastic place to dine for a couple, family or with good friends.  They are a chain, but they know how to cook steak very well and they are consistent. They have an exceptional wine list, which is what I recommend. Their well drinks are a too pricey (vodka & water X 2 = $24) so stick with wine.

9vMYEJD_P2V2kTHrKdZ7jA.text: We went there for our 54th anaversery and will never go back.the food was not to bad but the service was just terrible our waiter looked like he slept in the clothes he had on. I can't complain about the price but I could  get a comparable steak for much less money.its not the restaurant I had though it was ,more like a high end neighborhood bar and grill no for special occasions like a birthday or anaversery .

Hx94ySrVkBjDVYXtf7R0Ug.text: In the words of Monty Python, "Run away! Run away!" We have had several lovely meals at the DC Ranch location, so we tried this newly renovated spot, which turned out to be a horrid mistake. By the end of the meal we were debating whether it was our worst expensive meal ever. Here's what you get for $200/couple: It started when we were seated 20 mins late for our reservation - the hostess sounded genuinely perplexed that 'people are taking  longer than I expected.' (Hint: it's not your guests, it's your abysmal service.) Then we waited 35 minutes for first course, the squash ravioli, which was just OK (we were sharing it, but got no plates -- several waitstaff watched as we leaned over the table trying not to drip sauce all over). Then it was another 15 min wait until our spinach salad came (which was good). By now my wine glass was empty, and it would remain that way for the rest of the night without any offer for another. We had another 30 minute wait for our main course to arrive, which would have been more at home in an Outback Steak House and not even remotely worth the $50 price of admission -- my steak was undercooked, my wife's was overcooked. They weren't very tender or flavorful (mostly just over-salted). We ordered two sauces, and they brought the only one we DIDN'T ask for. The Fleming's potatoes, which I always love at the DC Ranch location, were mediocre here. The asparagus was cooked well but incredibly salty.  We also were treated to a show at neighbor's table as they sent back their steaks, and then received a shower of lobster bits as their server cracked open the shell (like a crustaceous IED). They did not look like they were enjoying their splurge meal.  The horrendous service and mediocre food would be disappointing even for a $50 meal. For a $200 meal it is outrageous. Do yourself a favor and STAY AWAY!

B7QP-ntusOtwC6PQXPaKRw.text: We came here for happy hour and the service is a little slow.  Food is amazing. We love Flemings

lipxe5bEtK5KDXncMMzdIg.text: Fantastic Dinner!  My wife and I had dinner here on a Saturday night and it was wonderful all around. They were doing a Duckhorn tasting where we were able to taste 6 different wines for $28 with our dinner.  The wines were very good and it was fun to try some wines the rose and whites with the seafood tower and then reds with our steak and French Onion Soup.  The seafood tower was very good and poke had fantastic flavor.  I have Celiacs and they were able to make our whole dinner gluten-free (they even had a separate GF menu).  My wife got the French Onion Soup and enjoyed it although she said it wasn't quite as rich as other's she's had.    We shared their 3 course meal ($55 total) which brought out a nice salad, filet over pork belly and delicious dessert. The salad was a good size and had candied nuts and dried fruit which was delicious.  The steak's here are always fantastic. The filet was tender and cooked perfectly when we ordered medium. The pork belly was also had good flavor but wasn't overly fatty which was nice.    For dessert we got a chocolate pudding of sorts with gluten-free brownie bites on top and some light whipped cream. It was fantastic!  They're always running specials so would suggest signing up for their emails. We'll definitely be back!

Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Campfire pudding with gluten-free brownie bites and home made whipped cream - highly recommend! It was soooo good!
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Campfire pudding with melted marshmallow on top

ox5yfltV7YOWLoZsR1VsyQ.text: Delicious food Went on date w hubby and food came out impressively fast, almost too fast. Felt rushed.  We wanted to enjoy time together and dining experience and we were done in less than 45 min.  Spending this much money on food I want it to last a bit longer. Space it out just a little bit more and would have been absolutely perfect

NxPhRO9dXvWZ0PtTkquptg.text: My wife and I went to Fleming's for the first time after hearing great things about their food. We sat at the bar and ordered a few drinks and some appetizers before our meals came out. My wife and I both got the filet mignon. The food was okay. For being a steakhouse I would have expected greater quality cuts. What really upset us was the fact some manager or older gentleman dressed in a suit (we think his name is Chris) was walking around to all the guests asking them how everything was. He looked at my wife and I and skipped us and went to the next group. I don't know what his intentions were but If I had to take a guess it is because we were much younger then the rest of the people in the restaurant. I really could have cared less that this man needs to come over to us and greet us but the fact that he didn't is upsetting. What really made this worse and why I'm writing this review, is that he went to the same tables again and skipped us AGAIN! What a loser! I would advise everyone to take their business elsewhere. Ruth Chris' Steakhouse is 3 minutes away from this place and is much higher class.   A word to Chris at Fleming's, targeting a specific crowd based on age is going to get you nowhere in 10-20 years when you expect people like us to come back to your restaurant and dine. Good Luck..  6 months later and still no response from the restaurant. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this place!!!

WXYUcUTZQd9t3CK7BrLh4A.text: Okay I am pretty disappointed in the particular Fleming's.... server was not to friendly and very slow. Food came out very slow.. by the time I got my steak it was cold and well done... NO BUENO! Maybe today was just a bad day for them... sorry have to give you guys 3 stars.

K1Yz8P9K6PNXINzGt-CpMg.text: Last Saturday it was as good as it gets. The restaurant being packed at 7:15, fortunately, we had Opentable reservations which worked out perfectly as it always does. We were seated in a spacious booth in Alex's (server) station. Always service at it's best with him.  Ordered our cocktails while reviewing the menu. My dining partner and I are always creatures of habit, ordering the same thing, this time around we opted for a couple different items. Of course you can't go wrong here with the traditional steakhouse Shrimp Cocktail. I wanted to try the Sweet Chili Calamari, a new choice for us. Entrees were the 16 oz. New York Strip, the Petite Filet and as a side the Signature Tower of Onion Rings, another new choice for us. All the appetizers and side were delicious and the steaks were cooked to our request.  Atmosphere: Upscale Steakhouse, Service: excellent, Food: excellent

5SGT7DNdLfYMXcd8mFE7QA.text: Food:  Warm bread with soft butter (as it should be).   Chopped salad looked like it had been chopped a couple of days ago (i.e. wilty edges on the veggies) and it was very, very small.  Steaks (Main Filet, Angus Ribeye, Prime Bone-in Ribeye) were good (as expected at a steak house).          Service:  Efficient, enthusiastic about the food.  Interrupted twice within 30 seconds by 2 different people asking how our food was (too much).    Ambiance:  Traditional steakhouse, more formal   Other:  No fee, tip-only valet at the hotel - appreciated on a busy Saturday

d7UHLGtoUIzaC5wDW0ZBlQ.text: I have been coming to Fleming's for years and have probably come to dine at various Fleming's maybe 20 or 30 times. Tonight we came to the Scottsdale one and had a wonderful meal that was perfectly adequate.   Unfortunately I didn't feel the steak was cooked as well as it usually is and so did the 2 other guests with me. Don't get me wrong the food was delicious but for a $300 meal I usually expect the steak to be cooked better. It was medium rare as ordered but the sear was too thick and hard which made the steak chewy instead of being like butter which is usually what I have experienced at Fleming's....also the Rib eye is good!   Reviews of "NON-STEAK" things we ordered  APPS  Calamari: def worth an order it was good and sweet and spicy with sliced peppers.   Ahi Poke: wasn't good at all and wouldn't order it again.   SIDES  Mushrooms: DEF a must order as I love mushrooms and they do a good job cooking them.   Creamed Spinach: good for a veggie but other sides are better  Mash: it's not usually my go to potatoes there but def food!   Fleming's potatoes: the best potato side to order, it's like a very yummy scalloped potato!   DESSERT  Lava cake: A MUST ORDER in my book if you are going to Fleming's and never disappoints. You cut into that cake and get the oooey goooey filling falling out, just perfection!! Served with ice cream, raspberries and fresh cream.   Creme Brulee: DEF a must order but if you are choosing between the lava cake and any other ORDER THE LAVA CAKE

-mgwJZ97SmZza5URZYiVpA.text: I did not take any pictures at all as the presentation of the food wasn't anything exquisite and the taste was not there either.  The wait staff were all very nice which is why I gave this rating more than a one star. However, they literally kept getting our orders mixed up. We were there for my boyfriend's parents birthday celebration and the wait staff kept forgetting who ordered what drink and main dish. It was quite frustrating.  The steak my boyfriend got was super rare which was not what he ordered. I had the scallops which wasn't bad but the puree underneath was extra bland, it might as well not have been there. A good lemon garlic sauce would have been better.  We ordered a lemon drop type of martini, sorry I forgot the name and it was way too sweet. Not at all like what I expect from a martini also they said it would be sour.  Our bill was about $750 between 5 people. The food was not worth it. If you want good steak, this isn't the place to go to. Sorry

BCiVEWmD86HTlcYiuEO4Wg.text: Visited Flemings Scottsdale for Father's Day during lunch and couldn't have been more pleased with our experience. Our server, Chad, was very attentive and friendly. The food came out timely and cooked to perfection. Flemings will always be on our list for special occasions or if we are in the mood for a good steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

4nU39P5wLNzFONIWRuudwg.text: My husband and I went to Fleming's for a Valentines dinner, and it was very nice. The food was good, and the service was better!  Drinks- my husband had the blueberry drop, and it was perfectly sweet and lightly lemon-y. It came in a martini glass so there wasn't much drink for $15. I had a glass of the Ruffino moscato wine which was exactly what I expected- sweet, light, and perfect! App- my husband chose the pri fixe offering which came with an amuse Bouche which was caviar and sour cream on a savory pancake- it was fine, seemed like it was more for show than taste. The app was a mushroom bisque that was very good! It was earthy and seasoned very nicely. My husband doesn't even like mushrooms but he liked this bisque. Mains- my husband has the petite filet and colossal shrimp- the steak was cooked perfectly with a flavorful Demi glaze, and he loved it. There were 2 shrimp on the plate in a creamy garlic sauce and that was amazing! The best thing of the night. I had the classic filet and it was also cooked the way I ordered and was very flavorful. We also got the Fleming's potatoes to share which were awesome! dessert- White chocolate bread pudding. I didn't get the white chocolate, but the dessert was great! A little stiffer than a traditional bread pudding, but the couli and dark chocolate sauce served with it offered a lot of moisture.  All in all, this was a great dinner. The only reason I left off a star is that I felt the food just wasn't worth the price- $53 for an 11 oz filet a la carte is fine if it's the best steak you've ever had, and this was good, but not the best.   Our server Chad was amazing and deserves a huge shoutout! Also, Patrick never let our water glasses go below an inch from the top and the staff was very attentive.

-vqgUhMhehcxkNIO__Kbaw.text: Went back to this location and left happy again!!  We had a new server named Andrew and he was fantastic, so much so I told the manager before I left.  Food was great, we did the Sunday special which is a beef tenderloin (filet is definitely better but the beef tenderloin was still yummy).  The carrot cake and Creme brulee are also great.  Definitely was an enjoyable experience and we will be back.

6wMC4BR6z8UNU1bkMHBdSg.text: I've been coming to this Flemings and the one up in DC Ranch for over 12 years. Not sure if we are just having bad luck but the last two times we went to DC Ranch we had a problems and now the last two times we went to this location we've had problems. We both got the filet mignon and lobster. The 8oz Prime filet came out perfectly cooked which I would expect. The lobster came out hard overcooked dry and actually had a tough crust on the top of it, not what you want with a lobster tail. Basically it was sitting out for a while or the chef just totally over cooked both of them. As well as my Caesar salad came out and they forgot the dressing?? It took them 10 minutes to bring out the dressing. Then for dessert we wanted the carrot cake but they were out of carrot cake which is one of their Signature Desserts so we ended up with a creme brulee which was good and a chocolate lava cake which took 20 minutes finally made it to the table and there was no lava inside just a dry sponge cake with ice cream. Very disappointing. Especially when you're paying $140 for the meal and half of it comes out incorrectly. Not sure if there is New Management or maybe they are not training their people as well as they used to. The chefs or Sous chefs seem to be lazy towards the end of the night and do not care what they put out. The last time here I had the entire mini bowl of hot butter spilled all over me. They need to step up their game because there are many many other great steakhouses right in the area that do a much better job at the same cost or lower. I would definitely go to Dominick's, Capital Grille, Ruth Chris or Mastro's over Fleming's.

4PX8IdwM786HIl25P-QE_g.text: Great service. And a fun meal with the family. Appreciated the waitress having fun with us and kids. Will be back. Every course was great. The steaks were perfect, tried the deconstructed Wellington. And in hindsight I like my Wellington's constructed. But over all great.

VaqBX3eGZLKIvtwdO5nmYw.text: I was blown away with the great service!! Our server was very attentive and friendly. We came originally with a group of 8 and the guest count expanded to 13 during the duration. They were all understanding and allowed us to move tables!! Thank you staff for the top notch service! We will definitely be returning.

4EbhUZAKMypuPSn60OnLOw.text: Great service and food but with so many open tables on New Years Eve and not taking anymore walk ins it was a bit of a turnoff. We were lucky and found a seat in the bar but when paying almost $300 for a meal for 2 you expect to feel more welcomed. I have eaten at Fleming's in Los Angeles before and I felt they appreciated the business and did not rush us out. Keep in mind the place was packed so wasn't like rushing us was helping them all go home.

2t9V5LYs_v3ffTVLHvH8bQ.text: Very odd experience at Fleming's. I travel quite a bit. Eat at Fleming's frequently. Never had a problem. This location was not a good experience. Staff and manager were first rate. Food was not. Ordered a filet medium rare. It came just a tad less than well done. These things happen. Talked to the staff. They were on top of it. Second steak was less than rare. The middle was still ice cold from the refrigerator.  At that point I asked for the check and made a reservation at another restaurant. I may not be able to eat steak again for s long time after this.

oHvuUuQH_y_L8OjlWnW4aQ.text: This wad really fun.  It was my wife's birthday so we signed up for Chef Jeff's Steak Cooking Class, "how to buy and cook the perfect steak.  He offers a class 3-4 times a year.  There were about 20 of us in the two hour class.  Very reasonably priced at $35.   We ate a ton of masterly cooked steaks and a lot of wine.  A lot of wine.  Did I mention a lot of wine???  Chef Jeff covered marbling, grading, cooking temperatures, buying steaks.  You might be surprised who he thinks sells the best meat in the Valley.  It was interesting to learn the differences between table salt and Kosher salt.  Sweet Jesus, I always thought Kosher salt was blessed by a Rabbi ......take the class and you may never use table salt again.  It was a fun, fun "couples" date.  Highly recommend.  Did I mention the wine?   Oh, and he will show you his Wagyu.  Pretty impressive.  It seemed like we drank a lot of wine.  Thanks Chef Jeff.   Put us down for the next class

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The wine
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The meat

cQ3SF-OZuEiWxoFFKia4Fg.text: Well my wife and I frequent this place 10 times a year. Tonite the service was horrible. Francisco, our server said no hurry, we will space it out. We did not finish our soup before the busser was trying to clear it. 10 seconds latter our meal arrived. Francisco had plenty of time to take pictures for other guests but no time for us. We just came in for a nice relaxing meal and were hearded in and out. Frankly we couldn't get out fast enough. We will not be back! You blew it bad!!!

w-A0sab7XYziJQFd2_K_yw.text: We celebrated Valentine's Day at Fleming's. We had the Valentines menu. I enjoyed a filet and lobstertail while my boyfriend enjoyed the filet and shrimp. Then we had a bread pudding for dessert. The entire meal was delicious. The bread basket was so good with the champagne infused Brie cheese spread..Amazing! It was a nice dinner. There service was great! The Manager even came by introduced himself and joked around with us. It was a great way to celebrate love

Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Valentine&#39;s celebration with my love!

p-bu2pW01KlnI02gg2ztGQ.text: This restaurant is very nice.  It has a sophisticated vibe to it and you can expect an older crowd here.  This is one place you should leave the kids at home.  The dining room is dimly lit and has more of a romantic atmosphere to it.  The table had a white table cloth and I was glad to be wearing a collar!    The food was good.  I went for the prime rib and my wife had a fillet minion.  The side of brussel sprouts was really good.  It had a spice and kick that I've never tasted and I would easily order it again.  We wanted to try the shrimp cocktail appetizer, but our meal would have easily hit $150 had we gone for any appetizers.  The one thing to be aware of is that things add up quickly here.    The desserts were good.  I went for the lava cake and my wife had the creme brulee.  These were definitely the highlights of the meal.    This place is perfect for celebrating a special occasion as it will be memorable, but I do not think we could afford to come here every week.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate lava cake, delicious
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Creme brulee with berries

c8ne0oibnkYlcVhx1EtmIg.text: This restaurant is receiving two stars for several reasons. First, they were seating reservations 45-55 minutes late. Why bother accepting reservations if you don't actually hold tables for them? When people have reservations, they want to be seated promptly. If a restaurant is unable to accommodate fast seating, then they are better off not accepting reservations at all.  At least people would know to expect a wait.  One hostess was personable and calming.  The other, with glasses, was terrible. She was patronizing to customers and quite rude in general.  The waiter we had was decent, nothing special and not personal. The gentleman filling water was very good - fast and attentive.  The food was nothing to write home about, albeit, we are vegetarian. Typically, steakhouses will offer vegetarian options that aren't on the menu. Fleming's did as well, but it was a compilation of their side dishes and appetizers.   One star for the berries and cream for dessert.   We only visited Fleming's because we had an AMEX promotion for $40 off, we won't be returning.

DHhif42tvJLRGmuPcGER0w.text: I ordered a medium well filet mignon and it came to me rare. I specifically stated that I only wanted a slight pink, not red, raw, & bloody. All three of the filets were like that. Potatoes were cold and Caesar salads were made with ice burg lettuce. Ridiculous and will not be returning. Worse steak house yet!

C1S9wYJXaOq_fZSkrIPbRg.text: Restaurant has a nice ambiance. Service was attentive. Drinks were good. The food however was really overpriced for what you got and disappointing. Steak was over cooked, portions seemed a lot smaller than a normal 8 oz/12oz serving, and seasoning was lacking. I can honestly say the best thing I had all night was the creamed spinach.

XmnecwkoDg-lNoR8EqL40Q.text: We go to DC ranch Flemings and it's always perfect however we decided to this location just to try a different ambiance but we are really disappointed.  The calamari appetizer and steaks were great.  The salad was really tiny , not sure why.  It took a really long time, 30 min between appetizer and salad. We thought they ran out of lettuce.  The worst part is that my girlfriend went to the restroom and there is no toilet paper and the paper towel is really low too.  When I went to the men's restroom the paper towel was almost out and the Kleenex  box was completely out as we'll.   you would think someone should check the restroom periodically at a nice restaurant  .  I've learned my lesson and stick to the DC ranch Flemings.  y

hupbVczP-6Kly3JtTIGk-g.text: My boyfriend and I went there for dessert. Well, I have to say that the Lava Cake was really good, but the staff wasn't. Our waitress was surprised and a little bit bothered that we were there just for dessert, and she wasn't really friendly too. I am a server as well, and I always take extremely care of my customers, with big smiles, prompting service, and my own personality. Especially in a classy place like this one, I would expect better staff. Concluding, 3 stars just for the Lava Cake.

TUaXakZVTHI7KcsnL26aMQ.text: It has been quite a while since I last visited this restaurant (about a year ago). I met my best friend there and all I remember is that the food was delicious and the service provided by the wait staff was excellent. Good wine was also flowing freely at our table, which may or may not have contributed to my not remembering exactly what I had for dinner that evening. However, I would very much like to go back and dine at Fleming's.  :-)  Ps- I do remember the manager stopping by our table to check in on our group to make sure we were being well taken care of.  That's always appreciated.

h5tV8OveFP0d29-sKplBKQ.text: Um. No.   One star for the the lovely's filet, he said it was one of the best he's had. Second star for service and the chocolate lava cake.   When I made the reservation, I told them it was Jeff's birthday. Upon arrival, they wished him a happy birthday and escorted us from the [handsome but very noisy] main dining room into what looks like a converted private space. No ambiance, no windows but quieter.   And although we appreciate a reprieve from the noise, there was piped in [bad] music. Ugh. So I'm sitting in the back forty, eating a $9 salad that is mostly chopped iceburg lettuce, some cherry tomato and a few candied walnuts, drinking a Smirnoff Cosmo [my fault for not specifying the vodka] that had almost half a lime in it.   Dinner was the lovely's 6 oz filet, baked potato and asparagus, and my Lobster tempura. He was happy, I was not. To their credit, lobster was perfectly cooked and but the tempura coating was so greasy - greasy as in they didn't drain it properly. The soy ginger sauce had so much salt I couldn't enjoy it and the accompanying jicama salad was overdressed.   The chocolate lava cake was yummy, coffee was meh.   Before dessert, manager Tracy brought a gift card and wished Jeff a happy birthday - a nice touch but we wont got back. For almost $200 we can have a stellar meal, more food, and a lovely experience at Capital Grille.

arnAxE55OV9bDJ0936BOlg.text: This is a pretty different place depending on whether you go for Happy Hour or Dinner, but both deserve 4 stars.  This is easily one of the best happy hours we've been to in the Scottsdale area.  I've been there twice and both times there has been a wait.  I wish you could make reservations for the bar area for Happy Hour, but unfortunately that isn't possible.  Here's why the Happy Hour is so busy: The service is outstanding, as are the deals. The burger is incredible ... for $7 I don't think you can do better.  Just don't get the onion rings ... it literally only came with 2 of them.  The drinks were strong and delicious.  $3 for a beer and $6 for specialty cocktails.  The Baked Brie and the Pork Belly appetizers were amazing.  As for dinner, everything was pretty delicious.  Both steaks were very good, but mine had far too much seasoning.    We didn't like our server because she seemed to be pretty pushy in terms of upselling, but she could have been having a bad day.  We also thought it was odd how often we saw the hostesses walking around checking on table progress.  Usually at such a nice restaurant, they're not as concerned with table turnover.  it was pretty darn expensive overall, but that's to be expected with a steakhouse.   Overall, I would recommend Fleming's more for Happy Hour than dinner, but both are great.  Enjoy!

yIgPCNr1YXAjSQbaUrqWMg.text: My boyfriend and I had went in here around June 20th to a start to our 3 week vacation we did show up a little late which I hate doing but they were very kind to us at the door and insured us that they were still open for another hour. It was one of the best dinners I've had to start with the perfect grey goose martini that we both love a little extra dirty to the house made BURRATA that was to die for its the best ever then we shared a filet cooked to perfection and for side we had the Fleming potatoes which were amazing as well and the asparagus!!! I really enjoyed this and we will be back thank you for a wonderful experience

yBhEuhCvREdjOaXn_I9imA.text: My favorite steakhouse!!! I have great memories here- when my (then) boyfriend first asked me to be his, Valentine's day, and our anniversary!! We just can't get enough of the exceptional service and quality food. Every server we've had has been great and you can tell management knows how to run a successful business. I have never been less than extremely satisfied. My fiance has a weak stomach and he says the steak here has always been delicious and never has bothered his stomach. I've had everything from salmon to steak and it's all so good!!  ANOTHER GREAT THING about this establishment that I must stress- they always make you feel welcome and a valued customer, always. We are in our mid to late twenties and have been to Mastro's City Hall and Ocean club and every time have been sat in the back corner because they think we look young and will not "spend enough money." We always do and tip accordingly, of course, but that's not the experience I want to have when we're dropping a couple hundred dollars for dinner. At Fleming's we either get one of the big booths in the middle or a table right in the middle. It may sound like something ridiculous to say, but it really does make all the difference for your experience. Fleming's will always have a place in our heart. Thanks for the great memories and even greater food!

VABLv65vaZOqGf8huaHHfQ.text: . Poor quality steak for $60. Their so called signature mac and cheese came out of the microwave and obviously they didn't heat it up well because it arrived very cold and it was tasteless. It is definitely not worth the $100 I spent on 1 person. However, the staff was nice so I gave it 2 stars. But I'm sorry I will not go there again.

WcJCMYqhyjTEPnunAMmY1g.text: I honestly can't say enough good things about this place! First - the bar is awesome and always packed so don't be surprised if you have to wait for a table/seat at the bar. The hh is amazing and goes til 7 which makes it even better. Most of the time I just stay and eat in the bar because the hh food is just as good as the other stuff!   We actually did go eat in the dining room though to have a bit more formal dinner. We split the filet, mushrooms, and shrimp appetizer. Everything was fabulous and the service was even better. Really can't say enough good things about this location!

hm-sdYcRo2HOpyOkrGkciQ.text: FAN-FREAKIN' -TASTIC!  Yes, it's a Great steakhouse... but they also have a Great wine selection... and Great bread to start... and Great desserts.... and Great service.  Rich and Richie took exceptional care of us.  They were attentive and fun to talk to... too.  I had the Prime Rib and it was huge and perfectly prepared. I ended up taking the rest home and having it for lunch the next day and it was just as good the following day.  :)  The Bread to start came with 2 different flavored butters.  You could easily fill up on bread before dinner.... so go easy on this as they will keep bringing out refills if you let them.  The Dessert.... we got the Chocolate Lava Cake... and the cake part was good... but the sides that came with the cake... they were Amazing.  The Chantilly Cream they serve on the side of the cake is freshly made and it's a Little Pillow of Heaven.  Rich brought us more when we ate all the cream and still had cake left.  And then they have a little homemade pistachio cookie with vanilla ice cream on the side too... these were great too... So, net, net... I wouldn't order the Chocolate Lava Cake for the cake part.... I'd order it for the things that come WITH the cake.  :)  Good for special occassions and if you are looking to have a lovely evening out.

vEVNYF5ax8klieHxB_0pHQ.text: I like this place for the happy hour and outside patio. The food seems to be consistent and a good value.  I do like the prime rib and cocktails.

eiiQTWnC0JPQikBBiFNGJg.text: This place is amazing.  Jeff the executive chef is ridiculous. My steak was beyond perfect. The shrimp was exceptional.  Service was as expected, prompt  This is the best!

g_oDnDEPNrvioZtHemHMWA.text: You can't really go wrong with Flemings. Very romantic, and dark inside. You get what you pay for, and here, you pay ALOT. Portions are small, but thats kind of a good thing if you ask me. Service is top notch and so is flavor. Came with my mom & we both had the Restaurant week specials. I went with the Chicken & Mom got the Steak.  Both were incredible.  My only regret was not getting the Chocolate Lava cake. This is a must at Flemings- Deelish!

vy2T5A8z86SWeE47VyqWVA.text: Fantastic happy hour with 5 wines, 5 cocktails, and 5 apps, each for $6.  My pal and I went with the sweet chile calamari and the mushroom ravioli and were not disappointed with either.  Fleming's is still on my list for dinner, but in the meantime, happy hour will do just fine.

T_M5INr-A_4d3rozmRBBqw.text: This last weekend we celebrated a milestone 60th anniversary party and wanted to go someplace special.  Seth C. booked us the private room and it was amazing.  The server Justin was on top of his game he was attentive to all of our needs from the time we sat down until we left.  Seth C. kept checking on us to make sure everything was perfect and even introduced us to Chef Jeff.  The food was amazing and the experience was 5 star. I can't wait to go back.

JtWZdfSV7AMoeDqA5v6Ypw.text: Top notch service. We recently celebrated a very special anniversary with a small group. Everyone went above and beyond. Seth C, the manager made sure my family had a memorable evening. He continually checked in to make sure everything was going well and even brought in Chef Jeff to introduce us as well as bring the Anniversary couple some special truffles.  Our server Justin was very attentive from the time we got there until the time our meal was over. Thank you team for a memorable night!

178_jUByiDwWKd8UvDmhGg.text: Was this the same brand?  My wife and I have been going to Flemings at different locations for years and it is my wife's favorite high end steakhouse. We have been to locations in Tyson's Corner, Naples, Orlando and Tampa. We love this brand, the food is good and the service excellent.   Not this Scottsdale location. We arrived on time for our reservation. First, they took the wrong name. After my wife spelled it out. So there wasn't a reservation according to the greeter. We had to convince her to look again. Thankfully my wife's unique first name allowed them to find it. Then we sat for 25 min as walk ins and a group of six, whose reservation was also lost were sat.   Finally we were sat and waited for about 10 minutes before our waiter came. He took our Order but by drink glass was frequently empty throughout the night. My wife ordered her usual small plates filet, substituting the mushroom risotto. And was told they cannot do that. She normally does this but ok.   Good was on par after we got it. But we will not go here again. I hope the north scottsdale location is better.

UWHcylHqTiBBD_6K58xceQ.text: Good steakhouse.  I've been here about half a dozen times.  I've never had a bad experience with the food here, or the service.  I prefer this over Morton's and Ruth's Cris, but not over City Hall or Mastro's other steakhouse up in North Scottsdale.   Standard menu.  Everything is a la carte, like other fine steak houses.  If you go here, you will not be disappointed...but be sure to make reservations.

LwiC0MyGK8rPm4pPpyPEag.text: Before we even sat down to our table, my party and I sat in the bar for a glass of wine. With their extensive wine list, I assumed we could taste a glass before purchasing a $100 bottle of wine, unfortunately for us, they charge for wine tasters. (which I happen to think is CRAZY, considering I work at a similar kind of restaurant) ...But where to start?.....Broken wine glasses on the table when we first sat down. Ordered a baked brie appetizer, that was cold in the center. On several occasions our drinks were empty for 15+ minutes before someone would even walk over to our table. Our server was terrible, the bus boy did 3x the amount of work. No communication coming from the server at all. The food was "alright", we ordered scallops and filet, definitely not worth another $200 or a trip back.

NDdFrOJXjzc7FobSE_8azg.text: I am seriously craving those little toasts with the two kinds of spreadable cheese they bring you before your meal at Flemmings right now.  DEAR GOD do you think you can get that to go?  I have had a fantastic experience every time I've been to Flemmings.  Great, sophisticated atmosphere with waiters who know their food and their wine.  Great wine selection, btw.    I always have the filet there and its always cooked to perfection, along with the asparagus and blue cheese mashed potatos...holy crap--DELISH.    Great upscale date place...I've also seen groups handled well here too.

b_qW_8xfFJvfjmiRQwBa1g.text: I just went to Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar yesterday and to start the food was phenomenal. I ordered the petite Filet Mignon and it was amazing. Best steak that I have ever had at any place! I also got the Fleming's potatoes, which had a perfect jalapeno flavor! The chocolate lava cake did take awhile to be made, which was told to us by our waitress, but regardless worth the wait! Food was superb! The reason that I'm rating a 4/5 is the service. To start, the waitress reached across me without asking to grab wine glasses after we said that we were not going to have wine and didn't say excuse me. The person who brought out our appetizer grabbed our bread and dip(when we hadn't finished it) and didn't ask us if we were done. The first waitress that I spoke of before also came by and asked us if we would like desert as the chocolate lava cake would take 20 minutes and we said we will look at the menu. She responded by saying that she would come back. We finished our food after 5 minutes and then she never came back for 5-10 minutes after we finished, which in turn made our wait for dessert 30-35 minutes. The food was the best, but the service shows need for some improvement and attention to detail.

uM3uMunps29rEZ2tVHA4yg.text: This is a good "old school" steakhouse that you would expect to find in any major city like Chicago or New York.  Lots of dark wood paneling, exposed stainless kitchen, linen tablecloths, attentive staff and a little pricey.  Similar to Capitol Grill or Ruth Chris.  I think it's the same group that owns P.F. Changs.  I took some friends there last night and everybody had good food and good service.  Noise can be a factor here as an adjacent large table, filled with large people with large voices were something of an irritation.  Sound seems to ricochet off of all restaurant surfaces.  Flemings is really proud of their wine list with prices to match.  Wine and several side dishes will add another $ to the price range.  You can easily have a five star night and probably wont be disappointed.

JFYVtWPg-FjTfXlgZumPQw.text: Great happy hour...7 days a week from 5-7pm at the bar.  Nice ambiance, nice bartenders, good drinks and yummy food all for $6 each.

FzWHx7elpfm6pFRjgWDHww.text: I had the Tbone last time and it was amazing. Ordered several sides, and was disappointed.  I guess you go for the steaks and not the sides.

lFI7jaOPoTYb6YzK7GvfcQ.text: A special night, one anniversary one birthday and a very disappointing evening.which was marred but very mediocre food and an overbearing waitress.  To sit and visit while enjoying your drinks was interrupted by a waitress trying to get an order while half the restaurant was empty. The food -salads OK, entrees - shrimp was dry and tasteless, scallops small plate was not inspiring, beef kabob was not good either, but my filet was very nice.  Having had good meals in the past and to go to an upscale top restaurant and receive this annoying service and less than stellar food is very disturbing and I would think it will be a long time before we return.  I was embarrassed in choosing this restaurant and felt bad that our friends had to pay so much for so little on a Thursday night.

wQCh3Ow_hxQz5E0k-qQQtw.text: Delcious and very happy that I was able to convince friends to try my rare NY strip. And now they order rare steak and love your restaurant.

K8q5O-Mu1x0Vh4MxYb-aUw.text: For my daughters 21st Birthday we decided to take the family to Flemings and DC Ranch.  We drive by this restaurant on a daily basis and yet have never given them a chance so I never knew what we were missing until now.  The atmosphere is very nice they have a bar area with TV's if you just in for an informal high quality steak and outstanding cocktails.  The service was simply outstanding we were treated like royalty and when one of the steaks delivered to the table we just a little overcooked they brought out the chef and insisted we allow them to make another.  Best part is they let us keep the mistake - thats nice when your talking a $50.00 piece of prime beef.  The ribeyes are amazing - ask for the ribeye that they bring to the table and cut off the bone for you WOW.  The wine selection was among the best in Scottsdale and the cocktails a perfect blend.  Thank you Flemmings for your fine contribution to my daughters 21st.

qj_cP8zxCHMABkFCX54bMg.text: The reason for the one star is the fact that you can NEVER get into Happy hour. People wait in line so if you get there at 5:01 you are sunk. They also save seats , so uncool. Repeated efforts are ridiculous and elbowing elderly people for a seat is not the way to go. Give me Wildfish any day!!

LljLq2SCBBxYyGi0EKjFjw.text: I think if God ever wanted a steak he would come down to Fleming's and order the Bone In Rib-eye.  Seriously Good Eats.  I am drooling a little right now just thinking about it.    Oh and then get the Fleming's Potatoes.  Like a combo of scalloped potatoes and enough cheese to choke a donkey, truly delicious.  I know the wine list is killer, but I can't stop myself from downing one (or four) of their amazing martini's.  There is a huge list of them that I have such a great time touring.    Finally, desserts!  I cannot come here without a group because after eating my steak, potatoes, (oh and great apps too, try the seafood tower, it is really tall), and drinks I don't have enough room to eat a whole dessert, let alone two because that is what I am going to order.  Yes I cannot make up my mind between Chocolate Lava Cake and Creme Brulee so I do what I do best and get both (to share of course).  They are so good and together they compliment each other perfectly.  The Lava Cake is so chocolaty that I could go into a coma and the top of the Creme Brulee cracks perfectly under my spoon.  I think I am diabetic now.  In all, this place is amazing, pricey but well worth it.  True you can come not dressed up but I like to make an occasion out of it.  You can find me in a cocktail dress with the chipmunk cheeks stuffed with food.  PS do yourself a favor and think about making a reservation, comes in handy.

_z4FLjrzOPp0wcJR5FbDnw.text: My husband and I had reservations for our anniversary last weekend. When we arrived we were informed that we had to wait for our table to become available. So we waited....and waited.....and waited.  We waited for almost an hour--the hostesses made no attempt to apologize and were rude when we inquired how much longer we would have to wait. Finally we were seated. Then, we waited and waited again...this time for someone to serve us. No one approached our table. Another couple seated after us were served immediately... My husband and I finally got tired of waiting and  left the restaurant. Don't waste your time and money on this place....there are too many other good choices in Scottsdale. I was so disappointed that our special anniversary dinner didn't happen...I won't be back and I will not be recommending this restaurant to my friends.

NNsMdSui4yi0sz5uMeSvbg.text: Not exactly what I expected. All the ranting and raving I hear about this place, well it's on the lower end of places where I would eat steak. Asked for Medium steak and received closer to medium well. Don't think I'll be visiting any time soon. Creme brulee dessert was not better than the Keg.

cj85Gb9Z3ZtdZB1wpBz-UA.text: I have a long history with Flemings...We go way back. Seattle, Washington, high school Senior Prom dinner. Yeah...That far back. That location is now closed, but I digress. When I moved to Scottsdale, I was excited immediately because there were multiple Flemings locations. It quickly became my go to special occasion dinner option, as my wife loves it as well.   In short, the food is phenomenal. I've had multiple cuts of steak there and different preparations and they're all amazing. Last time I had a 6oz Filet that was stuffed with jumbo lump crab...Just let that sink in for a minute. Their sides and salads are also really nicely done, and their wine list and bar is one of the best out there. They also have a very good happy hour which is a pretty well kept secret. It's 5 items for $6 until 7pm Monday through Friday, and they also have $6 glasses of wine and cocktails as well.   Obviously the food should be great, but the thing that sets Flemings apart for me is the service and commitment to quality. A brief story, if I may...  In July of 2011 I made reservations for my wedding anniversary. We got to the restaurant and were seated, everything started out fine. It took longer than usual to get the bread course and to get our order taken, and since it was a Wednesday night it was a little surprising. Everything was taking forever, but the biggest disappointment was the food. I ordered a New York peppercorn steak medium rare. When it came, it was well done. Brown inside and tough...I sent it back and they were apologetic for the mistake. It took nearly 20 minutes for me to get my second steak (my wife was done eating hers by this time), and while it was still overcooked for my liking, it was edible. The rest of the service continued to take way longer than necessary, the waitress wasn't attentive, and at the end of the meal, there was an issue with the bill that took another 15 minutes to resolve. It took nearly 3 hours (and not in a good way) from start to finish, and was not a good dining experience in the least.  I ended up writing Flemings the next day to express my disappointment, because it was a special occasion, and I'd never before been unhappy with the food or service I received. Within 24 hours, I had an email from the President of the company saying that he was very sorry and he'd have the GM of the restaurant reach out to me to amend any issues. The next day I got a call from the GM Mike Head and we chatted for a few minutes about our experience. He too apologized and asked me for my address so he could send something to make it right. Two days later I had a letter with a business card and a note saying "please call me personally to arrange your next reservation", along with $150 in gift certificates. I was floored.  We've since returned a few times, and the food and service was back to it's absolute best. You will rarely, if ever, see business done like this, and it's the reason I'm happy to keep Flemings as my special occasion go to.

6zgK_ejMAqSYh1kFXFExMQ.text: Might even be five stars, but it will have to wait until second visit.  I'm not usually big on steak houses.  I like to grill, and like my own preparation is better, and it's really not that hard.  I usually can't see spending a lot of cash on something I like better cooking myself.  Flemings is very good.  The filet mignon was perfectly seasoned and done medium rare.  Many steak places I have tried usually under season their meats, which leaves them bland.   They also try to cook them too quickly.   The reasons for this are really customer service; don't shock the customer, and get them their dinner quickly.    Beef should have a fair amount of time on salt to bring out flavor, and slower cooking to keep the meat tender, juicy and flavorful.  The appsy were great.  Salad, Onion soup, and mashed potatoes.    They have some great wine, although I felt they were trying to be a bit manipulative.   The wine list was ranked  gold, silver, bronze, but it was purely on price, not relative to how good they really were.   I had a better cheaper wine, than more expensive.  This is a place where I would bring my own wine, and pay corkage.

XZfTSV_eu2gsWEfg4Ra4eQ.text: As like the one in Chandler, it is more on the casual side then what we are used to in L.A.  We decided to go for our Vday dinner since they offered both set and regular menus that night.  We were gonna order from the regular menu since we usually are not fond of set menu.  However, the set menu looked pretty good and the server was trying hard to sell it so we decided to give it a try.  *Appetizer = pretty nice* *Main course = huge! and tasty. *Sides = honestly, not good *Atmosphere = louder than desired....

0LHNof0Ta0vK387efXRsrw.text: Birthday and wedding anniversary dinner on 12/24/11. Upon giving our name and reservation time the ladies offered their congratulations on our anniversary and wishes for a happy birthday! I requested a "quiet" table and we were shown to a small room off the main dining area. It had only 6 tables..nicely intimate and quiet. Our server, Nate, was at our table in an instant. He was very professional, attentive without being overbearing, knowledgeable, friendly but not too "chummy". He offered birthday and anniversary wishes as well.   Husband and I both ordered the Lobster Tails. They were perfectly cooked. I ordered the Fleming's Potatoes which were delicious..a sort of scalloped potato with cream, cheese and jalapenos. Husband ordered Sauteed Mushrooms which were also very tasty. For dessert we ordered the Creme Brulee. We ordered one but Nate came out with two desserts, each with a lit candle. The Chantilly Cream they served with the Brulee's was out of this world, crazy good! Don't miss that. After all this we were sent home with a large piece of chocolate cake to continue our celebration.  The entire experience was wonderful! Fantastic service and great food. I want to thank Nate for helping make our special dinner even more special.   Fleming's IS pricey but I felt for the service and food quality it was well worth it for a special dinner.

ai3-aX27EnBv4V8XoVPWPw.text: Excellent steakhouse overall.  Tip for those not familiar with Scottsdale - this Flemings is located in the Hilton hotel on Scottsdale Ave.  The address isn't really on the building, so it may not be super easy to find if you're just looking for the address.  I had the boneless rib eye.   I ordered it medium rare, but it was probably closer to medium, but still very flavorful, tender, and juicy.  They season only with salt and pepper to really let the True beef flavor come through.  This reminded me of the rib eye at Delmonico's (Emeril Lagasse's restaurant) inside Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas, which is also an excellent steak house.  My girlfriend got the fillet mignon (medium plus) with stuffed flounder.  Maybe because the fillet was medium plus, I really couldn't appreciate it as much.  The flounder was excellent.  Everything is a la carte, so it can get kind of pricey.  We got the lobster chowder (one of the best I've had), creamed corn (very good), sauteed spinach (excellent alternative to creamed spinach, surprisingly very good), and chocolate lava souffle for dessert (which is a must).  The bread is also really good.  I know you don't go to a steakhouse for the bread, but I can appreciate good, fresh bread with good butter.  For the 2 of us, it was $160 including the tip (and no alcohol).  Overall, a great dining experience with excellent steaks.

eilWj_yztfUBDp9haKIcMw.text: We had dinner at Flemmings last evening! What a delightful time! The atmosphere is perfect to get together with friends. I must admit,  the steaks are prepared deliciously! For dessert, I ordered the lava cake with vanilla ice cream.  This is the True test. Is the cake center gooey and warm so that the fudge runs out to be met by the vanilla ice cream?  YES! Perfect! Love this place!

L007nToUY0EYf6iFvx1cRQ.text: Let me start by saying I absolutely hate to review any business less than 5 stars. But it is extremely necessary in this circumstance.   My fiance and I had a reservation on New Years Eve. We expected the place to be packed which it was. We didn't expect to be seated right away I understand that people linger on holidays. What I didn't expect was that they were an hour and a half behind on reservations. I really wasn't even mad about that. We had several interesting conversations with other couples that were waiting so the time passed by pretty quickly.   What was really frustrating is we were sitting there for a long time. So I watched every person check in. We were also chit chatting with everyone so I knew what time each persons reservation was supposed to be at.   Two tables were open in the bar (with the white table cloth is how they described it) for a very long time these tables sat empty. Fast forward 45 minutes and the hostess asked a gentleman sitting next to me if he would like to take the table in the bar. He declined and waited for a dining room table. He was there with his girlfriend...so a table for 2 just like us. But his reservation was 30 minutes after us and he checked in way after us. The difference is he complained about the wait time. So they were trying to seat him before us. 15 minutes later the hostess offered my fiance and I that table. We took it.   No apologies for the wait.   Our server came over to greet us and said "I've been telling them to seat people in here all night"  Everyone waited a long time New Year's Eve so obviously there is mismanagement on reservations. But I watched them seat people in a very confusing order. And I was extremely mad they were going to seat a reservation 30 minutes after us. We should have been offered that option first.   To make matters worse I watched a manager yelling at a server right next to our table. Then to make it extremely worse the couple that complained about the wait got part of their meal comp'd.   Our reservation was at 915 we were seated at 1030. No apologies nothing at all.   Food was great. Amazing even. Our server was fabulous. But I will never go back. I've never seen such disorganization.

c5WgWJP4rXkxaTubK852Ww.text: Flemings never lets me down this is my choice for all my special occasions I've been coming here for over 10 years!!!!! Went for Father's Day dinner seated right away very attentive Staff including the manager  We ordered the Father's Day special which by the way was the BEST Bone in Ribeye I've ever had!!!!  The wedge is always on point,the Mac and cheese is so good that I've adapted the recipe for my own at home REALLY !!!!  They are the best !!!!High standards and reasonably priced we also ordered the Prime Rib Special it was melt in your mouth delicious!!!!! I will continue to keep my Special family events here...  For over 10 years and I haven't felt like I'm burnt out with Flemings BECAUSE they are forever changing the menu with five star choices and superb dining experiences Thank you Erica our server she was on point and very attentive hope we get you the next time we visit

Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bone in Ribeye  With Lobster tail House made stuffed Jalapeño Tater Tot&#39;s  Mouth melting Prime Rib Flemings famous Macaroni and Cheese

Wqa3YBpy3UVYZskPvNJJHw.text: We went in for dinner for my birthday, had a great time. When it turned out they lost the leftover steaks, they cooked us new ones to go. Thank you Seth!

LRn1OkmnsYjXxs3EtPw4GQ.text: There are so many better options in Scottsdale.  I took guests to Fleming's because it is proximate to the Hilton Village center.  Even though it's a chain I thought it would be a decent experience.  I was wrong.  We got stuck in the back room with crying babies everywhere (it was 8:00 pm).  And our server only seemed interested in turning over our table.  We had requested a table in the front but we were told all booths were reserved.  As we were leaving, we walked past the same two empty booths that we saw as we were coming in.    Not worth $500 to eat in a cafeteria setting.

VYOGU67EfVoFTKWSBUbISQ.text: I wish I had 4 hands so I could give this place 4 thumbs up! Great service from Paul and delicious food. Especially the lobster mashed potatoes.

hADoMh9Rd4wH-sIs-Cs2Fw.text: Time to update my review of this place.  Besides the awesome Steaks they have here, this is a great spot for happy hour.  We meet friends and associates here often for happy hour.  They have this awesome "5 for $6 'til 7" happy hour menu:  5 Wines, 5 Cocktails, 5 Appetizers, 2 Entrees, or 2 Blue Moons for $6 ea....that's an amazing deal!  We enjoy the Wines of course and some of the appetizers we get are the Roasted Pork Belly, Carpaccio, and Mushroom Ravioli.  Our fav entree is the Prime Burger w/Cheese & Bacon...it's a huge Burger for only $6.  This is a great spot for dinner or happy hour, check it out if you can.  Best part is we love to get the gift cards from Costco....$80 for $100 worth of cards....that saves us an additional 20%.  Return Factor - 100%
