Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

xPkInjoKlepxpLOEW_Jqmw.text: High end restaurant. The sides are HUGE, ribeye delicious and the molten cake is TO DIE FOR. Order it early because they make it by hand. Excellent wine selection, it's just a tad snooty for my liking. Anniversary spot for sure.

MbunSGbWfLT-pNeB7UglYg.text: This steak house delivers every time. The warm bread with the cheese spread was scrumptious. The wine list is extensive. The steaks were absolutely splendid. In our party someone ordered the brunch choice and loved it. Service was top notch. Ambiance was just right. Will definitely return and enjoy their steaks again.

iWdLgCpJP_abzYUV6ScPRw.text: I moved here from Chicago and I had to find a great steak house...I chose Flemmings because they were the only place around my area...I came in and I was seated right away even for a Saturday.  The waiter was so nice on top of everything and always checking on me to see how I was. The steak is perfect definitely to my liking. I felt like a princess how I was being treated. Will come back again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

lgfxUX2IjBuqWJY5g847Dg.text: This restaurant redeemed itself tonight.  My last visit was not quite a disaster but close. I was by myself tonight with a 5:30 reservation.  Wasn't excited about being seated in a small back room but probably would have been reseated if I'd asked. I started out with a Macallan 12.  Don't think I've ever been charged over $20 for one but it was a reasonable pour. Calamari for an appetizer.  Cooked perfectly and could have easily been shared. The wedge salad had plenty of good blue cheese.  I don't think it mentioned the type of lettuce but it wasn't a crispy iceberg like most. My strip steak was closer to medium than the medium-rare I asked for but it was a delicious piece of meat.  Very flavorful and more tender than a strip usually is. Loaded baked potato was done just right.  It too would have been plenty to share. The table assistants were really in the ball.  My server, not quite as attentive as I'd expect at a restaurant in this price range ($120.00). Overall I'd give tonight's dinner a 9 on food and an 8 on service.  Huge improvement over my last visit.

7LE-swDFvktVf33FEN5dow.text: I cannot recommend this place highly enough! We had a very special family event that Megan and Seth made easy and perfect for us. The food was outstanding, the services was excellent, and the ambiance was lovely. Chef Jeff is a genius (and Seth actually brought him out to meet us) and Justin, our server, was down-to-earth, professional and attentive. Seth also helped with a red wine recommendation that was smooth and delicious. For all of this, I actually consider their prices a bargain. Thank you all for making this once-in-a-lifetime celebration so perfect!

Vpwe_809LC4EB4FFAcFMiw.text: Had an amazing experience with server, Tommy Warren. He's extremely knowledgeable about wine and the menu was attentive yet let us enjoy our conversation. The food is also fantastic but Tommy is a reason to return for sure.

Eo7Qxp4ks-IFZQe5tVIxow.text: Wonderful food. Just did not give 5 stars because it took a long time to get water and bread (30 min). Other than that, best steak around.

oZFIAGzYpqoC6MdUthu0CA.text: Amazing restaurant! Took my brother there for his birthday and not only did they give a dessert, the manager came over, introduced himself, and gave us a gift card! Our server was wonderful too. Can't wait to to back. The food is over the top excellent. A++

Yi9qfzmkUu8qiXrZ1jY7Ng.text: Good service and food. Exactly what you would expect from a high end steakhouse, but nothing out of the ordinary.

lsRkB4zaChRU5UwRkU7Z7w.text: EVERYTHING from the wait staff to the drinks to the apps to the steaks was top notch. I was surprised when the Uber pulled up and it was attached to a Hilton but it turned out to be a great surprise. Everyone in our party was impressed with the food and ambiance and we're tough customers because we hail from a very foodie town. If you want a great experience, try Fleming's!

mAzi-ZPUyCWLQlWW8gs_5Q.text: Love Fleming's and this location! This is our special occasion stop. The food and service is always outstanding. Ask for Jason he will take good care of you. He has been there a long time.

akY36atbzm_66SA32HoYmw.text: Would've been a 5 star but we had an 8 o'clock reservation and at about 8:15 we were offered a seat on the patio or to continue to wait for a table to free up. However, our server, Jason, was attentive and very personable. The patio turned out to be just fine, surprised that more people didn't sit out there. The food was excellent, I got the filet mignon chef special and it was perfection. They also surprised our friend with a small gift as we were celebrating his bachelor party. Overall it was a pleasant experience and I would highly recommend it for anyone in search of an elegant place to enjoy a steak. The lobster mac and cheese was also done very well and would recommend that as well.

qiL7Mv5KZZh3hRDaSmiwQw.text: Ive been to a few Flemings in my life and added the recently remodeled Scottsdale to the list.  My wife and I came here the other day and had a wonderful dinner experience.   When you go to Fleming's it's all about the steak. I usually stick with the fillet mignon cooked medium but decided to try the Wagyu New York strip. I learned that Wagyu is the American way of Kobe beef, so I had to try it! I was very impressed, the steak was tender and very flavorful. It's a more deeper flavor than the fillet. I think I would actually order it medium rare next time though as the closer to the center of the strip the more flavorful it became. Overall a great piece of meat.  My wife ordered the Sunday prime rib special. Talk about a deal...she got a wedge salad, thick cut of prime rib, mash potatoes to share, and a dessert! All for $40..really for the amount of food and quality you can't beat that. We ended up sharing the lava cake which was amazing...even was served with ice cream.   We also shared the chipotle Mac n cheese, so good I was in heaven!   Service was great usual and ambiance was very nice.

q2ZIEBnlgEcLdtx-E2RmRg.text: A group of four dined here on Sunday evening for the Prime Rib special. A great deal if everything is good including the service. On this evening the service was slow... our dinner took 2 1/2 hours from start to finish. No bread for the first 30 minutes even after asking. Requested the wedge salads be chopped before bringing out and they were not. My wife found a hair in the Prime Rib which ruined her evening. Overall, a big disappointment but the desserts were excellent.

6v9rgi4BCaYJNFp2tTAYuA.text: We had a 7:30pm res for 6 with a stroller ( baby was very good and slept pretty much the whole time) They didn't sit us until 8:00pm ( the restaurant was empty ). SERVICE was epic. The server ( name rhymes with harrah ) was awesome!   We ordered a bone in filet. 20 mins after we ordered they said they ran out of bone in filet. This was Friday night at the end of high season in central Scottsdale. Shame on Flemings for not sticking their # 1 entree and shame on Preston the GM for not coming by. I'm 38 and well to do, if your not 49 years old + and or have gray hair you get treated like a worthless millennial. The bill was $800 for 6 people. This over rated restaurant and their useless upper level management needs to be replaced. I'm not coming back.....

pMEfnOQt9ICWridQVtSDKA.text: I will make this short and sweet. Unfortunately, I did not share more pictures of the food because we were too busy eating it, and there are enough pictures already. I will say this: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse-Scottsdale is slightly behind Donovan's Steak & Chop House - Phoenix, but it is WAYYYYYY better than Mastro's Restaurants - City Hall. However, all the steakhouses in Arizona pale in comparison to Bern's Steak House in Tampa, FL (the best tasting steak and the best bang for your buck out of all the restaurants we have visited).  My wife ordered the taste of the seasons: Filet Mignon and scallops Salad Puff pastries (like beignets) with in-house whipped cream  My order: Main Filet Mignon (Oscar style with shrimp as well) Asparagus Molten Lava Cake  Overall, we enjoyed it.  My wife really loved the pistachio cookies that accompany the cake & vanilla ice cream.  I would come back to let my daughter experience it, and also they have a Prime Rib deal every Sunday (which comes with a salad, your choice of side, and your choice of dessert) for $35.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Filet Mignon Oscar style.

w2cC_VyWgaPYd6ftYmXFkw.text: We celebrated our 33rd wedding anniversary one evening and the experience was unforgettable.  My wife enjoys a good steak and so, I thought of Fleming s. I've been to Ruth Chris', but heard so much about Fleming s that I decided to give them a try.  From the moment we walked in, we were treated like regulars. We sat at a booth which was nice and comfy. Our server was Nick who was very friendly, pleasant and  was very knowledgeable, but he cleared more utensils that he needed to and forgot to bring the two knives that were removed.  We weren't rushed and had enough time to decide on our meal. My wife started with a glass of Pinot Noir and since I'm allergic to alcohol, I had water.  The appetizer, Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes was not jumbo, but the crab and sauce flavors were. The salad, Lettuce Wedge, you were given a slice of bacon and blue cheese which you had to crumble yourself and my wife's Modern Caesar Salad was excellent. Main course, Newport Filet and Main Filet with a side of sauteed mushrooms were cooked to perfection and the button mushrooms are the ones I like instead of the sliced ones.  We followed the evening meal with the Turtle Pie and coffee which capped off a wonderful anniversary dinner. By the time we finished our first cup, Nick was right there filling our coffee cups again.  The manager came to our table several times to check on us, was friendly and gave us an incentive to come back which we will definitely use. We only saw our server once during our meal. The bus boy was terrific, he brought our missing pair of knives and kept our water glasses filled and cleared our table for us. Everyone there was so friendly and was not your typical stuffy high-end restaurant atmosphere.

sgBAYOEG5AgWpHd4L_fDdQ.text: Really good food with exceptional service as well.   Took clients out for dinner and this is where we ended up. The meal was perfect.  started with the seafood tower, Came with Lobster Tail and Crab Legs, Yum i had to order a second tower as well cause it was to die for.  for my meal i went with the Lamb Chops. The bite as perfect and juicy. Ordered it medium rare. i didn't even have to use any sauce with it as well. it was perfectly cooked as it.   I over stuffed myself with food because of the taste and how fresh the meat was, Tender just the way i liked it. the chew was soft and went down easily.  There service is on point and some of the best service that i have seen yet, this place deserves a 5 star rating.  If your in the area and looking to be wined and dined, then this is your spot, its nice and quiet here so you don't have to speak up or listen in to hear the other person.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

3ldZj2F8c7GGf-XaLOjLrA.text: Prime for Prime Rib!  We once again had a fabulous dinner at Flemings.  During the summer months they offer Prime Rib Mondays-and at a reduced price.  Best deal in town.  Salad, Prime Rib, a side and dessert for less than $30.00.  UNBELIEVABLE!  Brandon, our server, was attentive but not intrusive-the perfect compliment to a delicious meal.  Every bite was bursting with flavor.  We also enjoyed the complimentary wine tasting and bought a delightful bottle as a result!

5_Y8Gshm1DEnRmGFEcjZfQ.text: We came here for dinner on a Wednesday night, without a reservation but we were seated promptly. All of the staff was friendly and greeted us warmly. Our server Mackenna was very attentive and sweet. The food was cooked perfectly and the flavors were robust and delicious. We had mushroom ravioli, petit filet (cooked perfectly), truffle mashed potatoes, asparagus, and amazing lava chocolate dessert. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious lava cake!

4kQvx-bYXmo1gsSNCSVR-A.text: Returned to Flemings again tonight after the bad experience in March and what a turn around! We had a very good experience...everything was really perfect. Super piece of Chilean Sea Bass and Waygu Strip Steak both cooked superbly after two interesting salads.  We split an order of Fleming's potatoes, which was smart, otherwise we would not have had room for the Belgian chocolate lava cake. Throw in a fine glass of Pinot Noir and a white blend from France called The Whip and we could hardly walk to our car. Overall, it really was a great dinner. One important component to tonight's dinner was the great service we received from Sara Flanigan our server. Thanks to her for the friendly and efficient service.   Finally Thanks to Darrin Visser and his colleagues for stepping up and taking good care of us, this is what we have come to expect from Fleming's.   Five stars tonight gang!

hySewe6iVN0D_LjM_P-5Wg.text: A friend and I are on a quest to find the best steak in the Valley, so every time we meet for dinner, we choose a different steak place to try. Our visit to Fleming's was far below my expectations.   I had heard wonderful things about Fleming's for their happy hour, and, indeed, the happy hour has some great options. I'll return for that. Service was decent; we remained at the bar. And there was a fantastic wine selection with reasonable prices.   However, when it comes to steak: mine was overcooked (I ordered it medium) and not sufficiently trimmed (I got a filet). Sides were unmemorable.

KXk9-6E9Tqh0QvNNFjJDfQ.text: Most happy hours in the valley are more or less the same. Same especially in the sense they all post prices for happy hour.  The one unhappy exception is Flemings by the Hilton on Scottsdale road.  But hey it's a steak house with a decent reputation , why not try it.  And we did.  And we were very disappointed.  Our waitress told us Absolute vodka was the happy hour vodka.  So given that we ordered a round....on the rocks and with soda. We had friends with us so when I saw $10 for each vodka while paying the bill I  was a bit peeved.  So I get home and call Flemings and speak to the bartender and he says "No sir, what you ordered are not happy hour items". What???    Bottom line nobody knows what they are doing.  Will never go back even with their good onion rings but very small happy hour burger.  They better educate staff when asked a direct question about the menu.  Sure not the worst thing that can happen in life but it's irritating.

alphe8IQghBmyc-MLpV-3w.text: Their happy hour specials in the bar make Fleming's prices palatable. Though you may have to wait for a table, it is well worth it.  Their $7 hamburger and fries happy hour special is FANTASTIC. A juice prime beef patty cooked just the way you like it (even medium rare, if you are so inclined!). The huge patty is served on a roll, with lettuce, tomato and your choice of cheese. Pickles are only by request, why??  Happy Hour beers on tap are a great way to round out a cheap and fantastic meal at Fleming's during happy hour!  If you can find a seat on the patio, you can sit near their open fireplace.   Their main menu is ala carte everything... steak, potato, salad, side dish... The steaks are great and the side potatoes are huge.

KFhVSPcV9VFTO98JC6IbTQ.text: Are you kidding me? Charge the high prices but please .... can your Server Kristen not be On another planet? I'm hoping she was either high or recovering from a night out, because if that is really her work ethic.... She's need a job at Burger King, not a five star restaurant.....If she has a disability...I Truely apologize. Baring that, please let this girl move on to another service industry. Food was terrific, service was horrifying. My husband and I each ordered a glass of wine, she brought one glass and served it to our Son. Ordered Lobster Tails, she never came back & checked on us so I received drawn butter with 2 bites to go.  I assume the "Manager" came to ask us how our meal was....I had to ask her for another glass of wine for my husband & myself, she brought it to us....Still have not see our Server Kristen.   Did not leave our normal 20%+ Hopefully Kristen will get the drift.... Overly Priced Poor Service Everything is Ala-Cart so expect, like       Us a 300.00 tab if you actually want        A full meal, God help you if you want       A salad !! Hold on to your Wallet! Better choices all around the area, let this one go!

U-oIfpvU_Wyvg6ZHDqMYAQ.text: If you're craving a juicy, aged steak cooked to perfection, and wonderful a la carte side dishes, call Fleming's for reservations. They are usually at full capacity, and you may wait for your food, but the servers are excellent, and it's a place to enjoy the ambiance and wine. The extensive wine list is on an interactive iPad that includes the wine ratings and pairing suggestions. Although, I usually prefer the filet mignon, the seafood is exceptional, and the apple-mustard pork chop is delicious, however I have found the chicken disappointing. The best sides to share are the Fleming's cheesy potatoes with jalapenos, Chipotle mac & cheese, creamed spinach, and grilled asparagus. It is also a nice place take someone for their birthday as Fleming's will present them with a small signature box of chocolates and gift card for return visit. One interesting note is that the well drinks have a large round ice cube, which although very trendy, it does fill the whole glass leaving very little of the pricy drinks. Steaks range from $40. to $60. and sides (for two) are $11.

Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fleming&#39;s Wine List iPad, with wine ratings, pairing suggestions and more

1PlQsXSHPQuBvfNcItilBg.text: Great Service. Great Food. Always done perfect. Thanks to Fleming's for a great night out with the family.

4I6-Hf9AuI4f_OCigcUZGQ.text: Great food, excellent service. We were here for a birthday as well as a homecoming for a military member. Flemings went all out with making us all feel special. Truly a class act. The waiter Joseph was extremely friendly as well as helpful and went way above and beyond to make it a special evening. Thank you Joseph and Flemings for a memorable evening.

PzlQtgxz0MJUZBSKNSXMuw.text: Restaurant is totally remodeled  Very modern but comfortable. Menu is tweaked for the better. A lot more options. Wine pours come in 3,6,9 ounces now.  Ask for Tommy and or Vasily great waiters.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wedge salad. Bacon is sweet n spicy  huge slice of bleu cheese
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 12 oz medium rare filet

h3ccasJ2LnIhcBn_4i36hQ.text: Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful service. I am currently active duty military visiting family from out of town, and a trip to flemings started my vacation off right! The food was absolutely wonderful. Best service I have ever received. Joseph was our waiter, I would highly recommend him. :)

DAGIdYLAd-10zEcsWIDXww.text: Strange night, poor service for the price. Good food. We sat at the bar for 1/2 hour past our reservation time. Even the bar tender thought we were just hanging out at the bar for the night, we should have just ate there. I inquired as to when we would be seated and the hostess said my party of two was next. Not two minutes later she came and took a different party of two to their seats. We finally got seated and we're lead into a mostly empty room. Don't know why we have been waiting for so long. Small detail but we were hungry, the bread basket came out after our dinners were served. This was after we asked twice for the bread. Bread was brought out to another table but not us. I informed the manager of our experience and he apologized for it all. It's not what he wanted to hear but it was what it was and hopefully they get together to make sure nobody has an experience like this. It should be and probably is a better place than what we experienced. We just won't be back. There are other steak restaurants in the vicinity that we feel provides a better all around experience.

Alz2dmdy-yHuPGJl_7xo-g.text: Brought my dad here, while visiting, for a belated Father's Day celebration. I took heed of the chandler location reviews and went to Scottsdale. It didn't disappoint!! The food was AMAZING! Steaks cooked and seasoned perfectly, sides delicious! Deserts to die for!!! Service was perfect! Attentive enough without being too overbearing. Only complaint was the bread was too toasted. Prefer warm but not crunchy. As always, Flemings did not disappoint and my husband and I are already fantasizing about our next Flemings dinner!!! I find it way better than their competitor...the one that serves steaks on a 500 degree plate!!

DwChV8CTkhbNVFAu30DGOQ.text: Our most recent Fleming's visit brought us to the Scottsdale location. I had called a couple hours in advance to check on their expected availability and the hostess was a step ahead, offering to help me set a reservation. Once we arrived, all the service was excellent. McKenna, our server, was perfect. Friendly, warm, professional -- of course the food was great but service like hers is what made this a worthwhile outing.   We had a couple drinks, the calamari (good -- on the sweet side but that is how they advertise it), loaded baked potato, steaks, lobster tail, and the lava cake (GET THE LAVA CAKE IT IS TOO MUCH BUT YOU'LL BE SO GLAD YOU DID!). Everything was great. Honestly, I was actually a little surprised because chain places tend to slip somewhere but Fleming's was on point.

walBlhor_55JqGNKDJtbaw.text: *This review is for Happy Hour*  My family and I recently stopped in to Fleming's for happy hour to celebrate my father in law's birthday.  Note there are two happy hours now...from 5-7pm they have $6 cocktail or appetizer offerings (5 selections for $6 til 7) and 8-10pm are $9 appetizers and drinks (8 selections for $9 til 10).  With prices like that, what do you have to lose? We ordered one of everything.  The dishes are on the small side, but the quality is True to what you'd expect at Fleming's, so it was good bang for our buck.  We tried the calamari, carpaccio, butternut squash ravioli, pork belly and burrata.  All of it was delicious, and we got a second serving of the squash and calamari!  A couple of folks in our party tried cocktails and beers too, and they were very well received.    Tip: Happy hour is served in the bar area only, and it's pretty limited seating.  Arrive early if you don't want to wait!

uGrpukX6kP_99B6gTz0aTQ.text: The best Happy Hour in Town...Darrin, Frank, Abe, Julie are the best

pThP1Q2zQRQoMl2bsMC5LQ.text: My friend, my wife and I went for happy hour. Two martinis, a cosmo and 4 happy hour dishes and great servers. I used to work for tips, so I overdo it. Nonetheless I paid $60 total!

7_KPCk-huSHRXcLaoDoLaQ.text: My husband & I went there on a Saturday night after I left a bridal shower we were in town for.  I picked up my hubby @ the hoteI for a little bit of a romantic date & found Fleming's on YELP.  We arrived about 9pm & sat at the bar.  WHAT A DELIGHT!  They have an amazing wine list on ipads for you to peruse.  Very informative & includes numerous pairing possibilities for every item on the list.  The small plates are perfect for a late night bite & more than enough for me as an entree'. We paired the dessert with the reccommended port & all I can say is it was heavenly!  Our server was absolutely fantastic!  Attentive & personable.  Such an enjoyable evening we can't wait to go there again!

iiploEB2fry_bKAjWsXgiQ.text: We had the best server... name was Scott.  I ordered the prime rib after swallowing our appetizer, the shrimp  (forgot the official name...!) and it was delish!  If you're looking for a well-made dirty martini, this is the place to go!

Ur49ST6CWXNofUWXGqahaw.text: I draw two conclusions from reading the rest of the reviews: a) most people wouldn't know good ( no less great! ) food if they were ever to experience it; and, b) more people judge the quality of a restaurant by its happy hour than by its food.  Because I was a first-timer at this establishment, the manager came to my table, introduced himself, and inquired as to my satisfaction with my dining experience.  I politely sugarcoated it, later regretting that I did not tell him what I am about to share with you.  I did that because most people really do not want your honest opinion and will instinctively dig their heels in and defend themselves against every criticism you may voice regardless of how well intentioned you may be.  I wasn't looking for a debate and I didn't want to heap criticism upon him over something of which he presumably is proud.  The one star I gave this place was for the service - which was excellent.  From there we start deducting stars.  Flemings needs to hire an acoustical engineer to suggest ways of lower the deafening sound levels in the place (6:30 on a Sunday evening in July).  I couldn't hear half of what the servers said to me - I just nodded approval or agreement.  A small loaf of bread was provided - with two spreads: a garlic butter and another, orange in color. I sampled a bit of each on the end of a fork and found the primary ingredient of the orange substance was some sort of thick, heavy grease that coated one's tongue and the roof of one's mouth.  Terrible! I stuck with the garlic butter.  I chose a Caesar salad, and even though there was hardly any dressing on it, I ate every bit of it.  It was OK.  A appreciated touch here was the option of having anchovies on your salad.  When was the last time you had that choice?  The prime rib came with three dips: a mustardy concoction which I didn't care for (which doesn't mean it was not good), creamed horseradish (very good), and aj-jus. The latter had absolutely NO flavor, leaving me to wonder how something with so much color could possibly have no more flavor than tap water.  The beef was the size of my hand - a respectable portion - and light pink in color, just as I had specified.  It looked delicious.  However, it was dry and firm/tough/chewy.  I ate less than half and turned down the offer to package the rest for my trip home.  What could I do with it to salvage it at home?!?!  The single side dish I ordered was mushrooms.  The server did not say how they would be prepared: broiled, sauteed, etc.  And, while the cooking method was not apparent, they were rich dark brown  buttons, and a portion that was large to share with two others.  They had been prepared mixed with whole garlic cloves.  The problem: they were tasteless, despite the presence of the garlic and what I took for melted butter.  By then I was ready to leave and declined the included dessert.  My waitress, however, suggested I take with me a portion of the mixed berry option on the dessert list.  I did, and consumed the pleasant mix the following morning at breakfast.  But, I did not use the separately packaged "whipped cream" accompaniment, as it - like the orange colored prime rib dip - was made of fat/grease that tended to coat the tongue and mouth.  When I encounter something like that, I can't help but think how it coats one's arteries, too!   Sorry, Flemings.  I went with such high expectations and left throughly disappointed.

sh27T8-SJznN2wG0uFGBpg.text: Amazing steakhouse with a lot of delicious options. The ribeye steak was very tasty and cooked exactly as ordered. The Fleming's salad is so good and the walnut turtle pie is one of he best deserts I have ever enjoyed. Table service is top notch but the ambience needs some improving, as its too dark and noisy inside.

SY_fILVsf_QddnTNr1eifA.text: Now I know what everyone thinks, "This is a chair restaurant, why are you bothering with a review?"  Well, two reasons, one they have amazing service and two - I ate the MOST outstanding burger since I moved to AZ.  I arrived at 6:30 - waiting patiently for my 2 friends who were leaving the country for good, a little goodbye party.   My waitress was the sweetest person I had met and she really cared about her job and the tables she was dealing with.  I couldn't help but love her.  I ordered food and drink off the Happy Hour Menu - and let me stop here to explain this amazing situation: $5 food, martinis and wine - ARE YOU SERIOUS?  (as a heart attack) Anyway I was still waiting on my very late friends and wanted to stick in their 2 drinks before happy hour ended - and the lovely waitress ordered them, but waited to bring them, because she doesn't want them to have warm drinks - Can you believe this amazing service?  Lets move into the Burger, with peppered bacon and cheddar cheese.  Huge onion ring, and a little wedge for my burger.  I have no clue what sauce was served, but it was outstanding too.  I scarfed half the burger and could barely save the second half for my BFF (who still wasn't there).  The BBQ Shrimp, Calamari and Ahi Tuna all were amazing and I cannot rave enough.   I really appreciate staff and the restaurants they work at that go that extra mile.  They easily could have made me pay full price for the additional 2 beverages, but they didn't and its those little gifts that earn a review like this and a pat on the back!!

8hkQI8jfJnleilvnRbt_CQ.text: I love love love their Happy Hour 5 for 6 until 7 seven days a week! They change up the happy hour menu a few times a year, but you could never go wrong! My first time at this particular location and I enjoyed the ambiance and the great customer service! This location also had an IPad wine menu that paired your meal with particular wines! It was pretty awesome!

T04jorAIdyZAaZiAO_fBNg.text: Okay so normally I don't leave many reviews unless I want to warn people not to go somewhere but I was just reading through these reviews and was surprised to see 1 star reviews due to customer service and being judged because of the way a person looks or dress. Now I've been to this location numerous times but granted I did dress in a long sleeve express shirt, jeans and a pair of buckle dress shoes. Not the nicest outfit compare to what people said that if you didn't have a suit on then you didn't get service but I decided to put it to the ultimate test and by the way every man should own 1 nice outfit at least but that is besides the point so here is what I did.   I decided to go as casual as I could. I literally wore a pair of dark grey slack shorts, with a Hurley shirt and pair of old school D.C. Shoes. Now take into consideration I"m covered in tattoos as well. I had nothing nice on and even wore my ever day citizen watch which I bought at Costco for 250 bucks along with my hundred dollar gift card for 80 bucks which is always a must if you going to Fleming's. Now we went on Sunday for the Prime Rib special and only drank WATER besides a Heineken I ordered after already sitting the second time my waitress came by. Now I keep track of how many times our waitress and her helpers check on us and after 12 times I decided to stop counting. We never had an empty glass of WATER, we never didn't have service, food or anything else we needed. At one point my glass almost got half way empty before it was filled up. Our waitress was amazing and knew the menu back and forth and also was kind enough to suggest any specials they were offering. The manager on hand came by to make sure our meal was to our expectations and stayed to chat with us for a while.   When our meal was done our waitress had our extra food bagged and it was not because it was a slow nice. Every table in the main dining area was full and she had her hands full. The service and food was amazing and if you looking for a nice night out and an amazing steak with specials almost all the time and a casual atmosphere then Fleming's is a place for you. Out the door for 3 Prime Rib Specials that included a soup or salad, a side (which for an extra 8 dollars we upgraded to the lobster mash potatoes which were amazing and would recommend doing if they are serving it) a big Prime Rib and dessert for 39.99, plus coffee & beer we only paid $146.00 and of course left 190.00 for the superb service. If you going somewhere nice it's just part of eating. Tip your servers if they work their butts off. Was a great night out with my mom and girl and will be back again soon. Thanks Fleming's.

GuApumOU8nhVX32WQUdSNw.text: Came here for AZ Restaurant Week. This place was completely packed on a Tuesday night, but we'd made reservations ahead of time so we were immediately seated. This place is dimly lit, but not to the extreme where you cannot read the menu without your server pulling out a pen light. That's annoying so things were already off to a great start.   Everything was delicious. I loved the sun-dried tomato butter that came with the bread. We had very generous servings of the french onion soup. It's the best I've had. It was very flavorful. We ordered the lamb and the fillet Mignon. Both were pretty good. I'm not sure what to think of the mint sauce that came with the lamb. I didn't love it, but I didn't hate it either. We ended off the night stuffing ourselves with a creme brulee and chocolate mousse. We find it hard to say no to dessert.   The service was great. Our glasses of water and wine were never empty and our courses were fairly well timed.   I hear they have a great happy hour and I liked the bar area so we will certainty be back for drinks.

AzMfnBXXjKmHxTNQiAo9_w.text: Is it Five Star day or am I just in a good mood?  PF Changs...PeiWei...Teneko's...Flemings?  How does Fleming's fit in with the whole asian themed restaurant empire thingy that Peter Fleming put together?  I don't know...more importantly, I don't care...Fleming's Steakhouse is the best of the lot by my lights:)  Does Fleming's make the best steak in town?   Well no, the best steak in town comes off my grill, when I'm in the mood to grill:)  But I'm not always in the mood to grill my own steak and when I'm not, Flemings consistently puts a very solid medium rare Rib Eye ( with a little salad and a few string fries) right in front of me (along with a couple of well made Grey Goose marti's:)  They do it in a friendly style with  exemplary and easy going service in a warm and welcoming atmosphere...lighter decor than some of the very low lit/dark wood/red velvet steakhouses (BTW...not enough light to read the menu doesn't make the steak taste any better:)  Flemings has never done me wrong...  I have never felt "optimized" like I do at Ruth's Chris...I haven't felt that I overpaid for mediocre food like I do at Morton's or Mastro's...I never feel that I'm out of place when I show up wearing my shorts, sandals and golf shirt (exquisitely tailored, highly expensive shorts, sandals and golf shirt, but nevertheless:)  Flemings is a comfortable and pleasant place to grab a steak:)  The Beautiful Carin and I wandered over the other evening, intending to take advantage of the current Happy Hour specials (5 items for $6...5 wines, 5 cocktails and five small plates, each priced at $6...all of which are phenomenal, BTW:)  But after a couple of well crafted and astonishingly cold marti's, we decided we wanted dinner:)  I had the bone in Rib Eye and Carin had the New York Strip (my girl likes her steak:)  We split some shoestring potatoes and grilled asparagus:)  Everything was essentially perfect...a little too much food, but we took it home and DeeDee continues to believe that we are The Best People Ever:)  The next time you're in the mood for steak and you don't feel like heading out to your grill on a balmy 112 degree Scottsdale evening, put on your shorts and golf shirt, slide into your sandals, get comfy in a booth at Flemings and build yourself a $200 credit card bill.  Hey, I never said they were cheap...just good!

rtnh0pwrW8oi33-8TsXLhg.text: I've been to Flemings in Boston as well as this location, and they always do a great job.  I went last night to celebrate buying a new house with my fiancee. Not only did the hostess congratulate us, but our waiter Nate (who was fantastic) did the same; Jeff the manager even came over to congratulate us as we'll and gave us a gift card for our next visit. The food was spot on (bone in ribeye, porcini rubbed filet), but the extra touch from the staff/mgmt blew us away. We will definitely be back soon!

eaWtQkT0CHB8gMn4JBoxQA.text: Going to Fleming's used to be a nice occasion.  On this past visit, this restaurant's food had gone down hill quite a bit (we had the same experience in Palo Alto on their prime rib night).  Wine list has been greatly pared down, and there was nothing we really wanted.  Scratch this one off the list.

a1zal5gG00IKTor5g_TKXw.text: Thank the lord there is a Fleming's in Scottsdale! I am here for school for the week and am so happy there are great restaurants in this nice town. Lucky me, my bf is in town for work so I can FINALLY take him to this place that I have been raving out (see Nashville review for more details on the menu).  They give you two cheese dips here with sliced cracker/bread and celery sticks. One of them being a gorgonzola cranberry spread. DELICIOUS.  We ordered:  TENDERLOIN CARPACCIO - Although I remember it being tastier in the Nashville chain, this is still very good and better than any I have had in California thus far.  SEARED AHI TUNA - love it! This restaurant (not Japanese sushi joints) is why I am so hooked on tuna. Ironic isn't it? My bf loves this too.  BEEF FLEMINGTON filet wrapped in puff pastry with a mushroom duxelle, madeira sauce - This is by far my FAVORITE MEAT dish EVER! They cook it to perfection (remember I am a medium-rare girl), and it simply MELTS IN YOUR MOUTH. The combination of the tender filet and the buttery pastry is HEAVEN in your mouth. My bf LOVED this too and felt it was an exceptional dish. Ratings for this are up there with Nobu.   SEARED SCALLOPS lobster cream sauce with a puff pastry of sauted fresh vegetables - My bf thought this was very good but not as good as the Beef Flemington. We had the ultimate BEST SEARED SCALLOPS in Paris (at an average restaurant too), so it would be hard to have something that is up to par with that. Still a nice tasty dish. I love those puff pastries.  CHOCOLATE LAVA CAKE - This is the second best lava cake next to the Culinary Institute of America in Napa. HEAVENLY, FRESH, RIGHT OUT OF THE OVEN. Delicious! And they don't cheat at this one. No hole on the bottom of the cake to put the filling in! I love bittersweet chocolate. Ummmm.  The wine selection is great. They recommended a smooth Italian red wine for us (I think it was a sirah). The service is great. Despite how large the restaurant is, the high quality of their dishes remain the same. After eating here, then eating at Alexander's (Cupertino, CA -- see my review =D) back home makes any other steakhouse taste mediocre.

1JkY2bXG8VeUtPHl2rRscQ.text: incredible happy hour at the bar!  the burgers are delicious as are the bbq shrimp!

VjPVk5owB2F_EL_OmPHu5w.text: We have a ton of top notch steakhouses in Chicago and even though there's a fairly-recently opened Fleming's down the street from me, we decided to check out this one because we were in town and said, why the hell not?   (Let me tell you something I love about Arizona: in Chicago, you could never get away with wearing a t-shirt, shorts, sandals and a straw fedora to a steakhouse. But, luckily for me, things seem to be more lax in AZ. Also, lucky for me because my bags were on my original flight back to Chicago and I, clearly, was not.)  Anyway, my buddy and I sat in the bar section, where it was a little more lively, so we could catch some highlights and relax. Everything I ordered was superb. Started off with a perfectly made No. 10 martini (kudos) and then went with the Wedge. The blue cheese dressing was excellent. Then I, of course, went right for the Bone-In Ribeye (med. rare). When it came out, it was as if God, himself, was speaking directly to me. Perfectly cooked, pefectly marbled, great cut of beef. I don't even remember what sides we ordered, it didn't matter. Either way, Flemings: they know how to make a drink, they know how to cook a steak, and they're pretty cool about the whole thing. Go there.

Tcsm-8AizJj7tPiustg8Hg.text: Food was good, service was great. Being able to make a reservation on Yelp = amazing.

XTqtRksvRd1qdwIw3oeHdA.text: WOW!  Fleming's delivered in spades!  This is my favorite place to eat in Phoenix.  The food is exceptional, the wine list is out of this world, and the dress is casual!  It is a bit pricey for me, but man is it worth it.  I have never had a better Fillet and all of their wines are very well picked and represent a wide range of pricing and styles.  I can't go there often, but man am I happy when I do!

0Ftacn3anTRRybi55Z6aZw.text: I dined at Fleming's recently on the insistence of a friend, and while the service was good, I thought the food was shockingly high priced for what it was.   I had a small filet. It was correctly cooked and tasted very good. Just like I make at home when I buy steaks from AJ's. The reason I was not very happy was that my bill was around $80 for a small filet, a couple glasses of wine and a couple shared mediocre appetizers with two other people. No sides come with the meat at all. My steak was close to $30 alone. For a place that bills itself as a wine bar, I was disappointed with the by-the-glass choices. I guess if you are only searching for a good-tasting steak and you don't know how to cook, Fleming's is the place to go.    Guess that's what you get with the "lowest common denominator" style big national chains. I would not steer most people away from here, as I think this is what most people want: predictable and decent. I just figure I don't want to spend my money or calories on boring food when there are so many awesome local restaurants in this city!

ZrqgcDLMR81q-43LcW2lWA.text: As always....Flemings was perfect.  Go here in Scottsdale and La Jolla---always perfect!  Best steak ever...and I know a chain..but seriously amaze! :)  If there's a Flemings around--I never seek out another steak place because we have a great time always.  Even saw TW and Wil Ferrel one night at La Jolla..hahaha ;)

PW5oZemDUfYZvUsxdYvS0g.text: Have eaten MANY times @ Flemings.  Only sat in the bar at the South Scottsdale location, but sat in the dining room last weekend.  From the time we sat down and cold air was blowing on us, it was a disaster.  Still have GC for them so will use it up at DC Ranch location which has much better dining room service.

GUnGorNmG7vdwhznJ9qiiw.text: I was impressed w/ Flemings! Gr8 steak place! The bartenders are fun! They have those wine glasses tht a whole bottle can fit into b/c we thought we were getting short a wine thy proved us wrong! I will b bk :o)

1NMU_WzmL8P53pYJiK0vvQ.text: I almost never eat steak.  When the mood strikes, this is where I usually come.  I like the atmosphere, the prices are fair, and the food and service are great.

PEeA2d5FM89W-tj87cUlhA.text: Just about as good as a steak house can get, this place would be right at home in NY, Chicago or even DC.  First and foremost, excellent meat.  All the other goodies that go into making a good steak into a great steak house experience were there too.  Nice decor, open an dinviting.  Great service.  Huge wine list with options from budget to Bill Gates.  Creamed spinach and chocolate lava cake.  All good things.  Suprisingly, its a chain.  There is another in Tucson that is just as good.

udBQB_ReFD_AoXhweWUq5g.text: We just moved to Scottsdale. Celebrating my husband's birthday, we had many local places to check out but he chose Fleming's, tried and True celebration destination. We have been to many various Fleming's locations and service/food never disappointed. I made reservations, we arrived on time greeted by a not so friendly hostess. She informed me that she couldn't locate our reservation and suggested we were at a wrong location. I had to pull out my phone to verify their number and showed her that I'd called the day before. She somehow found the reservation after all. We waited another 25 minutes while people were walking in with reservation, being seated. I inquired and was told they had "reserved seating". Apparently a reservation here does NOT reserve you a seat, so don't bother! A party of 6 walks in, their reservation is also not located however they're immediately seated - a PARTY OF 6! Once seated, service continued to be slow. 20 mins after being at the table, I finally was able to order a glass of wine. Will not be returning to this location as we were both disappointed.

cYINQG9CegGYLq9R-NnBVw.text: Great food and Great service!  We arrived with a large party and from the Host to the server and Manager they were fantastic!  The Food and service was impeccable!

nKOBUtGu7jkgbsYSCzkBsg.text: i tend to go here for there happy hour 5-7 mon- sun 6$ gets you a great shrimp app, carpaccio, burger ect excellant martinis and service

kHJJSUzEPH8GMHL5hb0Gfw.text: It took a little convincing, but Hottie and I decided to give Flemings a second shot.  Let me just say, it was like we dined at a totally difference restaurant!  We were pleasantly greeted by the hostess, who offered us our choice of table (despite the fact that the place was just about at capacity).   To start us off, our server recommended a new specialty cocktail with vodka, fruit juice and Prosseco which was less than 99 calories.   It was delicious! She also recommended a couple Pino Noir options for Hottie, who was very pleased.  I started off with the Flemings salad.  Really nothing special, actually the dressing was rather bland and it was served over romaine.  It really should have been served over spring mix or arugula... and adding a little cheese never hurts!  Regardless, I was perfectly happy with the complimentary warm bread and infused butter spreads to start me off.  For dinner the server recommended a "super secret" menu item for vegetarians.    I'm not sure what it was called, but it had layers of spinach, portabella, asparagus and roasted red pepper served over a very tasty red cream sauce .  On the side, I ordered the chipotle mac-n-cheese, YUM!  I don't even want to imagine the number of calories that were stuffed into that plate of cheesy goodness!  My Hottie ordered their special, a filet bone-in cooked medium rare with Flemings potatoes on the side.  This time his steak came out cooked perfectly, in fact by the end he was eating it off the bone... gross! For desert we had the chocolate lava cake.  I was a little leery, because typically these are served very small and obviously just reheated in the microwave for about 30 seconds. Not the case here.   It was the size of a softball, and just heavenly... warm chocolate oozing out of center, topped with ice cream and some kind of pistachio cookie... mmmm, still licking my lips! Okay, Flemings... Now I'm a FAN!

M_pbM1QQMb9lHnhNrXQDxw.text: The atmosphere is great, although it was an upscale restaurant it felt very relaxed and friendly. The most recent time I was there was for their happy hour in the bar and it was delicious. During happy hour they have several appetizers for $6 (very friendly on the wallet) The baked Brie served with apple slices was cooked perfectly along with the Wicked Cajun Shrimp. They also have a Fleming's prime burger with cheese and bacon for $6 which was grilled to the perfect medium as we had asked served with these colossal onion rings. We topped our meal off with the Chocolate lava cake (let your server know ahead of time if you want to order this as it does take a while) and the Creme Brulee both of which were delicious. Overall I can't wait to go back and if you are concerned about their prices as they can be quite expensive for dinner trying giving their happy hour a try they call it their "5 For $6 'Til 7pm" in the bar area.

DhZSKvXd1Hb2ANz1kdWdOg.text: We ate here for Easter dinner with a special friend while on spring break. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The food quality was very good. In fact, one member of our group ordered a petite filet, med rare. It was not cooked properly. The waiter took it back immediately and brought another. The replacement looked like a 10oz or 12oz. And they took it off the bill anyway. Dessert was great and our wine selection was perfect. Although we don't live in Scottsdale, I can recommend this location.

S8CII2FU-FM3TxI2uYCj_w.text: I asked an employee at the Arizona Golf Resort in Mesa for her favorite fancy restaurant in Scottsdale and she gave me a bum steer. Wine list is extensive (but heavy on the CA selections) and I found the ipad wine list hard to navigate. Waiter offered a tasting (quite small, not more than a couple of sips) and we requested a second and third and had to pay (a third of the cost of a glass per taste). Finally we chose a $56 bottle of Oberon after paying about 8 dollars for 2 tastes. Struck me as a bit greedy, considering the menu prices. I ordered French Onion soup -- very good altho not quite the traditional method (melted cheese over the pot) and partner had special soup of the nite -- a type of seafood, overpriced I thought at $14. Partner had the BBQ salmon which she said was "fine." I ordered the smallest fillet mignon "Newport"  -- overpriced at $36 for something the size of a bar of soap (not the deodorant size; the kind you find for free in hotels). I ordered medium-well and it was medium-rare, and I found its seasonings/salt most disagreeable -- I kept tasting it again for hours afterward (sorry to say). Steak came with their house potatoes - kind of scalloped with cream and cheese and I did not care for the dish; the waiter was kind enough to remove it and offer french fries instead (which were fine). The waiter tried to be helpful but seemed rather inexperienced and hovered around too much. And the busboys were intrusive coming to collect plates seconds after it appeared we were finished with them. Manager offered a discount card on a future meal because I said we were celebrating an anniversary -- a nice touch but not enough to make up for the less than outstanding service, unsatisfying food and overall feeling that we were in one of a chain of restaurants (which we were) which lacked the exceptional quality I have come to expect from pricey places like this one. The price way exceeded the value of the experience. I must say the bread was excellent (but I was annoyed when busboys twice tried to remove the basket when the loaf was only half-eaten).

9_rApoubJLs3xgQtLmfnlw.text: I had a great experience here. I started off with a cocktail - "Romance" it reminded me of an adios, but it was sweet and champagne based.   Had the seafood tower and it was yummy. Moved on to the main course of twin lobster tails. I wasn't thrilled with my lobster tails which seemed to taste like - steamed lobster. But my Mac n cheese, asparagus, and mashed potatoes sides were flavorful.   My only disappointment rises from when I asked the waitress which she recommended - Lobster en Fuego or Twin lobster tails. She picked the lobster tails and my friend got the Lobster en Fugeo. Her meal was to die for. I had 3 bites and I will never look at lobster tails again. I highly recommend getting the lobster en fuego. It's filled with flavor and so easy and clean to eat.   We ended with the chocolate lava cake, which was just as appeasing and appetizing as the rest of the meal had been.

OgYPhks_K76HxpXH_UIfdQ.text: Solid steakhouse.  Pretty conventional steakhouse fare - steaks, potatoes, broccoli, you get the idea...Great service.

X631RvziaU0nLDWGYfQjdg.text: A fairly well realized monument to unabashed corporate card excess, Fleming's dutifully enables the expense account crowd.         Food and service are sporadic and a poor value for anyone silly enough to be spending their own money here. My wife's tuna steak looked pretty, but was tough and fibrous. Salmon was satisfactory, but I can make better at home.   Underlings fully invested in steak grunted unanimous satisfaction at the appropriate times.   A hostess and bartender were both pleasant, charming even, however table service can be embarrassingly gushy (another reviewer mentioned ass-kissing).  This is the kind of place where bringing a pile of onion rings or a lettuce wedge to the table takes three chattering sycophants. We endured a flowery speech and unsolicited updates on lava cake, until it finally arrived half an hour after entrees were cleared. Hardly worth a wait.   The whole meal took forever, which in an attractive, upscale room is often confused with fine dining. Paul Fleming is a respected restauranteur, and rightly so based on my visits to his other kitchens. But I am not that confused.

9wfvRFlJD3JcuFfpIJN-6Q.text: Once again, Fleming's was the PERFECT place to celebrate a special event. Brian R was one of the best servers we've had anywhere! Everything was perfect, the food was amazing (main filet mignons, Fleming's Potatoes, Garlic Mashed Potatoes and Steamed Carrots) and we had the Chocolate Mousse Cake for dessert. I beg Fleming's to add this to their dessert menu permanently, it was amazing and had no nuts! Thanks again for another incredible celebration, we'll be back soon!

2eV9_eKy3oWQe0yXb8rbSw.text: Ugh.  Went for a celebration dinner with my two kids.  we've been to Flemings in Peoria a number of times and always loved it. This experience was far from that.  Service was snooty and slow.  Took forever to get anyone to pay attention.  We ordered two kids meals and I had the petite filet, which, for $36, was so petite I left starving. I presented a $25 pre-paid gift card which I had paid for through our hotel stay at the nearby doubletree.  All of sudden, our waiter mysteriously disappeared with our bill for 15 minutes.  I complained to the manager and all he offered was to "expedite" the bill for me. No apology even.  Left a sour taste in my mouth.   Even so, it wasn't about the money.  I  I would go back to the west valley location in a minute because the experience is always fantastic.  At this location, they are just snooty, full of themselves, unfriendly and self-absorbed.  Oh and BTW, while the steak certainly wasn't bad, it wasn't heavenly either.  The wine I selected was sub-par and had no business being on the wine list for a restaurant of this supposed caliber.   And the kids meals included slices of apples as a first course.  Seriously?  They couldn't come up with something more creative than that?

zRHx7woKltuF-2h0t3KUyQ.text: this was my second experince at a Flemings and i am not gonna lie... i was not really lookign forward to it... but suprisingly it was GREAT... they have a great wedge and the prime rib i had was well cooked... my only cualm with it was that our server drove me nuts... i was there with a good family friend and i felt that every 5 minutes he was asking a question not to metion he messed up the order... but whatever... i will go back for the food... eventhough it is a chain steakhouse...

y3vQVsf41C1yXFikit0qow.text: first time here.  lifelong weekly mortons eater and this place was alright.  i enjoyed the wine selection and the steak.  the service was good and nothing to complain about either.  the food was prepared quickly and correct.  kudos!

25-Y-rjBC_MskOTfFwHfpA.text: we were looking for a steakhouse on yelp and decided to go here based on the good reviews on yelp. so far, this has been the second best place we have gone to eat since we have been in Arizona (first was at Ed's yelp.com/biz/eds-phoenix...). We got the Summer prix fix with the fillet mignon and that was a pretty good deal as it comes with a appetizer and dessert. The Prime Rib was very good and that also comes with a salad and dessert choice which made it a pretty good deal. The sides we got were corn and string beans, and they were just ok. For dessert, the prix fix comes with a banana creme broulet and that was good. For the prime rib (only served on sundays), you get to choose your dessert and I chose the Chocolate Layer Cake. It takes 20 minutes to prepare since it has hot fudge inside and it was pretty decent. We would definitely come back.
